Cons: Rooms and bathrooms are quite small, room did have a bit of a musty smell, and absolutely no view. Overall, though, the "cons" were not a big deal because we weren't in the room for much more than sleeping.

review.title: Nice and safe for a quick San Fran trip.
review.reviewText:
Came to San Fran for a quick 4 day get away. The hotel is located in a safe neighborhood. Close to China Town and for a stop to catch several Hop on and Hop Off Tour Buses.
Room was nice enough, but the AC was TERRIBLY LOUD. We finally turn off the AC indicator and used the fan only. This was much quieter and provided more than enough coolness for the room.
The staff was very nice, they held our luggage after we checked out without any hesitation.
Vincent, Ashley and Terry (porter) were all extremely helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Fix the loud AC. I would highly suggest updated photos for the website; it's not as dated as the photos app

managementResponses.response: Hi Doug: Sorry for any ac leaks in your room, we will have our team check up on the room now. Thank you for your stay and hope you enjoyed your visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Close to Union Square and Chinatown.

The front desk switched our room quickly after finding out about the odor.  Complimentary  wine was nice in the afternoon.  Convenient location and overall nice stay.

review.title: Good Location, clean and friendly staff
review.reviewText: Good location near to China Town -Dragon's Gate, Union Square and public transit. Older hotel that was renovated and is clean, comfortable, with friendly and helpful staff. Complimentary wine hour was nice in the evening and a fun way to socialize with other guests.

managementResponses.response:
Dear K,

I apologize for the slow check-out process. We do try our best to have speedy check-in and check-out experiences but it seems that in this case we ran into some challenges.

Indeed the parking structure we recommend is one block away. However, I would like to point out that we do have guaranteed space and attendants will park the car for our guests once the car is inside the garage. When our building was first built, underground parking technology for larger properties was not quite there yet.

If you have any further questions about your bill, please feel free to contact me.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent URBAIN
Guest Services Manager

review.reviewText: Good location and the gentleman at concierge was very nice, and housekeeping staff we encountered were friendly.  However check out was slow, unorganized, need more staff, not knowledgeable when asking about the bill. The hotel states there is parking, but be aware it is a block away and not located at the hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much, Ashley, for the kind words in your review. We all appreciate the time you took to post it. We will continue to make updates to our rooms to better serve the expectations to today's guests. Our goal is to make sure feel well taken care of, in a place you can call "Home, away from home".

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Great staff, small rooms, worth the stay!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect and central to everything you need to get to as a tourist!  We walked just about everywhere we needed to be.  The hotel staff were very kind and accommodating. We parked just a block behind the hotel, however when we went to pick up our vehicle on the last day there were an enormous amount of people waiting there for rentals and pickups.  One of the hotel deskmen had walked up to the garage, saw us standing there after checking out and offered to hold our bags for us until we could pick up our vehicle later that day (which was the plan anyways).   I found that one small gesture from the hotel staff to be so wonderfully kind and considerate of our time.  The hotel was clean and well kept, the bathrooms are insanely small and the shower is a bit hard to maneuver in due to the tight space but nonetheless it was clean and served it's purpose.  We were able to enjoy the 5pm wine tasting which was a great way to unwind.  The TV sets in the rooms are a little outdated - while they are flat screens there were no place for a USB plug.  Also, there was only one outlet to use to charge our phone and it was on the other side of the room under the desk.  All in all the minor inconveniences were grossly insignificant to the quality of our stay and I would stay at this hotel again. Mainly due to the very nice staff!
review.negativeRemarks: More outlets, or lamps with outlets on them to charge phones and ipads.  Insanely small shower stalls in the bathrooms!
review.locationRemarks: There were a plethora of dining options within a 2min walking radius! The trolley is about half a block away, everything is a 30min walk from here!

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the quick feedback - Appreciate that you enjoyed your stay, our location and our services.

Check out our Escape deals if you ever return!

review.reviewText: The hotel is comfortable, good location. Staff is great. A little expensive.

managementResponses.response: Dear Recent Guest - Thank you for the details and feedback, our hotel staff and location appear to meet your needs while you visited San Francisco!  Your correct about our hotel water pressure, but our hotel has a great system as the hot water lines were rebuilt with a new Geo-thermal steam hot water system.  Hope we can host your stay again!

review.title: Nice hotel with good, central location
review.reviewText:
This was my first stay at Executive Hotel Vintage Court and I'd say it was a good one. The amenities are a bit old but they definitely serve their purposes well (everything works and they are comfortable). The location is pretty good but it is in the middle of a hill, especially if you are using public transport to reach there.

The lobby was exceptionally nice and cozy and if you are a person who likes to work in open public spaces you'd love to work at the lobby which also has a real fireplace. The shower was very nice and without any water pressure issues (some hotels have this issue and they say it is to preserve water).

WiFi was okay but a bit unreliable. I've had better WiFi in San Francisco.

Overall, I'd stay here again but there are definitely equivalent alternatives around the same price point, especially if you don't mind the room size.
review.positiveRemarks:
- Good bathrooms
- Spacious rooms for San Francisco standards
- Nice location
- Comfy bed
- Very nice lobby
review.negativeRemarks:
- The amenities look a bit old and dusty
- There were loud noises early in the morning, probably someone taking the trash out
- WiFi was spotty
review.locationRemarks: Lot's of stores around if you are a shopping person. Not far from any public transport and close to the touristy cable-car. Also close to bars etc.

managementResponses.response: Dear Recent Guest - Thank you for the great feedback, our hotel staff and location appear to meet your needs while you visited San Francisco!  Hope we can host your stay again!

review.reviewText:
It was a great stay in SF.
The hotel staff was very nice and kind.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review of our hotel. I apologize for the noise level. Perhaps you were on a lower floor during a very period. We believe we stay quite competitive in the downtown San Francisco market and offer a good value. Parking charges can be high, as compared to other parts of the US, but certainly not as high as other properties in Nob Hill district that charge upwards of $65+Tax per day. Whenever a guest calls us about parking and we know they have a rental, we ask said guest if they plan on visiting areas outside of San Francisco during they stay. We do this to help them realize the true cost of renting a car (car rental price + parking charge = real cost). We thank you for your business and hope San Francisco will see you again.

Kind Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Convenient to attractions

I assure you that this is not a routine experience with us. Though it does get busy on Bush Street during morning and afternoon commute, we feel lucky to not be in the middle of Union Square itself, amongst more traffic, cable car bell ringing and delivery trucks. Perhaps during your next stay with us you could request a higher floor, away from Bush Street.

Kind Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Fine for a 3 star property, close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed 2 nights in an Executive Room with a Queen bed.  The bad:  The A/C in-window unit was terribly loud, but fortunately, didn't have to use it very long.  Opening a window was actually quieter, despite the street noise.  No in-room coffee maker or coffee in the lobby.  One slow elevator. I just took the stairs after one use, since I was on a low floor.  The good: price relative to other hotels with similar proximity and quality is pretty good.  I don't plan on making this my go-to hotel, but it's a fine option when rates everywhere are high. The bathroom was more updated/renovated relative to the room. Good choice of wall tile on the accent wall.
review.negativeRemarks: Room decor is a bit lacking.  Get quieter ACs!

I used BART and went to their "office", Bus Yard, to get my bag. The Executive Hotel Vintage Court staff performed amazingly in trying to help.

review.title: Cozy hotel with good services
review.reviewText: This hotel is really good! The location is excellent. It is a block from Chinatown, about 5 blocks from Market Street and there is cable car stop down the block. The staff are also incredibly nice! I requested to change rooms (I was unlucky and my room had a bad view) and they were quick to do so. While I was out they moved my bags into another room for no additional cost. The hotel also provide shuttle service to the airport for about $15 a person. This ride saved my life! And best of all, there's free wine (good wine too)! The downside is that this hotel isn't the best for those with children. The atmosphere is more adult-like and there is no pool.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you, Todd, for your review. We appreciate seeing your kind words and do apologize for the time it took for your deposit to be reversed.

Vincent.

review.reviewText: Very attentive staff. Great hotel and location. Quaint decor and very comfortable room

review.title: Nice Hotel - Good Location - Small Room
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for 3 nights in May 2016. The room was nice, we asked for a view but were advised to stay at the back of the hotel to avoid street noise so our view was a brick wall. The room was small and the he bathroom was even smaller with not much space to open a big suitcase (we had 2 big suitcases). 
The location was good, one block from street car and about 3 blocks to Union Square. Fishermans wharf is $10 taxi ride.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your review of or property in San Francisco. We all appreciate the time you took to post a review and take all your suggestions to heart. We too wish we had bigger rooms to offer, but the age of the hotel reflects the average size of a room in San Francisco back in 1913. Certainly, during your next visit, you can make us aware that you've stayed with us before and would like to try a larger room this time.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Great central hotel close to the main centre
review.reviewText:

Would definitely stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: bigger room? no view of the other rooms from my window.

review.reviewText: Great hotel only two blocks from Union sq. Very clean, staff was very helpful. The room was wonderful. The only bathroom could be a little bigger, but our stay was great. We would recommend this hotel to anybody, especially who will stay with no car.

Hello, Gabrielle, and Thank You for your review of our hotel. Glad to hear the walk from Powell Bart station was an easy one for you...that makes you one of the few to say that :). For an easier walk, with less people traffic, I would recommend Montgomery station, especially in the middle of the day or evening. We have indeed done work on our bathroom to give them an updated and fresh look. On your next trip to us, make sure to sign up for our Reward Club Program. As a member, you will have access to any available early check-in and late check-out as no additional fee. And that's just one of the perks.

Kind Regards,

Vincent.

In regards to our credit card machine, it is something we plan on donating to a tech museum in the near future. Afterall, we have to keep a few things vintage for the sake of our name...Executive Hotel Vintage Court :). Thank you once more for your review and we hope to see you again.  Vincent.

review.title: Location worked out well for my meetings downtown
review.reviewText: Moderate rate 2.5 to 3 star kind of place.  Easy access to many of the companies I had to meet with. Internet worked great.  You may really want to consider skipping their free "breakfast".  Funny that their check out credit card equipment is from a century ago. Seriously.  They actually use the carbon paper slider thing like they aren't located in one the world's major financial and technology hubs.   It worked. Just slow and kind of weird.

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Todd, for taking the time to provide your feedback of our property. We appreciate your honest review of the hotel. I do apologize for the leak in the sink and hope it was repaired in a time that did not inconvenience you. I certainly hope to see you in our city again.  Vincent.

review.title: Good location. Friendly and helpful staff.
review.reviewText: The rooms were very clean, but we asked to switch to another room as the one we were given had the sink outside the bathroom ( outside the main room). The staff accommodated us. We then had a slow leak in our sink in the bathroom of the new room. The staff repaired the problem and even offered us to switch to yet another room if the repair didn't work. The staff was friendly and helpful in helping us navigate around the city using public transportation in San Francisco. One in particular, Donovan spent a long time with us, providing suggestions on what to do and how to get there. He was very helpful and friendly. The hotel is in good proximity to restaurants, shopping and public transportation and has free Wi-Fi and an exercise room. Though the hills in San Francisco provide plenty of exercise. They also provide a free glass of wine in the foyer daily in the evenings. Overall a nice place to stay.

managementResponses.response: Hello, Stephanie. Thank you so much for your great review of our property. The words you spoke made us all feel proud of our work. We hope to see you soon again and are ready to give you another wonderful experience. Kindest Regards,  Vincent.

review.title: Excellent Room & Service!
review.reviewText: As soon as we arrived we were greeted and given immediate attention. Soon after arriving to our room they called us to make sure we found everything okay. The room was clean and quite nice, the bed was very comfortable! Overall we had a great experience at this hotel, would definitely stay there again!

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel, Miranda. We truly appreciate the time you took to post a review. We hope to see you again soon and offer the same great service you last experienced.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Great location. Easy to find.
review.reviewText: Close to buses, trains, cable car. Spacey room. Easy to find and use as a base for all attractions. Warm and friendly staff eager to help.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your review and 5-Star rating of our hotel. We truly appreciate the time you took out of your busy schedule. It means so much to hear from guests that we offered excellent service. It's what we strive for day after day.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Perfect for business: few frills but clean + safe
review.reviewText: I used them for a business trip.  Excellent price for being close to Union Square.  The room was small but bigger than most rooms in San Francisco.  I always felt safe here even after dark.  No real frills but I would stay again for sure.  The staff was excellent - I was surprised to read other reviews complaining about the staff.  Maybe it's under new management?  They were very helpful with specific problems/requests.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms have few frills but for business travel that's fine
review.locationRemarks: 5 minute walk to Union Square.  Easy at the start of the day walking downhill, hard at the end of the day walking uphill.  That's San Francisco

managementResponses.response:
Dear T,

Thank you so very much for your positive feedback. We appreciate the time you took to write down what stood out for you. Chelsea Place can indeed be noisy, but being toward the back of the hotel can certainly make a difference. Please ask for such a room during (I hope) your next stay with us. Kindest Regards,  Vincent.

review.title: Friendly and helpful staff.  Very clean.
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff.  Nice linens and clean. Gas fireplace in the lobby, wine hour, ice water and apples daily. Good location, Pet friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly and helpful staff.  Nice linens and clean. Gas fireplace in the lobby, wine hour, ice water and apples daily. Good location, Pet friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Free coffee and tea in the mornings. The neighbor hood can be very noisy with people coming out of bars at night.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Bart transportation and the cable car to Fisherman's wharf.  Walkable to the ferry and other sites

managementResponses.response: Thank you, Scott W, for your review. I am happy to hear you share your positive stay with us. We are always making improvements to our property to keep up with the times. On your next visit, feel free to contact us after booking and specify a room towards the back of the building. Advance notice always helps. Kindest Regards.  Vincent.

review.title: Nice old hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel has been nicely updated, but has old building quirks: slow elevator, thin windows, etc. In any case, it was a comfortable, small room and despite the thin windows, it was quiet at night (my room was on the back side of the building). Very courteous and friendly staff, comfortable bed, clean and updated bathroom, great water pressure.

managementResponses.response: Thanks again for your great review and hope to see you again soon!

review.reviewText: Great hotel have stayed on several occasions! Friendly staff

managementResponses.response:
Dear Mr.Kabatsky:  In regards to your posted review, I understand your frustrations of your stay, but with our staff and myself apologized for the external noise outside. In addition our hotel team was able to meet your needs after the unfortunate noise complaint from local business street side garbage pickup, but could not do so until 9am as the hotel was fully occupied on your arrival night. However, upon the morning notification and as rooms became available, our hotel was able to immediately move your room and your guests to a quiet room.  Our hotel did not refund the first night, but you were provided over $150 in stay credits with complimentary breakfast and parking at our hotel during your stay. Upon the agreed room move and stay credits, you were happy with the new room and even personally thanked me and our staff.  From this review, as you are still were not satisfied with the stay, please contact your booking company for further review. 

Sincerely,

Bill Engelhardt, General Manager

review.title: This hotel cheats customers
review.reviewText:
I stayed at this hotel with my elderly father and teen son. We paid a premium price to be woken up in this damp smelly room by a garbage truck violently attempting to empty a large metal trash container at 3:00am about ten feet from our window, which was NOT sound proofed. We got zero sleep because we arrived at the hotel around midnight. When I tried reasoning with the hotel night manager, Ronnie, he told me that there was nothing he could do to change the room and told me to go to a different hotel. So I went back to my room to listen to more unearthly and nightmare inducing garbage truck noises without sleep. At 9am when the hotel manager, Bill, finally arrived, I informed him of our sleepless night and requested a refund, he replied "I provided you with a roof, walls and bed and the street noise happened outside the hotel, therefore we are not responsible, therefore you will not get a refund." 

Overall I would never in a million trillion years return to this hotel.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Recent Guest,

First our apologies that your experience with any smells or odors in your room were excessively bad.  Our hotel staff and team are very proactive with such complaints and you should have been offered another hotel room if such a smell or odor was unbearable. Additionally our hotel team is on site 24 hours where it is very odd that even if another room was not immediately available base on the hotel occupancy, our hotel staff should have been able move or change your room within a reasonable time frame.   I again am sorry this was not the case and you did not receive the proper service to you request.  In addition our hotel offers three room types of which our queen bed rooms do offer the vanity sink inside the guest room area versus the enclosed bathroom.  Our hotel although is older has modernized all rooms, and bathrooms to be clean and newly renovated.  Lastly, all images are reflected of the room photos to all booking partners and are detailed by bed type or room type and room rate preferences chosen at time of the booking process. 

Sincerely,

Bill Engelhardt, General Manager

review.reviewText: I never leave reviews, but I want to let you that the photos on Expedia are VERY misleading (I wish I took photos to prove it). My hotel room was tiny, didn't look like anything on the photos, the sink was inside the room (not in the bathroom), AND smelled like sewer! I had to spend a few nights at a friend's hotel room, because I couldn't handle the smell and now all my clothes smells like sewer. I'm really bad at complaining, so I mentioned the smell situation to the Front Desk, but the guy didn't react or offered another room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Recent Guest, We appreciate your business and thank you for your recent review. Our apology for the loss of the dial tone on your guest room phone during your stay.  Our hotel recently updated our phone system and upon your notification to the hotel reception desk, service was restored within the 24 hours of the notification.  Our hotel appreciates your business and if any overseas charges of such calls or text were excessive due to the outage of your phone line our hotel will be happy to review for reimbursements. 

Sincerely,

Bill Engelhardt, General Manager

review.reviewText: The room's phone was broken so there was no dial in and out of the room during my stay. I did not find out until the night before I moved out when my oversea office texted me why my phone line had always been busy.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Recent Guest, 

Thank you for the recent review and overall kudos to our staff and hotel.  Our hotel team has currently review the window ac units to insure a quiet run, yet if this was an issue our hotel team is on site 24 hours to assist and review if noise was ever unbearable. Our hotel looks forward to hosting your stay again if you return to San Francisco. 

Sincerely, 

Bill Engelhardt

review.reviewText: Very pleasant staff and clean hotel. Air conditioning in room is a window unit and noisy but functional. Overall great experience

managementResponses.response:
Hello and Thank You for posting your review. We really appreciate the 4-Star rating. I am glad to hear our location and staff knowledge worked out for you. I must apologize for the condition of the pillows. We unfortunately failed to detect those during the inspection of your room. It is something we have paid a lot more attention to in the past 2 months. 
Rooms do not have microwaves for safety and damage control reasons (spilling hot food containers on carpet), but we can heat food items for guests in our break room. We are always ready to answer questions, or assist any way we can.

Kind Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Easy access to the rest of city & wharf
review.reviewText: Centrally located--easy to get anywhere from hotel. Lobby beautiful. Staff super helpful.  It needed a microwave, though.   That would have saved me $ when it was time for lunch/dinner.   (or for left overs)  The pillows stunk like dirty hair/dirty scalp.  I bought Febreeze at Walgreens after my first night and sprayed both sides of all 3 pillows & let them dry before putting the cases back on them, which helped a lot..Somehow, the pillows really need to be cleaned or sprayed.  It kept me awake the very first night.
review.positiveRemarks: location, helpful & friendly staff, good body care products in bathroom, hair dryer in bathroom, nice to know there is an iron and ironing board.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness ( smell only) of pillows.  They LOOK clean, but stink.   Also, need a microwave.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to piers, Big Bus Tours, Alcatraz, Coit tower, buses that take you over the G G Bridge, bus that takes you to G G Park, & close to BART

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your review. It is indeed great to hear that for over 10 years we have been hosting your stays in San Francisco. We are grateful for your continued patronage and will be here for you for the next 10 years, or more, to come.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Great location, nice lobby wine tasting.
review.reviewText: We have been regular customers of this hotel for at least 10 years.  The rooms are comfortable; good quality beds and linens plus well maintained bathrooms.  Flavorful coffee in the room is a nice touch.  The heat/air conditioner is a window style, a little noisy.  The staff is friendly, especially Chris, and we always enjoy meeting other travelers at the evening wine tasting. A highlight is this opportunity for chatting in the lobby, much nicer  than being confined to our individual rooms.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, comfort and the lobby are the positive points for Vintage Court.
review.negativeRemarks: Some of the carpets and paint are visibly worn, due for a replacement.  The heat/air is noisy and dated.
review.locationRemarks: Located above Union Square, less noise and traffic.  Outdoor views are pleasant.  All major sites are walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Thank you for your review. Some of our guests share your feelings about our pillow top beds, and that would be a matter of preference. Perhaps if we could find a way to offer either type it would greatly improve sleep experience. We thank you once more and hope to see you soon again.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.reviewText: The bed was a little soft for me.  I had slight back pains. Everything else was good. Very Clean, everywhere!!!

review.title: Short stay, decent.
review.reviewText: Went for business, it was a close walk to everything. First time in San Francisco, loved the area! Enjoyed wine hour.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Susan.

Thank you for your 4-Star rating of our property. I'm glad to hear you found your room to be satisfactory and our got great recommendations from our staff. We are working on our climate control in rooms and will hopefully earn a 5-star rating during your next stay.

Kindest Regards,

Vincent.

review.title: Nice hotel for a short stay
review.reviewText: This was a nice place for just a short stay. Even though it is an older building, it was nice enough, clean, and the staff was very friendly. They were more than willing to make recommendations to us when we asked for dining suggestions, having never been in San Francisco before. The complementary wine hour each evening in the lobby is a nice touch!
review.positiveRemarks: I appreciated a nice staircase into the lobby available instead of just an old, bare stairwell that is so often the only alternative to the elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: The climate control in the room was terrible- way too hot! The continental breakfast was way overpriced for what little was available.
review.locationRemarks: We walked everywhere we went, including the pier to Alcatraz, the cable car ride, and Fisherman's Wharf. Lots of walking, but do-able.

review.title: Get what you pay for!
review.reviewText:
This is a nice 3-star hotel. 
Location is great. I worked downtown so it was very convenient.
Price is one of the best you can get in this area.
Rooms are nice for this price range. Good bed and clean. Maybe a bit old but I don't care.
Hotel staff was nice. Nothing to complain about.

I will recommend the Vintage Court for a business trip. Not for a honeymoon.
You get bet what you pay for: a nice cheap room in downtown.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms would need a bit more light and bigger TV.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect especially if you are on a business trip and have to work downtown.

review.title: Great location, helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Overall it is nice. Although there is a strange smell in the lobby and rooms. Bathroom is too small and not much comfortable.
 Lobby area is very nice and cozy. Location is just perfect.
review.negativeRemarks: The smell in the hotel that is probably from cleaning items.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to Union Square with shopping and lot's of eating places.

review.title: Close to everything in sfo
review.reviewText: Very good. Highly recommended for downtown sfo. Convenient walking distances to everything. Not noisy in room. Good sleep. Did skip breakfast as much more choices all around so cannot comment on food in premises. Bath tub drains slowly, got the sunshine treatment as no action taken after complain. You will be standing in one inch of water as you shower. It is possibly due to old and small plumbing which would be expensive to replace.

review.title: Location & room fine, ambient noise a little much
review.reviewText:
Stayed just one night arriving after dinner and departed early, so I was in the room <12 hours in total.  For this, it was fine. For a week long stay, not sure how I'd feel.  The building is a bit old, the floors a bit creaky and walls a bit thin.  My neighbor above me that woke up early and showered, and he might as well have been showering in my bathroom with the door open, b/c it was quite loud.  Moreover, I could hear every footstep or thump of anything above me.  The outside noise wasn't too bad, as my room did not face the street, but it is San Francisco, and there are plenty of sirens, which I heard clearly and loudly on occasion.  

While the ambient noise was a bit more than desirable, it didn't ruin my stay, and I felt there was a good value based on the rate & what the hotel offered.  I could have chosen to spend a lot more to stay somewhere more upscale in a more modern building.
review.positiveRemarks: Very close Union Square, plenty of restaurants nearby and 10 minute walk to financial district
review.negativeRemarks: Better soundproofing, but suppose this would entail a lot of work

review.title: Nice and clean hotel right in the city center
review.reviewText:
this hotel is a gem in a perfect location: one step below from Nob hill and two blocks away from union square. 
If you are looking for a quite and clean place for your stay in SFO - this is the place to be!
review.positiveRemarks: Safe area and right on the best spot to be in SFO. Room is very clean, staff is friendly. The Internet was great

review.title: its what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Close to tram pick up. Hills are steep. Tell them to not give the room on the corner - the noise is from the side straight for locals parking. Rooms are small and it has a basic breakfast. Coffee was luke warm on both mornings. Not much variety.

review.title: Great location, charming hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is right on the cable car line. We only had to walk to the end of the block to access it. It's also steps away from restaurants and shops at Union Square.

The hotel rooms look recently renovated and are clean and cozy. The staff is friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, cleanliness, friendly staff, cozy room

managementResponses.response: Thannks for the points of our location, we are close to the cable car, china town and union square.  Hence it makes visiting San Francisco a easy trip.  Glad you found our updated baths attractive and room supportive to your needs.  Hope to see you again soon!

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: The best part of this hotel is the location. But the hotel itself is a little older. But I guess that's what puts 'Vintage' in the name. The heating wasn't working in our room but they did give us a small fan heater. Our room was also close to the street going uphill right outside our window, so we could hear people talking at midnight. The bathroom was nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. If you can get over a few speed bumps, which we did, the location totally makes up for it.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the great feedback, hope to see you again!

review.reviewText:
Hotel location is almost Nob hill.
When I was tired I felt hard to walk up the hill.
But lobby and room everything clean and beautiful
I want to stay this hotel again!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the feedback on the stay, appears you found our hotel in a great location to meet your needs.  Have a safe holiday and happy new year too.

review.title: Location, location
review.reviewText: The location is walking distance to everything in the city and surrounded with great places to eat.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for the great post.  Glad you found our hotels location and service fit your needs. Hope to host your stay again when you return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great  location
review.reviewText: 5 minutes  walk to  Chinatown and 15 minutes  walk  to  Union  Square,  AWESOME

review.title: Good location,  could use some investment.
review.reviewText:
Parking wasn't clear either from the website or even calling them. They ended up directing me to the wrong garage that was 2 times the cost. 
The smell there in the lobby and hotel was a little over powering. Also the tabs,  while flat screens,  are pretty trashy.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the great review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable.  Hope we can host your stay in the future too!

review.title: Really nice hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was really very comfortable and very clean. The location was great being a few blocks from Downtown. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times.

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the 5 star review!

review.reviewText: aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the great review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears our hotel met your needs.  Being an older hotel with wine boutique venue we have hosted guests for over 100 years and the charm and character trump the modernism.  As you stated great location, super staff and nice clean rooms made your stay great!  

Hope we can host your stay again too.  

Best regards, Bill

review.title: Great location, nice staff, and nice rooms.
review.reviewText: Great location, nice staff, and nice rooms. Really appreciated the location and the price. It's no frills but still very nice and clean.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping, check out the Beanstalk Cafe!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the notes and good review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and our apologies about the stain on a toss blanket. Also, for full length mirrors and closet lights are both great updates which will be done asap.  Thanks for the tip. Happy travels and glad our hotel could host you while you visited San Francisco

review.title: Love th evening wine tasting, made lots of friends
review.reviewText: Room could use a large mirror and a light in th closet.  Could also wash th brown top blankets, stains noted.  Otherwise, very comfortable. Love the bedding and mattresses.
review.negativeRemarks: As mentioned, mirrors, light in closet.
review.locationRemarks: Union square

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears you had a good time with our wine reception.  We will review any AC noise from your room too.  Lastly, although our rooms are cozy its decor is nice clean and works well with our location to the downtown area.  Hope we can host your stay again as we are one few Pet Friendly rooms that have dedicated rooms for our VIP's "very important pets".  Best regards, Bill

review.title: good location for walking and doing things downtow
review.reviewText:
close to lots of things to do downtown. nice room - a bit small. 
Lobby wine happy hour 5 - 6 pm was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms so small and heating/air conditioner too noisy

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and although you may not find all of our hotel modern, its a clean hotel in a great location with lots of added values.  

Thanks again!

review.title: Old hotel ...but still nice
review.reviewText: The room we booked via expedia was horrible we had to pay more to upegrade...its a old hotel but still have a nice warm stuff.and its close to union square.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the recent review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears our hotel met your needs .Hope we can host your stay again too.  

Best regards, Bill

review.reviewText: We had a great time, your staff was very helpful and informative.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the recent review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears our hotel met your needs as we will add a mirror to our closets this winter.  Glad you found our location good and overall a great value. 

Best regards, Bill

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great location, near union square, along the trolley line. It was a little noisy friday night, but overal a great value.
review.positiveRemarks: the staff was very friendly and helpful. i loved the bar next door.
review.negativeRemarks: We needed a mirror in the room. better sound proofing in the windows.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the updates great review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears you had a good time with our wine reception and found our location easy access to city attractions.  Sorry about any hot water issues, our team replaced a value so this issue is no more now too. 

Hope we can host your stay again as our guest services team is ready to be of service. 

Best regards, Bill

review.title: Great Staff and guests
review.reviewText: The wine hour was awesome!  Got to meet a lot of guests from all over.  The check-in guy was very nice.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was great...location wasn't too bad either.
review.negativeRemarks: It took the water a LONG time to get warm.
review.locationRemarks: You can walk to many places.  Need to ride back as it's on a hill.

managementResponses.response:
Thanks for the awesome review! Our hotel and staff are here to make your stay in San Francisco enjoyable and appears you enjoyed our wine reception along with our attentive staff.    Additionally you found our location to be super and a nice clean room too.  Hope we can host your stay again in the future.

 Best regards, Bill

review.title: Great hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Started off with excellent service, a little evening wine mixer by the fire and then a nice room.  Staff went out of their way to make the experience perfect!   Will stay here every time we go to SF.   1/2 block from the trolley, quick walk to union square and tons of great restaurants and bars nearby.   Highly recommended!

managementResponses.response: Thanks for the good feedback! Hope we can host your stay if ever back in San Francisco.  Our hotel upgraded the AC unit as that is now fixed too. Great to know you liked our staff, rooms and services too.

review.title: Boutique with Flair
review.reviewText: As a corporate traveler, I tend to stay with the big hotels chains. Hotel Vintage Court was a pleasant change for me. The old-world atmosphere and cheerful staff made the stay very enjoyable. The wine tasting in the lobby was a highlight for me; however, the room was very comfortable and clean as well. While in need of some renovation, nothing was unacceptable or lacking in function. Old isn't necessarily bad, and in this case it was charming. I liked the location for sightseeing, but it was a bit of a walk to my business location at the Embarcadero. I would definitely put it in my "to consider" category when back in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: A/C upgrade from window to wall unit
review.locationRemarks: China Town and lots of good restaurants. Cable cars one street away.

review.reviewText: Traveled for work. Hotel is close proximity to work destination.
review.locationRemarks: Close to attractions

review.title: would return if they got rid of the carpet
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located and the staff was great. We enjoyed the free wine in the lobby. Wouldn't return due to what seemed to me old smelly carpet that need to be replaced with hate surface flooring.

review.title: Fetid odor almost spoiled stay
review.reviewText: I prepaid a room in this well-located hotel because it was $100 cheaper per night during high season than my first choice, which would have been one of the Orchard Hotels down the block. The musky odor was so overpowering that we had to go to Macy's and purchase cologne to spray around the room daily. Even so, our clothes absorbed it, and it followed us home to Florida. The hotel was full, or I would have requested a room change. I might even have changed hotels, had I not prepaid. On the plus side, staff were friendly and available.
review.negativeRemarks: Get rid of that smell! Even if it means renovation, it's not fair to subject guests to that. Would the owners want to sleep there?
review.locationRemarks: Get a cable car pass and take advantage of the stops that are very convenient. Visit the cable car museum, Chinatown.

review.reviewText: Older building, so my room had a musty smell to it.  Not overpowering just there.  Bed was clean and comfortable.  Bathroom was updated and very clean.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are small, but well thought out.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car less then a block away.  China town entrance a block away.  Great Location

managementResponses.response: Thank You! We're happy you enjoyed your stay and the restaurant. We hope to have you as our guest again sometime in the future.

review.title: Great hotel w easy access
review.reviewText:
We stayed three nights and found it very friendly and accessible to shopping, resturants and transportation . 
The restaurant is out of this world great. Pricey but worth every cent.

managementResponses.response: Thank You! We appreciate your feedback and are glad you had a great stay and enjoyed the  friendly staff and our wine hour. We hope you have the chance to visit us again in the future,  Warmest Regards

review.reviewText: It was such a nice hotel and the staff were extremely friendly. The free wine tasting in the afternoon was exceptional. The lounge area was really comfortable.

review.title: Some good, some bad
review.reviewText: VERY small bathroom and even smaller shower.  Super comfy bed, small TV, carpet coming up in some areas, very friendly and helpful staff, good location, only one small slow elevator.  This place has a lot of good points and a lot of issues.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger showers, carpet replacement, cheaper parking

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Loved the hotels wine happy hour and the staff was very helpful! The room was nice and clean and we liked the sink located outside the bathroom.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText:
Staff was nice, room clean, but there was a bad smell in the room all the time probably related to the carpet. 
Close to downtown , overall ok but I wouldn't likely return

review.title: near union square
review.reviewText: location is great near the union square , hotel staff are nice and helpful but the hotel itself is old and not clean
review.negativeRemarks: cleaniness
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.reviewText: Not to bad hotel, bit very bad smell in the whole hotel and specially in room

Great location, good restaurants and coffee places around, easy walk to downtown.
Shower is small but ok. Rooms smell musty, open the windows and start the fan, and it will be gone by the time you go to sleep.

review.title: Our 7th Stay at this Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText:
We love staying at the Vintage Court and have just returned from our 7th stay.

The staff our friendly and helpful and the hotel is just a short walk away from Union Square. The Cable Car is just at the end of the block.

The rooms are always immaculate and are currently being refurbished. Our rooms had a lovely new bathroom.

We look forward to our next stay.
review.negativeRemarks: We can find no fault with this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is just a short walk from all the shops and restaurants in Union Square and China Town is just a few blocks away.

review.title: Great location, clean and tidy room
review.reviewText: The hotel was easy to find, clean and tidy the only problem is the shower.  The shower is small and I had read those reviews but as for only one night I will take a chance.  The shower was newly renovated and looked great but the water hit the wall and there was no way to point it directly down - the shower head was just too big for the space.  This meant that you were either drowning, as you had to stand directly in front of the water or you were having to splash yourself with the water to get wet.  It was a lovely hotel however if I was going to be there for a few days this would have driven me nuts.
review.positiveRemarks: the room was large and very comfortable, the room was clean
review.negativeRemarks: the shower is so small that either you are drowning or you need to find a way of splashing yourself to get wet. A very disappointing experience.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: A good hotel to stay overnight. I wouldn't stay much longer. The room had two queen beds and only one chair. The bathroom was very small. It was clean and looked like it was recently remodeled. Good for a short stay.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping in the area of Union Square, all kinds of tourist attractions.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the cable train
review.reviewText:
Jump the breakfast......
Plaisant situation
Nice employees
Clean room
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Every thing is closeby

review.title: Great location-staff very nice however...
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately the smell of urine was strong outside of front door. Inside smelled like animals. Had to buy frebreeze for room.
Priced double due to convention. Was charged $2.00 for a cup for  what we thought was complimentary coffee in lounge.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel needs refreshing
review.locationRemarks: Major shopping, Chinatown nearby.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Great location I was pleased that there was a fridge the washroom and shower little to small but overal we have a great time.
Could use more outlets to charge all my Gear.
Room service vas Excellent fresh Towels everyday. Toilet paper quality could be better not exactly Charmin quality but I understand that hotel have a budget too 
Rather have the fridge than good toilet paper lol.

review.title: Nice Hotel well located
review.reviewText: Location OK to walk to different points of interest, with cable car nearby. Room size OK, good bed and small fridge. Caf Roxanne across the street good for breakfast and even dinner.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, helpful staff, quiet room, free wifi. Free wine hour
review.negativeRemarks: Faster elevator, better wifi
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market St Visitor center, to cable car and within 30 minute walk to several point of interest including little Italy, Fisherman's Wharf,...

review.title: Great location, close to cable car & Union Square
review.reviewText: Was our first time to SF.  Hotel has a great location to many of the tourist attractions.  Highly recommend, would definitely stay again.  The staff was friendly & helpful, willing to answer any questions about the area.  The hotel is walking distance from the BART Station (great way to get to & from the airport).  It is close to Union Square & tons of shopping.  The cable car stop is half a block away & we walked from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf, Ghiradelli Square etc.  We went to a game at AT&T Park & was easily able to get transit to the stadium & back.  Overall was a great trip.  The hotel is older but very quaint & clean & nicely decorated.  The room was on the small side but perfect for a couple.  Would not hesitate to book again!
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, was very quaint.  Room wasn't huge, but good for a couple & we weren't spending a whole lot of time there.
review.negativeRemarks: The TV reception was bad, not a huge deal as we weren't using it much.  However for someone that wanted to watch regularly it was not great.
review.locationRemarks: Close to BART stn & other transit.  Cable car stop half a block away, close to Union Square & easily walkable to Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Nothing executive about this hotel
review.reviewText: Front desk was nice but that is it terrible would not recommend to worse enemy!

review.title: Great hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: My friends and I stayed at this hotel for Labor Day Weekend. The room was great, and the hotel location is perfect, just a block or two from Union Square and next to Chinatown!

review.title: would definitely recommend.
review.reviewText: Cordial, engaging and helpful staff.  Room was quite nice, especially for price.  Did not disappoint and would definitely stay again.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect.

review.title: Good alternative to Union Square
review.reviewText: Convenient and very pleasant hotel just up the hill from Union Square. Clean comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  Facilities are limited and some common areas are less well-tended.  But overall a solid choice, depending on the pricing available and if it's business travel.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Good location on the cable car line and just up from Union Square. Helpful staff. Room small but had everything we needed.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: This was one of the nicer places I stayed on my trip. For the most part, I wasn't really lingering in the area the hotel is in, but going out and leaving the area more or less immediately. There was a rather large number of homeless people along bush street, most of whom were perfectly harmless. Short walk to china town, union square and the cable cars.

review.title: Great location Helpful staff
review.reviewText: First trip to SanFran would stay here again in a heartbeat. Vintage but brought up to 21st century.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Close to trolley line to attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: no suggestions here
review.locationRemarks: Everything you want is close by via walking trolley or BART

review.reviewText: We liked the hotel, the services, the staff and the happy hour with the exquisite wines.  We did not have the opportunity to go to the restaurant, it was closed the 2 nights we spent at the hotel.  Next time we hope can enjoy their food.

review.title: Location, good location
review.reviewText: Apart from the location and the friendless of the staff, the room was too small, bed too hard, bathroom too small and the bath is a joke, noisy air conditioner but without that the room is too stuffy, but the location is excellent, about 60 metres to cable car and two blocks to Union Square.
Nice hotel. Clean. Comfortable. No frills, but everything needed for either business or pleasure.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable Bed. Nice towels. Nice size - with chair and desk.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator slow.
review.locationRemarks: Pretty good location. Close to Union Square. Bit of a walk up the hill for those out of shape.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to Union Square and cable car.
review.reviewText:
Hotel is located 2 blocks from Chinatown and 3 blocks from Union Square. Half a block from cable car stop. A nice location to almost everything! Hotel has a wine tasting everyday from 5 to 6 and the wine is very good. The staff at this hotel is excellent and will go over board to make sure that your stay is a nice one.
        Highly recommend that you stay here.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location! Wine tasting at 5 o'clock every day. The staff here go out of their way to make sure that your stay is a good one.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe get the air conditioner a little bit less noisy.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is right by the Hotel

review.title: Cute and petite hotel
review.reviewText: It is a small hotel with a nice lobby as you enter.  check in was fast and easy.  The rooms were a bit small but overall it is a good hotel to stay at during your trip to san Francisco.

review.title: great location but very small room
review.reviewText: if you want "location" you will need to sacrifice a bit of comfort here as the rooms are very small - the staff was friendly and knowledgeable
Hotel location is quiet handy but the rooms needed good upgrade. Also our room was towards street frontage and it was difficult to sleep at night with all street noise and lights.
Room was small and not very clean; bed was rock hard and uncomfortable; "self-parking" is a block away and $50 per night, not $30 as stated on the website.

review.title: Nice hotel close to china town.
review.reviewText:
Nice small hotel prime location. Close to evry place and great public transportation.
3 block a way from all the shops.
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi service in the room was very bad. Needs to improve.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Great location. If you take The BART from SFO airport to Powell Station is just $8... But i recommend taking a taxi from The Station to The hotel, because The hill up to The hotel gets tough!!
Helpful and welcoming staff.

review.title: Best part of the stay is the staff.
review.reviewText: The location is great - right in the heart of things to do downtown.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff is friendly and helpful.  The concierge was the best we have encountered in our travels.
review.negativeRemarks: The room is a little small but quite comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is half a block away and transit is within walking distance.

review.title: Nice hotel next to Chinatown
review.reviewText: Comfortable accomodations, would skip breakfast there unless you are in a bind! Walking distance to chinatown and union square.
The hotel was conveniently located.  It has been updated recently. Great bed!
review.negativeRemarks: Couldn't get hot water in the shower on one night.
review.locationRemarks: Right near Powell Cable Car line, Union Square, theater district.

review.reviewText: If you  don't mind paying $300+ for a room that has dirty coffee cups and you need to  keep asking for everything this is the place.

review.title: Small bath
review.reviewText: We paid for a delux room and got a small room with an even smaller bathroom with a shower head that did not move. We complained and only on the second night we were upgraded. Bath still small but better. Thumbs up for the upgrade but our stay had been ruined.

review.title: great location near to union square
review.reviewText: We were on the 8th floor very quiet room was great staff very helpfull
review.locationRemarks:
union square and shopping 
china town

review.title: Great safe location to restaurants and sites.
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our trip immensely.  The area restaurants were excellent and the people very friendly. The hotel staff were very helpful and nice. Loved the free wine tastings from 5-6 every day. The hotel was very clean!!!!

review.title: Nice, affordable hotel in downtown San Fransisco
review.reviewText: Good location within walking distance to many attractions and public transportation. Older hotel with vintage style rooms, but very friendly staff and clean rooms. Complimentary wine tasting from 5-6 on Weekends!

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location to everything you would want to see as a tourist in San Francisco. Right next to the cable car also. The hotel is a bit older but is air conditioned. There is an old smell in the room but if you keep the window open or air conditioner on it is not very strong. There is one elevator but we never had to wait very long. Overall it was a good place to stay for the price you pay. We were on the 8th floor and could not hear any noise from the streets.

review.title: Great Location, Great Vibe
review.reviewText: I have stayed at many dodgy hotels in San Francisco because it's always so hard to tell if a reasonably priced hotel is going to be nice and safe in SF. However, my experience at Executive Hotel Vintage Court was great and I would definitely stay here again! I loved the location, it's close to Union Square and was on a street that felt safe. It's close to a variety of great restaurants, bars, shopping, and transportation. Definitely worth the price!
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the vintage vibe - it felt like we were staying in a nice B&B rather than a massive hotel. It was also clean and felt safe.
review.negativeRemarks: The only thing I would have liked to see was an iron and coffee maker in the room - two things I always need (especially when travelling).
review.locationRemarks: SO many activities around the area - trolly ride, shopping, restaurants, bars. Just walking around the area is fun.

review.title: Close to Union square and to San Francisco downtow
review.reviewText: The best part of this Hotel is that is close to everything with in a walking distance or a short taxicab, Location is great the problem is an old hotel and the mist a few thing in the remodelation is not exactly my kind of hotel, although personal was good and atent.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and Mall

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to everything!!! Very very nice staff! Will stay again!

review.title: nice hotel
review.reviewText: this was a nice hotel for the price. clean room and friendly staff. we were able to walk around with no problem of getting lost, the cable car passes right by the hotel so you have access to them to get to other places. i would stay here again.

review.title: We loved it!
review.reviewText: We spent 4 nights at Executive Hotel Vintage Court and were very pleased with our choice. The staff was very helpful and we were steps away from the cable cars, restaurants and shopping. They even serve complimentary wine between 5 and 6 where you can get to meet fellow travellers. The room was clean and comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Great little breakfast place at the corner. Access to transit is very near.

review.title: Great location. Close to the cable cars.
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Very nice and helpful staff. Great location, in the center of everything.

review.title: Nice and close to everything
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 4 nights. When I walked into the room I was pleasantly surprised! It looked better than the photos! We stayed on the 8th floor and there was actually a decent view! Room was clean except for a white crusty stain on the blanket that worried me, I just didn't use the blanket no big deal! The bed was comfy. The bathroom was small and could use more counter space. But it was very nicely updated. The staff was always friendly and helpful! I would definitely stay here again. Great deal for the price. Also it is close to the BART and lots of shopping! Had an awesome stay!
I was visiting relatives. I needed a hotel within close proximity of them
review.negativeRemarks: Wi fi-- kept going in and out
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Union Square

review.title: Great value and location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a nice area, close to Union Square and has several great amenities, including free coffee in the morning, free wine in the afternoon and free internet service.  The deal I got was a great value for the price I paid. It is, however, on a street that requires a fairly steep climb.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel had window air conditioners, which were quite loud. Overall, there was a lot of noise, both coming from inside the hotel and the street.
review.locationRemarks: A few block from Union Square and Chinatown, and  a short walk to Market Street. Several food choices.

review.title: Small, but nice and convenient.
review.reviewText: The room was small but clean, with a very comfy bed. Perfect for a couple or person traveling alone to stay. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, available 24/7 for whatever you may need. Also within walking distance of the BART station, many restaurants and bars, with the staff willing to help you with arranging travel if needed.

review.title: Nice hotel near everything
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed here for a conference I was attending at Moscone Center.  The room we stayed in was very nice, clean and updated bathroom (although the bathroom was small). It was small, but comfortable. The hotel was within walking distance (as long as you are willing to walk a mile or so) to Moscone Center, Union Square, Chinatown, Little Italy, and fisherman's warf.  I would stay here again  and would recommend it to others.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, affordable and good location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, easy to walk almost everywhere in San Francisco.

review.reviewText: Great old hotel but rooms are smaller if you have a bunch of luggage.

review.title: Great Hotelclose to everything.
review.reviewText: Our stay was fantastic!! Everything is within walking distance of the hotel.  At 5pm we enjoyed free wine and mingled with other guests. The beds were awesome! So comfy!! We had two rooms and we all would come back again! Thank you!!
review.negativeRemarks: Room service and would be nice if the dinning room was opened on Sundays and Mondays.
review.locationRemarks: We were in walking distance of Chinatown and we caught the cable car at the light.  Great restaurants within minutes of the hotel.

review.title: Pretty nice staff, below average accomedations
review.reviewText:
North of Union square (if you want to shop high end). Next to cable cars which is nice. Pretty average accomedations. Friendly staff except for one unfriendly girl at front desk. Great restaurant next door that's connected. Our toilet was broken for half the trip, but they gave me an $80 break which seemed fair (came to fix it quickly each time). Parking is ridiculous. Spent $135 for four nights to park in a garage a block over. 
Overall a good experience but we would probably stay near Fisherman's wharf if we returned. 
Make sure you see the redwoods!!

review.title: Adequate hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I booked using the discounted service which does not disclose hotel until after booking and full payment. I was willing to take the 'risk' on a 'blind' hotel booking because of guaranteed criteria listed. I will not do this again. It was disappointing that having been guaranteed a room that would sleep 3 adults, we were given one with just two full size beds and towels etc. for two people only. We were prepared for the fact that two of us might need to share a queen bed, but not a full size. None of us is large or overweight but we did not have enough room to sleep comfortably and we had to put up with all night music from the foyer below us. We reported this on the first night. The female receptionist we spoke to on Sunday morning seemed unconcerned and  told us it should not be on at night. No concern was shown or apology given. The same problem happened the next night so we did not sleep well! The room was clean and linens were fresh but generally the hotel needs a good clean. The banister rail on the stairs between the ground and second floor is sticky and black with grime! In contrast to the reception staff member, the guest services man was very helpful and courteous. The cost of the room was not cheap and I do not consider it was good value for money or lived up to expectations based on criteria published by Expedia. I travel a lot and very rarely am dissatisfied or find a need to complain. I am not looking for luxury. Below Expedia's normal standards
review.positiveRemarks: Not a great deal unfortunately! It was centrally located providing good access to the city.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, customer relations of some staff members and value for money
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located with access to much the city has to offer

review.reviewText:
We arrived in San Francisco around 9am, hours before check-in, after travelling by sleeper train down the west coast. The staff were helpful, looking after our luggage for a few hours and letting us check in a couple of hours early so we could freshen up.

The location was excellent, just a block or two from Union Square. We were able to walk to many destinations and were also near lots of buses, cable cars etc. The room was comfortable enough and clean. One nice touch was a dispenser of ice water in the lobby. There was also complementary wine every evening between 5 and 6, which we made use of once.

On the other hand, the en suite bathroom had definitely seen better days. It was functional and clean, but needed freshening up and a lick of paint. It could also have done with a proper bathroom bin (ie with a lid) which I think women in particular appreciate. The bathroom window also needed replacing - it had a big crack in it which had been taped up. It didn't bother us too much, but I expect more for a hotel of this price.

review.title: nice stuff, good place and pretty good.
review.reviewText: I love it so much and will choose it again when I visit San Francisco next time.

review.title: Excellent for its price
review.reviewText:
- Nicely located
- Friendly staff 
- Rooms are small but clean 

@ $166 a night including taxes within walking distance of Union Square, I was skeptical; but it proved to be a great find. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to all my budget friendly friends.
The hotel is very convenient to a lot of attractions as well as the shopping center of town.the cleanliness was very good.would stay here any time i am in San Francisco.

review.title: Bed bugs?
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 2 nights, staff was very kind and efficient. Location just north of Union Square is great, with a cable car stop on the corner. Free wine every evening was a nice touch. 

Room condition was not good. Baseboards were filthy and dusty. My girlfriend woke with 2 bites on her back. I don't know if they were bedbugs, but she was definitely bitten. Antiquated environmental controls--in-window A/C unit, separate heater on the floor that required a weird combo of switches to operate. 

Stayed here because of an Expedia deal but we won't be back.
Hotel is clean. Bed is comfortable. Housekeeping did a good job cleaning the room. Restaurant/bar downstairs is very convenient. Staff are professional, accommodating and very helpful.

Hotel room was clean. Staff friendly and helpful about things to do in the area. They allowed us to drop off our bags way before check in.  Only complaint was the extremely loud noise at 6 am. Either garbage or laundry. Overall good hotel for the money.

review.title: Nice European style hotel
review.reviewText: Comfortable but cozy size hotel walking distance close to Union Square, Chinatown, convention center

review.title: Very cool hotel.
review.reviewText: I loved this place.  Location was perfect, had a nice room, and who doesn't like free wine every night?  There was good places to eat within walking distance that were inexpensive for the area.  Cable cars, trolleys, even the BART were all a short walk away.  I would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that it was an old building.  They've been putting a lot of work into it but keeping the vintage feel.
review.negativeRemarks: Longer free wine happy hour haha!  No I thought it was great, wouldn't change a thing.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, China Town, Nob Hill, everything is a short walk away.  There was some really good places to eat and have a drink across the street too.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: We have stayed here many times and it is the most bang for your buck in SF. If you are looking for a huge room this place is not for you. Small, cozy and every room has a winery theme. I have always had a nice room with a window seat but I have seen smaller rooms that I am glad I did not get. Very clean which is for me very important.
review.positiveRemarks: Complimentary wine in the evening. Very centrally located so we walked everywhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee service in the lobby for free. I don't like the little coffee pots in the room. Had to go out to get coffee.
review.locationRemarks: Union square, Chinatown ,northbeach,....

review.title: Wouldn't stay again
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel for two nights during our stay in SF. We found the location to be convenient and the staff particularly Chris to be very helpful. The problem that we had however is that the hotel is actually a pet friendly hotel, something we were not aware of upon booking. Upon checking in to our room on the third floor we noticed a strong dog smell in the corridor as well as in our room. Later in the evening after returning from dinner the smell was overwhelming so we asked if we could transfer to another room. Chris at the hotel reception was both helpful and friendly and we transferred that night. Apparently floors 2 and 3 are pet friendly while floor 5 where we moved wasnt. The room we moved to was comfortable however we could both still smell animals had been in the room. We didn't ask to move again because it seems that the entire hotel has an unpleasant odor. Despite the odor the hotel was pleasant however due to the issue I outlined above we would not stay here again and unless you yourself have pets that you wish to accommodate at this hotel I suggest you stay elsewhere.

review.title: Disappointed.
review.reviewText:
Sadly I have to confirm some of the other posted reviews. Of biggest concern was the musty smell in the rooms. Nothing could seem to get rid of it. Otherwise the standard queen room was very small, uncomfortable and we were overlooking a dark alley. The parking was also a con, a hefty 33-45$ per night. 

Pros were daily wine at 5pm, somewhat helpful staff, and location

review.title: Great Location-HORRIBLE INTERNET
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights/5 days and we pretty much did not have internet for the entire length of our stay. Called down to the lobby which directed us to a tech support line to call. By day 3 the gentlemen on the other end of the line said it was on the hotel's end and there was nothing else he can do. (Have a Brand new computer-which would connect to their hotel router -just NO INTERNET). After going to the lobby a couple times they did offer to switch our room, which was appreciated, however we chose to just stay put because our laptop wouldn't work anywhere in their building except one recommended corner of the lobby.  The crux of the matter was we needed it for business. Otherwise our room was nice and clean. They are are in a great location, and the evening wine service was a plus as well. FYI 2 side notes- Our room was alley side-garbage collection is VERY loud and very early every morning. And secondly we discovered this AMAZING cafe Mo'z Cafe just south of Union Square off of 5th st. We would highly recommend it, great quality without the tourist $$.
review.positiveRemarks: Location! Very easy to get to food, shipping & transportation. Felt safe but without the overt hustle and bustle of being in the heart of Union Square
review.negativeRemarks: Internet. And although staff was friendly they don't come across as sincere.
review.locationRemarks: Eat at Mo'z Cafe just south of Union Square off of 5th st. We would highly recommend it, great quality and cost. Hotel is Close to Cable cars too!

review.reviewText: Great hotel for the price and location. Very comfortable.

review.title: Nice, affordable hotel, very pleasant staff
review.reviewText: Clean room, helpful staff and great location. Room was pretty small but so was the price. Thanks

review.title: Easy access to many sites yet in business district
review.reviewText: The location is good. My room was very small and looked directly across to the windows of stairway. Staff excellent. Bathroom clean

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: First impression of the lobby was that the hotel needed to be updated, however, our room was recently updated.  Our room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable. We were towards the back on the 6th floor and it was so quiet.  The wine tasting each night was excellent. Nice hotel for being in the heart of a city.

Staff was really nice and helpful but big down side that i have to carry my heavy stroller with the baby up and down the stairs that was very tiering some staff looked at me and didnt even bother to help but some did help. Over all was ok didnt really like the set up in the room bathroom and sink room separate .

review.title: First time in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had a great stay. Staff were very helpful, and the maintenance staff very good. The room was all I need since I was only there to sleep. The wine hour was something nice to come back to. Loved the city, and people here. I will definetly come back to this hotel. If there was a negative to my stay it was that there were renovating the rooms on my floor.

review.title: update
review.reviewText: Some rooms need new wallpaper and carpet.  Corners are a little dirty and areas behind furniture.  Beds are extremely comfortable and linens are luxurious. Bathrooms are well maintained.
review.positiveRemarks: Meeting interesting travelers at the evening wine tasting.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is walking distance.  Good neighborhood.

review.title: Great location, staff was very helpful  and nice.
Home away from home
review.reviewText: I stayed at the hotel for 6 days 5 nights. The location was within walking distance to great restaurants, shopping, cable cars, and chinatown. I was able to go inside if two rooms and my only complaints would be that housekeeping needs to do a more thorough job attending to details such as dusting and cleaning the carpet on a regular basis.  Management should also look into doing minor up keep to maintain the premises.  The hotel staff was very helpful,  especially the manager Mr. Urbain. He was quite accommodating and he helped to make my first visit to San Francisco all the more special. Rachel was awesome as well. The rest of the staffed lacked nothing when it came to general customer service. Mornings were a littke noisy outside of the hotel due to street cleaning, garbage trucks, etc  but I would still stay there again.
Priced right, clean and comfortable. Great staff and close to everything .
review.positiveRemarks: Location.  Close to Powell St Trolley
review.negativeRemarks: Not .much with a building this old.  It was quite pleasant
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, nob Hill, lots of shopping, China town 2 blocks away, restaurants close by, fishermans wharf

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice. A few rooms are currently under renovation. The rooms are small and the hotel has an odd odor to it. Might be from the paint. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly and willing to help you. This is a good place to stay

review.title: Not a nice hotel
review.reviewText: The entire hotel smelled of mold and mildew.  The first room they put me in was overpowering:  my eyes were watering within one minute.  The second room was better but still had a terrible musty smell.  The shower was also way below standard--it hit me right in the face and couldn't be adjusted.  This is what I would expect in a hotel in central or south america (maybe even europe) not San Fran and not at such a high cost.

The hotel staff was very helpful. The rooms were comfortable, but on street side they were somewhat loud. We could hear the street cleaner running every morning starting early at 0500. Would recommend earplugs if you are a light sleeper.
review.negativeRemarks: The lobby smelled of cat urine, which was unpleasant.

review.title: Never book at that hotel again
review.reviewText: I tried to chang my reservation so the supervisor and other persons  at Expedia talk to the manager in this manner and he refused and didn't refound any money. And even whenever I agreed to pay again he want to charge me triple what I was paids .  I will never try to make reservations at my whole life again at that hotel

review.title: 40th anniversary
review.reviewText: upon entering our room we discover someone's luggage was left behind. The staff (Eric) immediately assigned us a corner room that was probably several upgrades from what we had booked. It was quiet and clean with the exception of dusty blinds. The wine tasting hour is lovely!
review.negativeRemarks: The blinds were dusty.
review.locationRemarks: Two drinking establishments nearby.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Pros- proximity to Union Square, Macy and many other stores for shopping. You can walk from Powell Bart station to the hotel (20 mins) although there is a steep slope for about one block. You can find Vito's pizza and Walgreens Pharmacy near by.
