There are 2 Walgreens on Powell St near the hotel. The one that is closer to Union Square/Macy is much bigger and you can buy bottle water, coffee and sandwiches. It opens 24 hrs a day. The cable car is only 50 yards at Powell and Bush St. China town is also within walking distance.

The hotel staff was quite friendly and let us store our luggage after we checked out so that we could go to Market St to see the St. Patrick's day Parade.

Cons - Hotel is over 100 years old. The first room we got on the 4th floor was old, smelly and had some flies( looks like fruit flies) in the bath room. We asked for a change and was assigned one on the 8th floor. The room looked like it was recently updated and very clean.
The air conditioner (window unit) is quite noisy. Luckily we did not have to turn it on during sleep. Otherwise I don't think you can sleep with the noise. In addition, our section can clearly hear the noise from garbage trunks at around 6 am. If that bothers you, you may want to ask for the quiet side of the building when you book.
Since this is an old hotel, the in-room safe is on the shelf inside the closet. It is pretty high, you need a chair unless you are 6 foot 5.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to Union Square, BART train station.
review.negativeRemarks: Some rooms need updated and annoying insects eradicated.
review.locationRemarks:
Macy and the popular Cheese Cake factory restaurant on the top floor. 
Shopping at the big department store in Westfield Shopping Centre on Market.

review.title: Convenient location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Stayed here only one night, but we were very comfortable.  The room was very clean and quiet.  We particularly enjoyed the happy hour and convenience of walking to wonderful local restaurants, like Farallon.  Our cab ride to an evening event was reasonable, given the central location of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff were friendly, and the fire made the lobby that much more appealing and cozy. Nice varied seating worked well for happy hour!  Met nice people.
review.negativeRemarks: When we arrived, the bellman seemed overburdened with duties, and we had to schlep our own suitcases to our room. (Not a huge deal).
review.locationRemarks: Everything is nearby - the cable car, Union Square, restaurants, shopping, bars.

review.title: This hotel experience ruined San Francisco for us.
review.reviewText:
Though (or perhaps because of) the booking thru Expedia being made a number of weeks prior, on our arrival the duty reception clerk could find no record of it. He said they were very busy. After some time muttering, and tinkering with the computer, he came up with room 414, which my wife and I subsequently squeezed into......and I mean that almost literally. Despite booking for four nights, we had to just open our suitcases on the floor and walk around them best we could for the whole time: there were no drawers or cupboards of any sort to unpack into. There were no curtains in the room, only venetian blinds.
The bathroom was tiny, many cracked and poorly grouted tiles and without any sort of extractor fan: after misting up the room after a shower I managed (after a struggle) to open up the small window for ventilation, thus looking directly into two opposite windows some ten feet away across the lightwell. 
Next morning I complained bitterly to reception, only to be told that a room change wasn't possible until after one more night in 414. After enduring that we were switched into nextdoor, 412, slightly larger room, but even smaller bathroom with no washbasin: that was in a cupboard in the room itself. Still nowhere to unpack into, so cases lived on the floor. 
And on checking out we were charged extra $40 for two nights "room upgrade"!
review.negativeRemarks: Virtually everything
review.locationRemarks: Two long blocks from Union Square (one of them on about a 40 degree slope). Good cafe a half block away on nearest corner, trolley stop outside.

review.title: Prefect hotel for a weekend in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Honestly, I think this is one the best hotel deals I have ever found.  We checked in early without a hitch and went to the 6th to our room. It looked like it had maybe just been remodeled, very nice and clean. The room was definitely small but for the two of us it was more than enough space for a weekend. The staff was beyond friendly, trying to help even if we didn't ask. Also the wine reception every evening is a perfect way to start the night. They are in the process of remodeling, from the lobby we could hear it but in our room we couldn't at all. The location was prefect as well, close to union square, FiDi and China town and just a short walk or cable car ride to the Fishermans Wharf.  It's also just a short walk to the BART.

review.title: Below average hotel, above average rates
review.reviewText: The Vintage Court is a below average hotel. Nothing about it is terrible, but the hallways were musty (room smelled OK thanks to airflow), the rooms are looking shabby (caulking coming apart, things generally worn) and water temperature was inadequate. In terms of the water, it was just barely warm enough to shower most days, but never warm enough to shave. Again, not terrible, but it is priced equally to a lot of much nicer hotels in the same area. Wouldn't stay again, skip over the Vintage Court. Air con worked but was very noisy. Road noise was present but reasonable.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is musty and dated.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is near by, as is Fishermens Wharf, and it has proximity to the financial district.

review.title: Very nice location close the where we wanted to be
review.reviewText: Enjoyed a night in the city with great accommodations
review.negativeRemarks: have the parking a bit more reasonable
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and the Chinese New Year parade which is what took us there.

review.title: Good place to stay!
review.reviewText: The lobby was very inviting.  The happy hour was an added treat.  Eric was a great help and provided good suggestions every time we asked him.  He is very knowledgeable about the city. The hotel is centrally located and easy to get to all of the places including the Convention Center and China Town.  The negatives are that there is a lot of noise from the stair well and the elevator on the 2nd floor.  The bed is quite hard but was comfortable to sleep in.  There was not enough hot water on Friday morning resulting in a barely warm shower.  We had a great time in San Francisco even thought we were there for business.
Good experience - a bit cramped, but affordable price for the area. Great time!

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square- Beware of hill.
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was great; however, the location was a bit difficult. While it's VERY close to Union Square, it's at the top of one of the steeper hills so if you are walking from the BART station, it's a little rough. Our room was very comfortable and quite clean; however, the alley by our room was quite noisy with people arguing and slamming doors frequently. We don't mind city noise, but this was a little more alarming at times. Good staff.
review.positiveRemarks: The actual room was really nice. You can tell the building is older but the rooms were clean and well kept.
review.negativeRemarks: Honestly, the things that we didn't like were based on the location which is not really fixable.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Chinatown, Nob Hill, Union Square, cable car stops, etc.

review.title: Vintage style hotel in San Fran
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a great locatioan. Within walking distance of a variety of restaurants, cafs, and shopping. Chinatown is only a couple blocks away. Easy to find transportation to other areas in the city. 
As far as the hotel room itself: vinatage feel,  small room, but all basic necessities included. 
Downside: No parking. Valet service available for a cost.

Perfect for a weekend in SF. Rooms are clean and the staff are really nice.
Great location!

review.title: good location, overpriced poor breakfast if open
review.reviewText:
I had a good experience overall. The room was clean, it would be great to get slippers carpeted rooms are not the greatest in terms of hygiene.
The staff was great. I enjoyed the fact that main cable cars are so close to the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: smells at the entrance of the hotel
review.locationRemarks: nice location close to everything

review.title: Great hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
We were there four nights in Feb 2015.  A great boutique hotel that features a wine tasting in the lounge each evening between 5-6.  The fire complements the wine and creates a friendly environment to meet other guests and chat about your visit. 

It's 1912 charm adds to the welcoming nature of the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The room size, the friendly staff, close proximity to Union square and tourist attractions - and the wine tasting!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is not always guaranteed (voucher for cafe across the road can be a little inconvenient), butter and spreads not provided.
review.locationRemarks: easy to get to tourist sites via Powell-Market Rd cable car and trolley cars, Union square and Market St close. Plenty of restaurants close by.

review.reviewText: Good! The staff is very friendly and the room is comfortable also

review.title: Excellent
review.reviewText:
Great position close to Union Square for shopping and eating.
Hotel is comfortable , quiet and the 5-6pm cocktail hour (well wine hour) is just lovely.
Staff are wonderfully attentive.
Stayed here many times and have not found a reason not to.
review.negativeRemarks: Longer wine hour  (just joking)
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, cable car and Market street. Plenty of shopping and eateries. Just up the road from Chinatown 2 Blocks.

review.title: Nice Hotel well located
review.reviewText: The hotel which had an "affordable" cost per night was excellent. The lobby with it's sitting area around the fire place was a pleasant surprise. My room was in the back of the building and therefore was very quiet except for some garbage pickup in the early morning. In fact the room layout allowed it to be relatively isolated from adjacent rooms contributing to the quiet level. There was one flaw, however, There was no dresser in the room. What should have been a dresser below the TV was instead a low closet containing one shelf over a safe. The safe could have been put in the clothes closet with a full dresser substituting for this cabinet. Also, I think the "extra cost" food and drink items in the room were overdone. The entire refrigerator was filled with these items.
review.negativeRemarks: See above.
review.locationRemarks: Located near Union Square the most active area in San Francisco.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The rooom's carpet, bathroom and A/C need update.

review.title: smells like a died pet
review.reviewText: The staff are Excellent, well located , smells terrible, old carpet and not clean.

Nice hotel staff. Room seemed a lot smaller than expected, and headboards were dirty. Other than that it was a decent place to get a good night sleep. Although, every morning at 6 AM there was a lot of commotion either at the kitchen or going to a dumpster that woke me.

review.title: Not good parking
review.reviewText: Staff is good but the rooms are small noisy parking is far and expensive bathroom it's small
Comfortable room, not a lot of noise, good shower

review.title: Booking Problem
review.reviewText: There was a booking problem, and I was told by Expedia to call the hotel. When I called the hotel they told me to wait for the reservation manager on Monday. The person who helped me was understanding and said there was nothing he could do as he would need authorization from a manager. When I called on Monday and asked to speak to the manager. The reservation manager was rude. Every time I tried to speak she would cut me off and raise her voice. I was not able to resolve anything and was told to call Expedia back. When I called Expedia back they were rude and I had to wait thirty minutes for to talk to a supervisor. The supervisor kept raising his voice and cutting me off as well. I was left unsatisfied and felt that my problem was not resolved.

review.title: Exceptional personal service
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco to visit my daughter who was ill and the hotel staff went out of their way to make us both feel comfortable and cared for.  Everyone from the manager to the doorman to the cleaning staff were as accommodating and gracious as they could be.  By the end of the week my daughter was feeling better and we both had enjoyed a great stay at the hotel. Loved the free wine hours too !

review.title: Close to work in financial district
review.reviewText: Nice clean rooms. Bed was comfortable. Shower was old looking but the shower and water pressure was awesome.

review.title: Location, location
review.reviewText: Older hotel, room was fine and hotel staff was great. Location was convenient to everything.  We paid a high rate due to a very busy weekend.  This hotel is not worth a high rate but if your able to get a room for $150 or less it is worth it.  Free wine from 5 to 6 is also nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets need to be replaced or change to something else.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, Chinatown.  Even more if you like to walk!

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: I frequently visit SF and stay in hotels in the Financial District. This hotel was disappointing mainly due to the room configuration. The bathroom was very small and consisted only of a toilet and tiny shower. The sink area was in the main room and located in a very small closet. I prefer to have all bathroom needs (including the sink) in one room. I was also not fond of the location.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff was very nice and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks:
Larger bathrooms
Faster elevator

review.title: Needs Updating
review.reviewText: Staff was friendly but room was small, cold and very noisy with a view of a brick wall and a bathroom in need of updating.
review.positiveRemarks: It was the only place left within a reasonable walk of the financial district.  Nice fireplace in lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets and rooms badly in need of updating -- especially for the astronomical price.  Also needs soundproofing.
review.locationRemarks: A block from Chinatown; restaurants and coffee shops nearby.

review.title: Nice hotel very well renovated. Excellent location
review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay. Friendly and helpful staff. Liked the wine offering at 5:00 pm. Small, but very nice and very clean. Room was upgraded very well. Near Union Square and the Trolley.
review.positiveRemarks: Great rate for such a nice hotel in an excellent location.
review.negativeRemarks: The parking was inconvenient. One block away.
review.locationRemarks: You can reach all of San Francisco with the public bus and trolley system.

review.title: Would book again
review.reviewText: Good, comfortable room with attentive staff.  We will book here again.
review.locationRemarks: Location is the best thing, really the center of SF's best visitor neighborhoods and a great homebase for walking, shopping, drinking, and eating.

review.title: Last choice
review.reviewText: Good location, staff was adequately attentive, a/c - heat turned on and off -loudly - every 10 minutes. Bathroom was like a dorm room bath, just not as nice.  Funny smell in the room.

Great hotel. Perfect location 
Good staff. Clean rooms.

review.title: Great location close to Chinatown and Union Square
review.reviewText: Clean, spacious room for this area.  Friendly and helpful staff.  Nice wine hour in the lobby, close to restaurants etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks:
Chinatown
Union Square
Walking distance to North Beach through Chinatown.

review.title: Clean hotel, very helpful staff, very small rooms
review.reviewText: Quiet neighborhood (aside from construction); safe neighborhood for this area; very small rooms, but clean hotel and upkeep satisfactory, free internet,
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square, safe area
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area

review.title: Basic hotel close (ish) to Union Square
review.reviewText: convenient base for attending JP Morgan Healthcare conference
review.positiveRemarks: I had a huge room by US standards. Well placed for Union Square. Available
review.negativeRemarks: Wifi could have been better

review.title: Sorry but I would not recommend this
review.reviewText: Hotel room smelled. Shower did not work. T v did not work. Very hard to sleep very noisy

review.title: not worth it.
review.reviewText: I paid $452.22 for one night for Executive One Room, (Double Beds) and for parking $42.00 valet parking( self parking $32.00) parking is not in hotel, it is two block away from hotel. They gave me a room on 3rd floor. the room is very small. Breakfast was not good. they only had bagel, bread, coffee, waffle, milk,4 kind of cereal. that's it. I'm not happy with this hotel. Also I'm not happy with expedia because expedia not suppose to include this hotel in their network. thanks
review.negativeRemarks: Reception staff need to improve their politeness/ courtesy. More items should be in breakfast. air condition unit need be changed. eliminate smell.
review.locationRemarks: it is close to union square, china town san francisco.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: We enjoy staying here when we are going to shop in Union Square.  It is a very short walk and the room is clean, comfortable and inexpensive.
review.negativeRemarks: Given the age of the historic building, I am not sure anything could be done; I do like having a bathtub.  Room service hours were too restrictive.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to great dining and shopping.

review.title: Hard bed
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was great and quick to help, however the king size bed me and my gf stayed in left us both sore the next morning.. They have a wine bar/tasting every night at 5pm for it's guests and parking is 35-50 bucks for the valet per night

review.title: Good for wine fans
review.reviewText:
During the free wine hour, they actually serve high quality wines, better than what you'd pay through the nose for at most hotels (and I say this as a bit of a wine snob). The wines they feature are usually small California producers, not big name garbage.
Also, the hotel is wine themed and within short walking distance of many great food options.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is perfectly located to explore San Francisco but it is a very old hotel and strange smell in the room.
The rooms in the back have no view, very dark.

review.title: Nice hotel at a perfect location
review.reviewText: The staff is super friendly. Location is perfect! Bathroom is a bit too small, though.
review.negativeRemarks: Heating system can be improved.

review.title: Vintage = Old
review.reviewText: Old furniture, old walls, old floors, old hotel.  It needs a good remodeling and updating.   The staff is doing the best they can with what they have but it was not what I expected.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel remodeling is a must.
review.locationRemarks: great location 2 blocks from Union Square (not on it).

review.title: Character, Convenient,  Clean and Comfortable
review.reviewText:
Our stay was for 6 nights during Thanksgiving holiday.

Close to Union Square with reasonable rates.  Older building (means smaller spaces) that is clean, has very good beds, all the conveniences and a friendly staff who is really helpful.  In the evenings, Chris was a very pleasant happy guy who was always ready with a helping hand.  During the day, Vincent was there to fulfill any request and take care of any traveling needs we had.  All of the staff, both day and night, were friendly and professional.  Wine hour every day in the lobby around the fireplace was always fun; met several of the other guests and made new friends.
Such a great location with various modes of transportation available for longer distances.
Catholic church close by.

On a budget or not, this is a wonderful hotel with an ideal location
.
review.positiveRemarks:
Location, staff and rates.  Staff helped make wine hour fun time to mingle with the other guests.
Close to cafes, restaurants in all price ranges
review.negativeRemarks: More time for wine!
review.locationRemarks: Bush tw'n Powell / Stockton. Ride cable car, walk hill or walk easy & use tunnel stairs to Union Square. Chinatown very close.  Varied eating closeby

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: We always stay here,  feeling welcome and comfortable,  but mainly for the many friends we've made at the nightly Wine Tasting!  It's not about the wine so much as meeting people from around the world, plus we've made some long term friendships there.
review.negativeRemarks: Update paint and wallpaper. Better vacuuming.
review.locationRemarks: Union square

review.title: Good location & service with "vintage" drawbacks
review.reviewText: We chose Executive Hotel Vintage Court because of the price, the positive reviews, and the location.  Customer service was as good as the reviews indicated.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  But with "vintage" you also get smaller rooms and a mold/mildew smell that pervades the whole building.  It's a kind of odor that no amount of surface cleaning would solve (and the place was decently clean).  The other downer was that our rooms faced the front of the hotel, which meant lots of street noise to keep us up late at night and wake us up early in the morning.  Unfortunately, there's really nothing the hotel staff can do to fix any of these drawbacks.  Everything else that they _can_ control is done well.
review.positiveRemarks: Service, location, wine happy hour, free wifi.
review.negativeRemarks: The mold/mildew odor.
review.locationRemarks: Steps away from a cable car stop.  And a 10 min. walk to BART.  Close breakfast places:  Cable Car Cafe, Roxanne Cafe, Starbucks.

review.title: Decent hotel, well located
review.reviewText: The room was clean, the location was excellent (2 blocks from union square), only one elevator, the rooms are not so big and the carpet smells weird

review.title: close to Market Street and Trolleys.
review.reviewText: Had a great time at the hotel and the city was wonderful. The cable car was just up the street. We used the 3 day pass you get at Wallgreens on the Trolley, bus, metro and tram car, saved allot of money. Took the Alcatraz Tour, Muir Woods tour, and the city tour, all were wonderful. Shopping centers all around. Went to Gharardelli's, took lots of pictures, drank wine, met new people, tried new dishes and ways to liven up an omelette. Found out why they trolley driver dings the bell. Took the audio tour at Alcatraz. Used the gym in the hotel. small but nice. Can't wait to get a chance to go back, so many things left to do.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything, the wine party was nice, the staff are friendly, the room was wonderful.
review.negativeRemarks: clean the carpet or whatever the smell was that was in the room. The cost for using the internet in the business center.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect to go anywhere by Trolley, bus or metro. The restaurants for new dishes to try. Tour buses pick you up at the hotel. Diner close by.

review.title: can't complain about the price.
review.reviewText: Not a bad experience just the water was luke warm. The room was clean, and the building was clean also. It was also not a bad location. I would not take my kids there, but for just the wife and I it was a fun experience. (Nothing for kids to do close by) I really can't complain about the price. You get what you pay for.

review.title: Great hotel, great location, thin walls.
review.reviewText: If you are a light sleeper this may not be the best hotel for you. However, for our quick getaway given the low price, it was perfect. Upon check in we were greeted by a VERY friendly gentleman, our room was not ready but they held our luggage until our return several hours later. We enjoyed the afternoon wine reception. The following morning we were awoken by a small child jumping around the room above us, for about two hours, which is clearly poor parenting, not the hotels fault, but the thin walls did nothing to help this. We had a king room, which was spacious, clean and the bed was comfortable. At check out we encountered the only employee that could have been a bit more personable, but overall it was a great stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Low price, kind employees, wine reception, clean rooms, comfortable bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Better towels, they were a bit stiff, and only two towels for two people, my husband was kind enough to use the hand towel to dry off with.
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance to many attractions and BART.

review.title: Wonderful Stay.
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel in an excellent location.  The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: I particularly enjoyed the wine served during the nightly wine tasting event.
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel allowed me to see a part of the city I would have otherwise never explored.

review.title: Attentive service, cozy lobby
review.reviewText:
I really liked the staff at the hotel. They were good at anticipating my needs and very friendly. I barley had to ask a question, they already knew what I was looking for ( whether it was the maid service, the door man, front desk, etc).

The wine happy hour is a great touch and I liked the gentleman serving the wine. 

The hotel is "vintage" but so is everything else in this area. It seemed to be a good value.

I found it to be pretty tranquil. Being a smaller hotel, it didnt have the huslte and bustle of a large hotel.  

The Internet speeds were adequate for simple browsing. 

The lobby is really nice. I sat in the lobby reading for a couple of hours and it was the perfect place to do so. Very comfortable chairs, fireplace, low key.

review.title: Beautiful, vintage hotel near Chinatown
review.reviewText: Such a beautiful hotel.  Very charming.  Very near great restaurants and 2 blocks from Chinatown.  Extremely friendly and helpful staff!
review.negativeRemarks: The room had a slight mildew smell, like the carpet had been cleaned recently and not dried properly.  It was very faint and not bothersome.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is 2 blocks away.  Uncle Vito's and Roxanne's Cafe 1 block away and the prices and food were unbeatable!

review.reviewText: Great location.  Great staff.  Clean and quiet room.  Comfortable bed.
Great location and price.  Management is very professional.  Staff needs a bit more customer service training.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff training and re-training if necessary
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: We liked the hotel enough. Walking distance to China Town. Lobby was nice. Room was clean and nice. Bathroom was clean but very tight.

review.title: Good for the price and location
review.reviewText: If you are fussy about noise and like everything shinny and new dont stay here.   If you are OK with things a little rustic, with character and charm this could be your place.  The staff is fabulous and the location is convenient and safe.   I would stay there again.

review.title: nice boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent staff service they were willing to go the extra mile.
review.negativeRemarks: small elevator
review.locationRemarks: nice downtown location

review.title: Wine tasting
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the wine tasting.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Which was important as we ran a half marathon that started there early Sunday morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is incredibly over priced. Even for SF standards.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square. China town.

review.title: Close to bars, union square, etc
review.reviewText: Needs updating, but overall nice and comfortable. Being comfortable shoes!
Overall a good, clean hotel. Would stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection

review.title: location good but hotel not so much
review.reviewText: hotel very mediocre furnishings in the lobby and rooms.  the room we were in smelled horrible so much that we had to change rooms.  Room rate was $250 plus $40 tax fee and they don't even have coffee for guests in the morning.
Fine, comfortable and clean. One could try this hotel. Much better than I thought. It was quiet.
Too expensive....but great location. Union square, shopping malls, and train stations

review.title: Very close to union square and you can walk aroun
review.reviewText: Very nice people and the wine every afternoon give you the opportunity to talk with different people

review.title: Very pleased with the location
review.reviewText: It's an older hotel but very nice, and the rooms were very clean! The staff was very helpful and very eager to please us.
review.positiveRemarks: We really like the location, easy to walk from. Two blocks from Chinatown!
review.locationRemarks: Great location, restraurant, Chinatown very close! You can get the cable car at the corner to pier 39!

review.title: Decent place, but important caveats!!
review.positiveRemarks: Charm I guess, wine receptions was decent.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless is advertised but provided by some 3rd party system and our room it would connect, work for 30 seconds, then fail across multiple devices.
review.locationRemarks: Good location, a block or two off where you'd really want, of course up another monster hill, but considering all the hills we walked whats 1 more.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, close to trams, China Town and Union Square. The staff were very helpful and our room was kept very clean. Even received a bottle of free wine.

The reception area is nice and welcoming. The only downside would be to update the decor of the rooms. Apart from that good hotel to use as a sightseeing base.
Socks completely sucks hotel staff is very rude not helpful rooms are very old and stinky is a lot of germs and a lot of stuff everywhere

review.title: Very nice reasonable stay
review.reviewText: Price was right and staff and hotel right in San Francisco giving you the experience of the city with a friendly atmosphere and fun so what are waiting for come and have some fun.
review.locationRemarks: Everything close and most walking distance

review.title: Great hotel, at a great location
review.reviewText: Close to just about everything that you can see in San Francisco.. The staff is very welcoming and nice the room was clean and beautiful. We loved it!!!

review.title: Central location
review.reviewText: A half block from Powell St., convenient to the city center.  The neighborhood is funky, with a range of cuisines at moderate prices.

review.title: Close to downtown might be the only thing
review.reviewText: When I entered the room, the room smelled weird never went away. Towels smelled and felt it's little discussing. All the noises kept me awake and couldn't sleep well. With the much to pay, not enough  amenities and service. But I guess for some people its location would pay off of all.

review.title: Good basic hotel close to city centre
review.reviewText: Some staff were a bit off-hand, breakfast was minimal, and hence my somewhat lukewarm response.  But it provided a convenient place to stay and that is what we were looking for.

review.title: Average facility - good location in urban center
review.reviewText: Small rooms with little to no closet space and small bathroom; no complimentary breakfast; very expensive for the quality of room and overall accomodations
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff was very courteous and professional
review.negativeRemarks: Offer some sort of breakfast or at least coffee and muffins

review.title: Great location. Friendly staff.
review.reviewText: We had a pet friendly room. So we probably didn't end up in the best they had to offer. But the staff was very friendly and the room was clean.
Nice lobby but the room was a shock. Dirty, holes in the wall, the shower was only about 7 sf small. Way to expensive for what it is.

review.title: An OK hotel if you have to be in this part of town
review.reviewText: If you have to be in this part of San Fran, this hotel is ok. I was there for 6 nights because my usual hotel in the Cultural District was full. It's a busy area and if you're driving, it's tough getting in and out, especially with all the road works going on around Stockton and Market Streets. there's self parking at 750 Bush, half a block up the street. The hotel guest parking rate is $32 a night. The hotel restaurant was being renovated so it was closed other than for a very feeble breakfast offering of toast, coffee, cereal. You're better off crossing the street to the caf on the corner. Rooms are older and quite small but adequate if you're out most of the day. The elevator (there's only one) is slow so you may want to use the stairs. The wine hour (5pm-6pm each evening) was enjoyable and a good opportunity to meet some interesting people.
review.positiveRemarks: Uncle Vito's Italian restaurant half a block up the street. Great food, good wine, great prices. It's busy every night and you may have to line up.
review.negativeRemarks: the elevator

review.title: Great San Francisco location
review.reviewText: Great stay. Very convinient. Staff was very helpful. Room was bigger than I expected.

review.title: One night well worth the expense.
review.reviewText: Very clean.  Needs closer parking facilities. Very good room.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText:
Loved staying at this hotel, it was close to Union Square and easy to get to public transport.
The staff were amazing, couldn't do enough for us.  Loved the happy hour, so friendly and the staff seemed genuinely  interested in everyone.  Good fitness room, clean rooms with everything you need and nice and quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing it was great
review.locationRemarks: Great location handy to everything. Good shopping, close to hop on hop off bus which takes you to see all the tourist destinations

review.title: A little older but nice.
review.reviewText: We had a very nice 3 nights in this hotel.  It was clean and safe.  Mildly outdated, but I think the price reflects this.  Very convenient to Chinatown and Union Square.
Terrible experience at this hotel i will never go back

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: This hotel had a great location close to public transportation to get anywhere in San Francisco. The hotel is old, but clean and in good condition. I recommend this hotel for someone on a budget.

review.title: Good place to stay outside of Yosemite
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and the staff was courteous and professional.  The room was big and comfortable.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to visit Yosemite that cannot stay at the park.
review.positiveRemarks: Great place to stay, clean rooms, comfortable beds, plenty of closet and drawer space for the clothes.

review.title: Excellent Location
review.reviewText: The best location in San Francisco, we went on our honeymoon and it is located just 2 blocks away from Union Square, 1/2 block from a stop of the cable car, you can go everywhere from there with the MUNI services.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff at your arrival should be a little bit more friendly.
review.locationRemarks: Just in THE spot, you can go everywhere from there. You have tons of restaurants around it.

review.title: Vintage and well kept
review.reviewText:
The room was vintage as the air unit was located in the window. It was not central air, but it was great location for near downtown, to catch the trolley and a straight shot to the wharf if you don't mind a good walk. The staff was very nice and check-in and out were seamless. If you  are bed and breakfast or people person, this is a good hotel for you.

If you don't value charm, I'd say go to the Hilton instead.
review.positiveRemarks: I like the location, staff, and quaintness.
review.locationRemarks: It's a short walk to downtown shopping and market street. The trolley stops half a block away on Powell.

review.title: Great location, would stay elsewhere next time.
review.reviewText: We had a disappointing experience with the staff upon our departure. The concierge had told us that whether we were taking a cab or towncar to the airport, it would need to be reserved in advance. We asked him to book a cab, but he booked a towncar which didn't show up. We waited 20 minutes for it and then one of the other staff called a cab. Waited another 10 minutes, but meanwhile there were tons of available cabs driving by and they wouldn't hail one for us. We hailed one ourselves and they were hesitant to help us load our luggage. I don't think a 30 minute delay in airport transportation is acceptable, but believe staff were receiving kickbacks for transit referrals to their buddies. We would not stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: room was comfortable, a/c was sufficient
review.negativeRemarks: staff
review.locationRemarks: close to shopping and restaurants.

review.title: Hotel close to Union Square and trolley car.
review.reviewText:
Found hotel so central to most attractions and easy walking access.
Enjoyed the happy hour each night, a great way to meet other travellers. Everyone seemed to friendly and most mixed in well.
review.positiveRemarks: The central position and friendly staff. Happy hour another big bonus.
review.negativeRemarks: Room seemed somewhat cramped quite well fitted out but not a lot of room.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping Cable car to Fishermans Wharf Chinatown Hop on and hop off bus nearby

review.title: Good central location
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was larger than I expected for this location. The wine happy hour was a nice added benefit. I would definitely stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Well-equipped and very comfortable. Easy to fall asleep and stay asleep.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom fixtures were a bit old and dingy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to just about everything in a very safe area.

review.reviewText: Very nice hotel and great price for being in the city.

review.title: 2 blocks to Chinatown gate.
review.reviewText: Excellent location to all our points of interest. 2 blocks from Chinatown gate. 20 min walk to Pier 1@ Embarcadero with 4 Starbucks on the way. Lots to C on that walk. 30 min walk to Pier 39 from the hotel thru Chinatown if you don't stop and smell the roses. We'll be back at that hotel in couple of years.
They put 4 standard size pillows on a king size bed. The pillows are flatten and hard. No black out drapes. The building is dated and smelly. However, location is good.

review.title: you get what you pay for
review.reviewText: I paid around 210 for this hotel. The rooms were very old, although it seemed clean at first glance the patterns on the walls, headboard, and carpet was a poor attempt to hide grime. The headboard was material and had stains on it. The carpet felt really nasty and I kept shoes on my entire stay. The bathroom was okay but I did not feel it was clean enough to shower so I skipped showering that day for fear of feeling worse after I got out then when I got in. The towels looked like they had been used 1000 times already. The hotel staff was wonderful and the valet service was very quick. I wouldn't want to pay more the $150 for this hotel. $210 was way to expensive. Thank god I only booked it for one night. Also- It is located on a very busy street and as a female I did not feel safe standing outside at night alone.
review.negativeRemarks: needs updating
review.locationRemarks: you can walk to Chinatown. 10 dollar cab ride to the pier. 10 minute drive to Lombard street.

review.title: Good location, nice services
review.reviewText: Walking distance to Chinatown, Union square. Old facility but clean and still comfortable. Very nice and helpful staff. One of the best experience in SF
review.negativeRemarks: Facility
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, union square shopping

review.title: Nice comforting bed, pillows and room temperature
review.reviewText: Location is very convenient , close to china town and embacadero and financial district. I definitely will come back and stay here.

review.title: Dated but cozy and conveniently located
review.reviewText: I was in San Francisco for a convention and all the well known hotels were either booked or outrageously priced ($600 plus a night) . Took a shot with this hotel for $349 a night (typically in the low $200 range) and was not disappointed. It's not the Four Seasons or the Ritz and it's a little dated but it was enough for me to get comfortable in and within walking distance to Union Square, China Town, Financial District and the convention center (Mascone). Also with regards to walking, to get here on foot from the base of Union Square is a little challenging due to the sloped streets so if you're gonna be on foot all day you may want to take a cab on the way to the hotel. This hotel is also down the street from an awesome Italian restaurant called "Uncle Vitos" on Bush and Powell Streets that serves a delicious pizza.
review.positiveRemarks: Conveniently located to China Town, Union Square and Financial District.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are a little dated and could use new paint instead of wallpaper but the overall character of the establishment gives it it's charm and appeal.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located to China Town, Union Square and Financial District.

review.title: Convenient hotel good for getting around In SF
review.reviewText: I had a great experience and although it was my first time in SF I was able to get around very easily
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient close to transport, cable car goes by the hotel wonderful 6.00 to travel one way but what a thrill also.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is useless not worth the bother!
review.locationRemarks: Shopping in Union square and the pier and Fishermans wharf pretty close by. Great for strolling around San Francisco

review.title: Hotel in quite a good position
review.reviewText: The room was very disappointing and the cleanliness left a lot to be desired. Although they cleaned every day it was not done very well and you could see that things had been left dirty. On the other hand most of the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was not worth taking and everything was served on plastics plates and bowls so that they could be thrown away. Even the coffee was served in paper cups.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is in quite a good location to be able to get around.
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel needs refurbishing thoroughly and the rooms cleaned better.
review.locationRemarks: Union square is only two blocks away and the cables cars stop at the end of the road. The buses are at the bottom of Union square so easy to get to.

review.title: Cute and Chic
review.reviewText: Hotel was right near Chinatown. great location near lots of food offerings. They do a breakfast, but it was lack luster so just go out to eat. small boutique hotel. Clean with no issues.
review.negativeRemarks: old school with the air conditioner so it was hard to regulate temperature.also, up the broadband on your wireless. slow as well.
review.locationRemarks: diners, shopping and enough hills for some exercise.

review.title: Really nice double room.Comfortable beds
review.reviewText: Really like the complimentary happy hour at 5 p m. Staff were very helpful. Great experience!
review.locationRemarks: A hill climb to get to it but what the heck got to work off some of the great food around town!

review.title: Great location to most attractions, & transport
review.reviewText:
Spent 6 nights on first trip to SF.

Staff very friendly and inviting. Hotel is local to major areas, and to city transportation connections. The wine hour is a plus. Room was on the small side but comfortable and adequate.

Close to good restaurants. Breakfast could have had more choice but served the purpose - Juices, fruit, toast, cereals, bagels, and waffles, tea and coffee.

Would stay again
review.positiveRemarks: Location to attractions, restauraunts, and transport points. Staff
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast choices
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance. Cable car stop at end of block as is the city bus line stop to get you to any were in the city

review.title: Classic downtown SF hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, right downtown, close to Union Square and Chinatown, not far from Fisherman's Wharf, etc. Great, classic hotel, with modern conveniences, excellent service and cleanliness, and decent parking close by.

review.title: Great hotel and location nice free wine happy hour
review.reviewText: Only problem is the bad perfum smell in the hall way and room, also $12.00 for a very limited breakfest is a steal.

review.title: Christmas Holidays 2013/2014
review.reviewText: We stayed here during the Christmas holidays last year and had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful in arranging tours for us and always smiling when we arrived. they always try to answer all questions and give us advise on the best and economical places to go re: food and shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was clean, quiet and the staff was very friendly. We stayed there 7 days and we were really comfortable.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel was close to all amenities. Within walking distance to shops, restaurants and bars.

review.title: Terrible
review.reviewText: Hotel is smell and air conditioner making loud noise. Can't even sleep and staffs are not vet friendly. Not worth the money

review.title: Good location and good price
review.reviewText:
We were very close to Chinatown and an easy walk to the financial district. We were on the 8th floor and it was so quiet you could not hear any street noise. Lots of places to eat nearby. The famed cable car could be caught one block away.
The one down side was that the air conditioner worked more like a fan and we were there when it was very hot. All staff were great and so helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning
review.locationRemarks: Ride cable car to Fisherman's Wharf, see Chinatown, walk through financial district and on to Candlestick Park

review.title: Value for money hotel with good location.
review.reviewText: Spacious and clean room. Staff very helpful and welcoming. Excellent location for down town. Relaxing lobby area. Only criticism is the weak internet. It's free and weak. I'd prefer to pay the extra for good strong internet signal. Took ages to download simple stuff.

review.title: Worth it... just don't eat there
review.reviewText: Excellent room and bed, could be better maintained... knobs missing... small stuff but the bed and pillows were VERY comfortable. Staff is helpful... FREE wine every day at 5 a plus... but don't even think about the breakfast... they should be embarassed on that one...

review.title: Nice hotel experience
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel clean and staff extremely friendly. The location was excellent and the nightly
wine with other guests was a nice touch.
review.negativeRemarks: Fresh coffee available in the lobby in the morning.

review.title: Easy to get to from the bart ,muni and cable cars
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel. Free wine!
Central to transit and food.
It was vintage, but that made the experience unique. I'd def's fo sho stay here again.

review.title: Good price for location
review.reviewText:
This hotel is great for it's location. The rooms are a little worn, but comfortable and clean. It is located just steps from Powell Street, which is great for visiting downtown San Francisco.

We had breakfast included in our stay. This was awful. There was often no coffee - when we notified the attendant he went to the kitchen and came back with one carafe. Then we noticed no sugar, or no bagels, or no waffle mix, etc. He would go back to get what we asked for, never checking to see what else was needed. The toaster did not work properly. The coffee cups were paper, and everything else was plastic. Very disappointing.
review.negativeRemarks: If breakfast is going to be included, it must be improved!

review.title: Nice hotel alittle far from fishermans wharf..
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great! Clean and staff was friendly. My only draw back would be that it's a distance from fisherman wharf which is where many of the attractions were. You can get the Powell street line which is half a block from the hotel, but if you aren't familiar with the city you really have to pay attention to where to get off on the way back. You can get tours and day trips with pickups and drop offs in front of the hotel through extranomical and grayline which was a great option for a solo traveler! A taxi ride to and from the San Francisco airport is around $50! There is also a shuttle you can get to and from called "go-lorries" for only $14! Overall the experience was great and I would suggest it. If you are looking to really hangout at the wharf I would pay the extra money to stay at a hotel there but if you willing to do a quiet hotel with day trips or be willing to find ways to this hotel it is an awesome option!

review.title: Central, clean and comfortable
review.reviewText:
This hotel was recommended by a friend who had stayed there some years ago. It is very central and convenient to Union Square and the Powell-Market cable car. Very comfortable bed, very friendly helpful staff, especially Vincent the Manager.

My first room was dark, internal and a little smelly. In request they moved me the next day to a nicer, brighter room. The food/bar facilities in the hotel were disappointing but there are many cafs, bars and restaurants close by. Their recommended for Scala bistro was excellent.

Walking around the area my first evening (and each day in SG) it was not expecting to see so many people sleeping on the streets. Outside one of the fancier establishments on Union square was a guy who seemed to be cooling his butt cheeks on the pavement with his pants halfway on/off. It's just a part of SF.

Each evening they have wine tasting (free red or white wine available) from a single vineyard for an hour. Not an event just wine available should you want a glass and staff were very attentive.

Only other issue was the problem my airport shuttle driver (and company) had locating the hotel. I didn't have the correct address and the hotel is listed under Vintage Court not Executive Vintage with the taxi companies.

Pleasant, safe, comfortable, very central.

managementResponses.response:
Thank for your stay and we hope we see you again. Our hotels location is great and I am happy you found the room accommodations well suited for your needs!

Best regards,

Bill Engelhardt - General Manager

review.title: Pretty room comfortable.
review.reviewText: Room was lovely. Location was great. Walking distance to China town, Union Square, and North Beach Restaurants.

managementResponses.response:
Our apologies for any poor experience due to odors or dust in the guest room. Our hotel staff is here to assist and your stay should be pleasant, clean and refreshing. Our hotel staff is always here to assist you to make sure you found value in your stay and the right experience. As you noted, if the smell and cleaning did not highlight you senses and clothes, you may have had a better stay. Based on your notes you did enjoy our hotels central location and helpful staff. I will review and change any inspections with our staff to better the hotel and appreciate your comments too.

Sincerely,

Bill Engelhardt - General Manager

review.title: Lack of attention to details
review.reviewText:
First impression, room smelled a bit like urine. An employee was very friendly and helped me move to a new room, which only smelled marginally better...my clothes also absorbed the unpleasant smell.

This hotel could be nice if they paid attention to the small things. Specifically, the layers of dust on everything didn't impress. The carpet was lumpy and felt rough and dirty. Overall, the place is a bit run down and needs some TLC. Plan on spending a very limited amount of time in the room if you stay here.

review.title: cozy hotel near cablecar lines
review.reviewText: we enjoyed our stay .The room was comfortable the staff was helpful and the complimentary breakfast and wine hour were a nice extra touch.

review.title: Great location - between Union Square and Nob Hill
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel with old world charm. Rooms were not large (no dresser) but charming and attractive. Bed was comfortable and nice view out of window to side street below. Staff were very helpful and friendly, and there was complimentary wine in the evening - very civilized! Good location to walk to many neighborhoods - Chinatown, Nob Hill, Union Square. Short Muni ride to Castro. Only draw back was the 5 am trash truck that was exceptionally loud. Nonetheless, we will definitely stay here again if we come back to San Francisco!

review.title: Nice hotel in heart of San Francisco.
review.reviewText: This was a lovely boutique style hotel with a very friendly staff. The facitlites were older and the rooms small but very functional.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.

review.title: Not comfortable
review.reviewText:
The room I stayed has a window face the garbage cans. So I was scared of the huge noise in the early morning about 3 or 4 clock. Even I had prepared to have a small room because the location is busy area, I still be impressed by the small room and small shower space. The drainer of shower didn't work well so when I took shower my feet was in the slow water and had to shut down the water to wait. The smell in the room was unpleasant.
The internet is another problem. It often disconnected and I had to try again and again to open a email.
The parking is expensive as valet parking $40 per day. When I checked in I told the gentleman in the front desk we would have a valet parking the first night and self parking second night which price is $30, he said no problem but he didn't told us we must remove the car the second day and re-enter the parking lot to change to self park. When we check out we were charge 2 days valet parking because we didn't use the car at all so the status of the car was still in valet parking. The lady who helped me check out said the guy checked me in should told me reenter the parking lot but he didn't. She said the parking lot runs by another company so the hotel just collect money for them.
review.positiveRemarks: The gentlemen in lobby ( I supposed he is a doorman) was very friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: smell in the room. the slow running water in shower.
review.locationRemarks: The location is convenient just at the edge of China Town. Not far to restaurant and cafe. One block to the cable car station. Walking to Fisherman's

review.title: good
review.reviewText: Everything is nice, especially the friendly staff. Very comfort except the smell of the room.

review.title: Ehh
review.reviewText: I like the room and look. But the a.c. system is so old and the room smelled like a wet dog I left it off because it was bringing in the smells from the nasty ally... another room could be better but thats how my stay was. Bring a candle......?

review.title: Enjoyed my stay here!
review.reviewText: The room was a bit small, but the location is perfect (right in the financial district), the facilities are well maintained, and the staff were exceptionally friendly. The hotel even hosts a free wine event each night! If you're looking for a reasonably priced stay in the heart of San Francisco and don't need the accoutrements of a 5-star hotel, this place is perfect.
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect: right near Nob Hill, the financial district, and Chinatown.

review.title: Stinky Place
review.reviewText: It smells really old, staff is really helpful, cheaper than surrounding places in the area

review.title: Available hotel
review.reviewText: Good hotel too expensive for the quality but SF is crazy in cost and value

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Great location friendly staff we enjoyed having sex in clean room

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great hotel location and staff. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I would stay here again.

review.title: A short stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: As someone who travels often for business I find myself staying in a wide variety of hotels; however I always feel more comfortable staying in places like the Executive Hotel Vintage Court - small number of friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere, comfortable, good-sized rooms, clean and tidy, and not at all pretentious. The location was excellent (easy walking distance to shops and restaurants), and certainly very cost-effective option for a hotel so close to Union Square. Yes the place is a little old and perhaps some of the fixtures and fittings could do with updating, but this sort of quirkiness kind of added to the place, and I'd certainly stay there again. The wine tasting sessions each evening also had an element of appeal.

review.title: Nice Hotel in a great City.
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and the staff very attentive. My room location was poor. too much noise from 5/6Am trash removal.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located near the central business district, many good restaurants, shopping, and a shore trolley ride to Fisherman's Warf.

review.title: Location & Staff
review.reviewText:
The location is just perfect as to access to public transportation...as we could go most places within 10 minutes.
The staff was so helpful and friendly...helped us get our bearings and how to use the public transportation system. Had a great time...THANKS

review.title: Perfect location and area!
review.reviewText: Loved it, it was convenient and comfortable! We will be returning again and only staying there!
review.positiveRemarks: Old world style, yet clean and modern style. It was exactly the San Fran hotel experience I wanted. Walking distance from everything!
review.negativeRemarks: Had issue with plumming but it was an old building. It was expected and fixed immediately.
review.locationRemarks: Everything... It's close to union square and all the trolley pickups! Great breakfast at Roxanne cafe! Great suggestion from hotel!

review.title: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Close to tram station.
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Must stay here. Very good staff.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: Very accessible location, close to Chinatown, Union Square, Hop on hop off buses

review.title: Great Location. Near everything.
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you are in San Francisco for the 1st time. We were walking distance from major landmarks. also, if you dont feel like walking a taxi is not very expensive from and to.
review.positiveRemarks: the hotels location in the city was great
review.negativeRemarks: the room condition could be improved. bettter carpet or bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: near Chinatown and downtown & fairy building

review.title: Wonderful service!
review.reviewText:
Was very appreciative of the great staff and exceptional service. They were terrific!

Hotel in a great location, very close to financial district, Union Square, shopping & Chinatown.
review.negativeRemarks: Slightly outdated facility... just because it's in an older building.
review.locationRemarks: Location is fabulous. Very close to some great restaurants. Within walking distance of the Embarcadero, Union Square, Chinatown, great shopping.

review.title: Outdated Rooms in Need of Complete Overhaul
review.reviewText: My room was completely outdated. Everything needs to be changed from the furniture, to the old and falling apart carpeting, to the in the window air conditioning unit, to the ancient looking bathroom. To top it off, there was no hot water in the entire hotel during my first morning there. The accommodations where poor, at best.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely everything besides the location.

review.title: room stay
review.reviewText: Room was cold and dreary. 2nd floor is near a trash compactor or something loud that woke me up 3 times in the night. Bathroom door should be a pocket door- very hard to move around in the tiny bathroom with the door in the way. There is no way to pull into the front of hotel so if the street parking is not available, you're sunk. I had to go around the block but with one way streets this is very inconvenient. Would be nice if there was wine available in the room for purchase.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was nice and competent. I did not have to wait for anything. Wireless included in room price.
review.negativeRemarks: Room cleanliness. Non-smoking floors not just individual rooms- the hallway stunk of tobacco. Assure that there is adequate space to pull in front

review.title: EXCELLENT location for families!
review.reviewText: In a great location for those wanting to sight see and be out and about. Rooms are small but my husband, 8 year old daughter and I were fine. Friendly staff- overall great experience!

review.title: Prime Value in a Prime Union Square Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very charming and the staff were very friendly and professional. The rooms were clean and the bathroom set up was ideal with shelving around the mirror to allow my wife to display her makeup, perfume and all other bathroom necessities. The location was ideal - basically sitting a couple of blocks above Union Square. Easy walking distance to Starbucks and a several great restaurants of various pricing levels.

We will "be back"!
review.negativeRemarks: The only issue is that the property sits on Bush and the windows are not necessarily air tight and as such you hear some street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Immediate access to Starbucks (a couple of locations), great breakfast, lunch and dinner spots and pubs and bars.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Only on an overnight stay but have booked to go back in a weeks time
review.positiveRemarks: Staff exceptional, daily wine tasting (complimentary) location
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown, Fishermans Wharf, Union Square, tram stops, loads of restaurants close by

review.title: san fran visit
review.reviewText: was good...hotel was old and neat, good area with great food nearby at a place called ALIMENT . Near chinatown, close to union square and very close to cablecar stop.

review.title: Great Wine Hotel
review.reviewText: Check in was quick and easy, staff was very friendly and they accommodated us by holding our bags for a bit before our actual check in time so we could go walk around the area. The room was very clean and quaint, just what we wanted. The complimentary wine tasting were fantastic, we found a new Napa winery that we had never heard of and found some amazing ports bought a couple bottles and they kind enough to open one for us before we left for dinner. All in all this hotel is perfect for people who want to be centrally located in the city and are looking for a place that has wonderful accommodations but without all the fuss of the larger hotels. Would recommend it to friends, and family and will definitely be back the next time we are in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Absolutely love the wine tastings...what a fantastic thing to provide to your guests.
review.negativeRemarks: The one and literally only one complaint I would have was that the shower doors were aged and were kind of a pain to open and close.
review.locationRemarks: The cable car cafe on Powell was great for a quick, clean and simple breakfast as was Sears Fine Food (the corn beef hash was amazing).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, nice historic hotel. Staff friendly and helpful, rooms are smallish but comfy.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and easy access to transit.

review.title: it was fine
review.reviewText: Old hotel with decent sized rooms, small bathroom, but in good shape with a very nice and professional staff. I would stay there again.

review.title: Great hotel, affordable, close to union square
review.reviewText: We dealt with Vincent, Jasmine, and Chris during our stay. They were extremely kind and helpful. The hotel is just a few blocks north of union square (and Powell St. BART stop) and a few blocks SW of Chinatown. Very good location. Easy to get around to touristy places with many bus stations nearby. Good amount of restaurants, shopping, convenience stores, and "must-dos" in a very small radius. We booked this hotel because the pictures looked clean and it was within our price range. They have a free wine hour 5-6pm (at least while we were there). Breakfast was not included, but we just ate leftovers from our dinner the night before.
review.positiveRemarks: clean, fresh, kind staff, location, wine hour, affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast..? we did not have a car, but if you do, parking is not cheap...

review.title: Nice place to stay.
review.reviewText: The internet was the worst part of the hotel, I could hardly get connected. Other than that I did not have much problems.

review.title: Nice Location for the price
review.reviewText: Very close to Union Square. Great hotel for short business trips in city without paying a huge night rate. $14 shuttle to the airport is great.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from Chinatown and three blocks from Union Square

review.positiveRemarks: Good location, reasonable parking cost (for San Francisco), charming building and rooms. VERY comfy bed. Very quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: The Wi-Fi is terrible! So bad that it took google about 5 mins to load.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Squar (2 blocks), 1/2 a block from the Powell St trolley. Lots of good shopping, good food, easy trolley trip to Fisherman's Wharff.

review.title: Close proximity
review.reviewText:
We were near Union Square and close to all our activities. The hotel staff was very attentive and helpful.
Our room was a little worn looking but very comfortable. There was a heavy handed use of air freshener in the hallway. But I stay there again!

review.positiveRemarks: The fact that they pay too much to Expedia for commission off of their hotel rooms and don't allow last minute cancellations.

review.title: The room could be better
review.reviewText: I didn't like the room, small. The breakfast is not included and it is really difficult parking a car in this region

review.title: The staff at this hotel was beyond terrible.
review.reviewText: I arrived at the hotel for my check in and was told that they had me booked for 3 rooms, I informed them that I had only booked 2 rooms. I was then not so pleasantly greeted by the Reservations Manager, Ariel. Ariel informed me that "well somebody has to pay for the 3rd room." I told her that I absolutely would not because I had only booked 2 rooms. She then made me work it out with Expedia rather than her calling to fix her own issue. From there you would think they would start being more polite to me after realizing that it was a conflict between them and Expedia rather than anything to do with me or my own error. Instead I was still talked to in an incredibly rude manner, followed by me checking my bank account to find out I was charged for all 3 rooms. Upon going downstairs the next morning there was another super rude employee (female, blond short hair) that was almost as bad as the Reservations Manager. Overall, this establishment definitely does not put the customer first. At least I was finally refunded for the third room, I will never stay at this hotel again and I certainly would not recommend it to a single person.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer Service
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, San Francisco. Lots to do, great area.

review.negativeRemarks: Soundproof from outside

review.title: Good value & good location to Union Square.
review.reviewText:
Overall my stay at this Hotel was ok. The only reason I was somewhat disappointed was my fault. I missed the word "vintage" in the name of the hotel.
The staff was very friendly and helpful and my room was clean.

If you are aware that this is a "vintage" hotel and that is what you are looking for, then you will not be disappointed.

I have to say it was a good value for me but the parking fee was a bit too much, in my opinion. Yes, we have to pay the parking fee at all the SF hotels but the set- up for valet was not worth the fee.
review.negativeRemarks: Update the furniture and make sure that housekeeping is vacuuming under the night-stands. I could tell that my room had not been vacuumed under there.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText:
Having read the previous mixed reviews, I couldnt make up my mind about this hotel, so I thought I would give it the benefit of the doubt. I stayed at the hotel for three nights, and still cannot make up my mind about it. Here is what I think.

Positive experience:
1. It is situated in an excellent location (Union Square).
2. The Hotel offers value for money.
3. Staff members were generally friendly, especially front house staff
4. My room was specious enough, and clean.
5. There was no noise in my room that woke me up in the middle of the night.
6. Snacks in the room and a range of drinks
7. Happy hour reception.
8. Free internet service

Negative Experience
If you make a mistake, there is no caring culture, and you would have to own any mistake you make. I had the wrong booking dates on Expedia and wanted to stay at the hotel for one more night, I have been told to pay 150% more for the night. No discretion! No discount! On two occasions, I have been told to speak with the Booking manager in the next day. When I came back to reception, the response I got was unsympathetic; all the previous smiles suddenly seemed superficial. I was asked if I was going to pay up for the extra night (since this was a very busy New Years night!!!), instead I checked out! 1. The Hotel has 3 stars; dont expect a 5 star service!
If you are the kind of customer who would be annoyed by small things going wrong, then probably you should consider elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Value for money (except busy nights!). Super location.
review.negativeRemarks: There is enough connection to read and response to your emails and check out stuff, but frequent disconnections were common. This should be fixed!

review.title: totally a vintage feel & smell
review.reviewText: hotel staff friendly and helpful. it was our second time here and we enjoy our stay here. the rooms are small and bed were pleasing. Not much of a view but the ac works and the windows open but you can hear all the city noise or a view of your nieghbor so i suggest to close your blinds. when they say vintage totally have the vintage smell but eventually the smell will rub off on you. I would totally recommend this hotel to my friends but nothing fancy.
review.positiveRemarks: close to china town and across the st you can see union square and about couple blocks you can hit the pier walking distance
review.negativeRemarks: the restroom were small and cracks in the wall
review.locationRemarks: union square china town

review.title: Close to Union Square and Chinatown!
review.reviewText: Small but nice rooms. Bathroom shower a little dated but that's it. Would stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: Update the shower/bathroom

review.title: Too expensive, small rooms, unreliable internet
review.reviewText: The staff greeted me with a smile, but that was probably the only good part about my stay. The rooms are small, not very clean, conditioner was very noisy, even though my room was not facing the street. The internet broke several times (it was completely out for a couple of evenings) and the stuff was not able to help me. The location is good. Free coffee and happy hour were good, too, although I was not able to attend any of the happy hours (from 5 to 6pm - was too busy with other things). The greatest disappointments - dirty rooms and BAD internet.
review.positiveRemarks: Happy hour, free coffee in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms, internet.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right next to the Union Square, there's plenty to see and do - e.g. Starlight Room on top of Francis Drake Hotel.

review.title: I will go back!
review.positiveRemarks: Great location. Has all the amenities I want for a good price.

review.title: It's a good place, but parking is not free.
review.reviewText: Stay 2 nights at here. It's a nice place, friendly staff, clean room. Just one thing, the parking is not free, and the parking lots is not in the hotel, is one block away.

review.title: Nice Hotel that was close to everything
review.reviewText: I was visiting San Francisco for work and ended up being able to fly in a day before my event started. So I only stayed at this property for one night. It was a great value. It is very close to Union Square, the cable cars pick up right outside! The room was very clean and comfortable. They even have free wi-fi! I would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square shopping and great restaurants.

review.title: San Fran trip
review.reviewText: Waaaaaay too noisy! I could hear the guy singing in the shower in another room! Noise all night. And too much light!

The hotel smelled old and musty! The hotel is old but, I expected it not smell like so bad! The hotel front desk staff was borderline rude. My husband and I just had to laugh at the rude comment the gap made.

review.title: Hotel on the hillside. Good for weak legs.
review.reviewText: Friendly staffs with smile
review.positiveRemarks: staffs are very friendly and responsive - need a shower cap, just call and come within 5 minutes
review.negativeRemarks: Ventilation in the bathroom, fixture updates, toilet bowl too small and too low, still flush with 3 gpf,
review.locationRemarks: Good shopping around and good restaurants with variety of foods.

review.title: The hotel provided excellent server
review.reviewText: One of the hotel service persons called my room to ask if I needed airport shuttle service. They went on to arrange for the pickup and dropped off the paperwork to my room. I didn't need to do anything beyond showing up at the pickup point at the scheduled time. I thought this was great and proactive service by the hotel. The staff were really friendly in terms of checking in/out and safeguarding my bags while I was away for the day.

review.title: Close to China Town, cable cars, Union Square
review.reviewText:
The price is right, close to so much. The beds are really comfortable! Advise breakfast down the street at the corner. For the same price, it is fresh baked, not warmed up.
Love the early 1900's architecture with furnishings mimicking art deco ambience. Also, wine each evening for free in there lobby, nice way to wind down after a hard day.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve waiter service and food for breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf, 2 blocks to Chinatown, cab to North Beach and great Italian restaurants.

review.title: Laundromat on the same block
review.reviewText: I have thrilled to find out that there was a laundromat on the same block some 30 second walk from the hotel enterance. $2.50 to wash (40 minutes) $0. There are also lot of places to each nearby which some places you can get discounts by getting the coupon from the hotel. 5 to 6pm wine tasting in the cozy lobby was a nice touch.

review.title: Enjoyed my trip!
review.reviewText: Great location. Seemed to be close to everything lots of good restaurants around the area. It was very convenient. I REALLY enjoyed the hotels social hour between 5-6. I was there for business, and after working a long day, it was really fun to have a glass of wine and chat with other guests. I enjoyed this daily ritual much more than I expected. Thank you!
review.negativeRemarks: It is an older building, so it wasn't a perfect room but given the age, it was nice.

review.title: Great Location & Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. It is very affordable, especially considering it's AWESOME location. Easy walk to plenty of restaurants, cable car stop, and shopping! Concierge staff was very friendly & knowledgeable about the area... I never even had to ask for help, they were always ready and willing to share tips. Rooms were comfortable & clean.
review.locationRemarks: Cable Car Stop, Shopping, Breakfast, Chinatown

review.title: We had bad night.
review.reviewText: We have bad experience.we never use expedia for reservation, this first and last time we use expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Room has bad smell, 2.30 am loud talk,dirty room.
review.locationRemarks: Nothing to tell

review.reviewText: close to china town and many restaurants. lovely hotel

review.title: Very nice hotel: price, location ,staff etc.
review.reviewText:
Very satisfactory. The hotel exceeded my expectations based upon earlier reviews that I read.
The staff was great especially Bader and the gentleman who handled our "check-in."

I have two complaints: the TV was very difficult to operate and there was insufficient " hot water" at times.
review.positiveRemarks: It's condition, the staff, location and the evening wine tasting experience.
review.negativeRemarks: TV, Hot Water and the Breal fast selections were not appealing.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal

review.title: Very close quarters for the price!
review.reviewText: For the price, I would have thought the room would have had more room. The bathroom was really small.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff we're very helpful and accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: If you ask for a room with two beds, there should be enough room to stretch out.

review.title: How bad can it get?
review.reviewText:
The hotel was like a time warp to the past. Air Conditioner was stuck in a window, open to outside, and leaded cold air around it. Heater was a baseboard unit, with wiring obviously hidden under carpet, and on/off controls at floor level, and while in English, were a mystery as to use. Called for help with heater. Staff could not get it working, so brought me a small plug in heater, like I have in my office, and placed it on the desk, unmindful of the fire danger.

No room service. Restaurant only open for 'breakfast', which was an inexpensive joke. Hot, i.e., warm chocolate was the kind made with water--could not even choke it down. No lunch, no dinner. When room was serviced in my absence, tiny wet-bar snacks were not replaced, nor were soft drinks, even after I asked for them to be.

Overall, a blast from the past, and not a good one. Avoid this dump at all costs.
review.negativeRemarks: TEAR IT DOWN, BUILD A NEW ONE.
