review.locationRemarks: NOTHING, UNLESS YOU WANT TO WALK 2 BLOCKS DOWN STEEP HILL TO UNION SQUARE. REMEMBER, WHAT GOES DOWN, ALSO GOES BACK UP.

review.title: Old hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText: This Hotel is old but it is not badly maintained. Staff is friendly. Located in downtown San Francisco near Union Square and Chinatown.

review.title: A great classic!!
review.reviewText: Upon booking this hotel I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. True this isn't the Ritz but it is in itself a great hotel with a lot of history in it. The hotel staff was so wonderful and helpful. The rooms were comfy and clean. Yes the building is old but that adds to the charm of staying in downtown SF. I encourage everyone to book this hotel without hesitation! It is a great deal for the price and is now my new favorite place to stay in SF.

review.positiveRemarks: The staff are really helpful and was able to give us information. Thanks to Connie!
review.negativeRemarks: We couldn't really sleep cause the bed was itchy!

review.title: Great location safe & central
review.reviewText: Typically San Fran quaint hotel loved it wine tasting hour brilliant chance to meet other travellers so easy to hop on the Powell street cable car all the way to the bay also easy access to Union Sq. fantastic local cheap restaurants especially Italian on corner of Powell & Bush loved the whole thing $40 pn for valet parking we thought it was worth it could leave car there after check out which meant more chance to shop & sightsee

review.title: Great Service
review.reviewText: Great service at this hotel and comfortable rooms. The room was a bit musty smelling and the stay could be improved by eliminating whatever is causing that.

review.title: Good location, parking is very close by
review.reviewText: Good location, parking is very close, however I questioned the cleanliness of the room. When I told the front desk, it was immediately fixed.

review.title: Smells old
review.reviewText: Everything about this hotel smells old - the lobby, the elevator, but especially the rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Clean, comfortable, reasonable, central hotel
review.reviewText: Location and rate were very good; paid parking was reasonable for the city; who doesn't like nightly wine reviews!
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly and helpful providing local directions, sites, recommendations.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioner is window based so a bit noisy and takes time to affect the full room, but it did do the job.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square, shopping, restaurants, theatres, financial district, cable car lines, easy access to Fisherman's Wharf & Golden Gate Bridge

review.title: Nice overall.
review.reviewText: The staff was amazing. Hospitable, helpful, and patient.

review.title: great location, rooms small breakfest expensive.
review.reviewText: I know it was I season for San Francisco but the price given the room size and the very small brath room seem very pricey. Very good staff, very helpful. Hotel was very european with no AC in main lobby and seating area.
review.negativeRemarks: It would be nice to know room size before hand for the price.

review.title: Great location inbetween china town and downtown
review.reviewText: Great locations if you like to walk everything is walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was awesome slept like a baby
review.negativeRemarks: It's an old building restroom and walls has crack etc but other then that it was great atmosphere
review.locationRemarks: China town and shopping great locations

review.title: Red Sox Vacation
review.reviewText: Our trip was specifically to watch the Boston Red Sox play the Giants. We were able to fit in tourist things such as the Golden Gate Bridge, Sausalito, Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown and Union Square shopping as well as attend 3 baseball games. The staff was extremely helpful in booking tours and giving advice about how to get to AT & T Park. Although we weren't able to attend every night of wine tasting, it was a neat way of seeing other guests and lots of fellow Red Sox fans who were staying at the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: We especially liked the close proximity to Chinatown and Union Square.

review.title: Nice htel close to china town
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the centre of San Francisco (walking distance from Chinatown) serving complementary wine every night from 5pm to 6pm.

review.title: Nice Hotel close to the City.
review.reviewText:
We found the Hotel to be very comfortable and relaxing. The location of the hotel provides the ease of travelling throughout the city.
A great treat that is provided by the hotel is the 5 pm to 6 pm wine tasting. The hotel feature wines that are very good and an environment that invites you to mingle with folks from all over the world. We would recommend this hotel to those visiting San Francisco and enjoy walking about the city.
review.positiveRemarks: We loved the Vintage Charm of the hotel and the extremely accommodating staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Sprucing up the rooms a little more. The carpets in the room we stayed in needed cleaning.
review.locationRemarks: The Hotels location is very close to Center city, Chinatown and Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Staff we very helpful
review.reviewText: Very good experience, the hotel is centrally located by favorite sites.
review.negativeRemarks: do away with late checkout fee
review.locationRemarks: The best part of the hotel is the location.

review.title: Very central. Easy access to shops, eateries etc
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay, old and interesting decor. But needs updating especially the bathroom. Also need more variety for breakfast as the hotel offers the same three options everyday which is not very wide.
review.positiveRemarks: Decor was quaint and location was central enough.
review.negativeRemarks: Update bathroom and lounge area.
review.locationRemarks: Chinatown is nearby, so too is Powell street where one can hop on a cable car. Easily access major shopping malls and shops.

review.title: Pick a better one
review.reviewText: It's not that awful but it smells very bad!!! The staff is not nice at all

review.title: Beautiful!
review.reviewText: Amongst I have seen. Certainly a top quality hotel!
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent customer service from warm, friendly and respectable hotel staff.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: Rich with culture and history. I needed more days to explore them all. I must return.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Ive stayed here before in 2012 & my room & experience was better then. This time the room was smaller & different style. It was ok. The rooms need to be updated. The a/c was very noisy, like a plane or helicopter sound. There is 1 elevator so it could take forever sometimes. The staff is friendly. The free wine reception in the evening is nice to have. Just basic wine nothing fancy. Location of the hotel i like because walkable to many places.
review.negativeRemarks: A/c

review.title: Perfect balance price and confort
review.reviewText: The best: location. Near to Union Square, China Town, etc. Great choice!

review.title: Wear some flowers in your hair!
review.reviewText: We stayed for 3 nights in July 2013. A good central location close to Chinatown and Cable Cars. Not far from the waterfront and Fishermans Wharf area. Good eating places around the hotel. We found the hotel a little musty but the reception staff were excellent and very accommodating. Nice touch with the wine happy hour from 5-6pm and coffee/tea available in lobby area from 6.30am. Good advice from reception secured us tickets to a tour of Alcatraz Island which is generally booked out for weeks in busy periods.
review.negativeRemarks: Bit musty
review.locationRemarks: Nice and central

review.title: A Classy City Break
review.reviewText: Great location, good service, compact but clean and classy room, free wifi and safe in the room, complementary wine each evening in the hotel lobby, friendly and helpful staff - all in all an ideal place to stay in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is in a great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast is not included in the price you pay and is quite expensive.
review.locationRemarks: The Location is brilliant! close to the gates of China town and 2 blocks away from union square. A safe area to walk around at night.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: Ok hotel, loud air conditioning...but great location!
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Union Square, China Town, Cable cars. Walking distance to everything downtown

review.title: Misleading hotel ratings, even the bad ones!
review.reviewText: The room smelled like wet dead people lived there and the bed had to be made of sheet metal. The a/c sounded like the furnace from Home Alone and was a sleep monster bc you can't sleep with that much noise. Took a cancellation fee just to get out of here. Staff was unpleasant at best as a whole, one or two were okay. Worlds smallest bathroom, sink, shower. Horrible experience so much so that I spent over 1k just to book a 4.5 star hotel for the rest of the holiday weekend. Not a bad location but not a good one.
review.negativeRemarks: Get a new building and a new staff.
review.locationRemarks: Union square down a few blocks

review.title: Short stay San Fran.
review.reviewText: Room was well appointed and hotel is in a great location. 40 metres to Cable Car. Close to the city centre and China Town. Laundromat very close by and a supermarket across the road. Hotel had wine tasting every afternoon. Very well recognised restaurant located next door to hotel.

review.title: Very old hotel, with very small rooms.
review.reviewText: The staff was very pleasant, and always prepared to help one.
review.negativeRemarks: Renew it.
review.locationRemarks: Very well located.

review.title: Nice hotel - staff cares - needs renovation
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay, but the hotel does need to be renovated.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need some repairs and updates - time to renovate!
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Good Convenient Lodging for the Cheap Tourist
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a very convenient location for tourists. I thought the front desk area was nice and the hotel had a charming antique atmosphere. I appreciated the unique brand of toiletries provided. Although I realize the building is old, there was a noticeable musty smell to the room that was unpleasant and tile floor in the shower was also really worn and perhaps cracked and unpleasant as well. I would have been nice to have more space on the rack in the shower or perhaps have another rack to put our toiletries. It would have also have been nice if the hook on the bathroom was also lower or if there was an additional hook in the bathroom.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell and unpleasant tile floor in the shower
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Bed and shower
review.reviewText: About as expected. Desperate for a hotel and found this one on expedia. Way, way overpriced for the night but I would not say it was the hotel's fault. A convention was in town. The bed was clean and fairly comfortable. The water pressure in the shower was really good and the water was hot enough. I got what I needed but just paid too much at near 400 bucks for the queen room. No hassles with addition fees.
review.negativeRemarks: Interior renovation
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: smelly & noisy room
review.reviewText: the room smells like some rotten egg. Please bring your own perfume to spray the room. Air condition is working but noisy.

review.title: Endo Meeting Trip
review.reviewText:
The view from room was not good and the water was not warm enough in the morning.
Otherwise, a good Hotel

review.title: Well kept older hotel w/ great staff
review.reviewText:
Since night stay but I'll likely be back.

Besides the usual shoehorning that takes place when an older hotel attempts modern amenities, this hotel has very accommodating staff.

I needed late checkout due to an event in the morning. No problem.

But what about when I forgot to put the "do not disturb" sign up as I left at 6.00am, leaving my bag w/ the lobby staff? Even though they'd already cleaned the room? Still no problem.

Very pleased & highly recommend as a mid-priced hotel that has all the basics.

review.title: Excellent, "vintage" hotel. Very cool.
review.reviewText: The rooms were immaculate; ALL staff were remarkably friendly. Great location. We were able to find (paid) parking one block away. An all-around positive experience & I truly could find nothing wrong with our stay at this hotel. I stayed there with little kids, & the neighborhood was safe; the staff was enormously friendly & helpful; the rooms were immaculate. Worth every penny.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of everything you love about San Francisco.

review.title: Weird smell
review.reviewText: great location but the entire building has annoying smell

review.title: Nice hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Overall good experience for the money, good location, friendly staff, free vine tasting every evening.

review.title: great location but...
review.reviewText: Good Location! But the room and hotel in general have a weird smell.
review.negativeRemarks: smell
review.locationRemarks: very close to union square.

review.title: Great location, amazing staff
review.reviewText: The experience was great. The location is awesome, as was the staff. It's an older building, so you can't expect perfection. It was also relatively affordable, which is always nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Some renovations.
review.locationRemarks: Really great Asian food.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: First room we were given - air conditioning vents fell off when we turned it on. No air coming through until we removed the filter, which hadn't been changed/cleaned in years (if ever). We asked for another room. All rooms were very small; no dresser to put clothes in. Bathrooms were very small. No parking was available - parking garage was 1 1/2 blocks away and cost an additional $45.00 per night,
review.locationRemarks: Nobs Hill, San Francisco

review.title: Great hotel for couples
review.reviewText: Great location - walking distance to Union Square. Staff is very poliate and helpful. Will stay here again.

review.title: Right hotel given the right expectations.
review.reviewText: Very reasonable rate for location in San Francisco. Met expectations.

review.title: Hotel conveniently located in the heart of SF.
review.reviewText: Perhaps our only disappointment were the pillows, which were too soft. I didn't expect to have to pay for local calls but I was charged for them. It wasn't a big deal; I pay $6 for a few calls. The vent in our bathroom was "rattly" and needed repair. Wish we could've had a microwave in the room; but one was available on the 6th floor and there was an ice machine on the 4th floor. Enjoyed the complimentary wine and coffee. Also thought the centralized location was perfect. It was very close to Chinatown and Union Square. Loved the fireplace in the lobby and the fresh flowers. Also, loved the jazzy music #Diana Krall, Frank Sinatra, etc.#.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! Beautiful decor, nice employees. There's even a free wine tasting every night between 5 and 6 in the lobby. It is also very well located, near all the buses and a metro station. The only thing I would say is the bathroom is very small. Also, there was kind of an old smell in the room, but you get over it when you've stayed a bit in.
review.negativeRemarks: Very small bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Well located for public transit.

review.title: Concierge made this stay worthwhile
review.reviewText: The hotel was older, had a smell I couldn't quite put my finger on. It was just OK. The big selling point must have been the location. Loved the 5 PM wine tasting. The only thing that would make me a repeat visitor is Vincent, the Concierge. He did a tremendous job of helping us navigate the city, made awesome recommendations, and was just pleasant to everyone. I heard him dealing with a customer who just seemed like she wanted to be upset, but she couldn't stay mad at him. Customer service is his middle name!
review.negativeRemarks: The smell
review.locationRemarks: Downtown SF, close to EVERYTHINGS!

review.title: Credit card fraud
review.reviewText: The hotel charged things to my credit card that I have not been using (i.e. minibar, telephone).

review.title: So so hotel
review.reviewText: Room smells. If u have an allergy to molds, I'll advice u to get a newer hotel
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: Cute, small historic building. It definitely is an older building but it has its own charm. They keep it clean and as long as you are fine without the bigger generic looking rooms, it's a nice place to stay. The staff was wonderful and very helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything! You can walk many places safely and it's a great location
review.negativeRemarks: Some modern updates like air conditioning and not individual window units like they have now would be nicer
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, Chinatown, close enough the the piers, etc.

review.title: Good location & cozy place
review.reviewText:
convenient place to visit anywhere
I used for business and no problem at all

review.title: So-so hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location relative to Union Square. Easy to walk to and from the square and catch the cable car. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room smelled musty and showed its age. The rooms itself are very tiny and there is no security chain on the door, only the handle lock.
review.negativeRemarks: Musty smell
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Comments
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location. Two recommendations would be for the mini bar to have a price list as it is very over priced and the concierge to give more information regarding the hotel and room facilities upon check in.

review.title: Great location, near Union Square and China Town.
review.reviewText: Room on 6th floor had a funny smell. Promptly moved to another room on 2nd floor when requested.
review.positiveRemarks: Room is big enough for 2 persons
review.negativeRemarks: Bathtub too shallow
review.locationRemarks: Very centralized hotel

review.title: Difference between night and day.
review.reviewText:
The hotel service and overall appeal have declined dramatically sinced we were last there in 2009. I really missed Keith, the former manager. He made me feel welcome and nnappreciated. When he was in charge he made the wine receptioption a
truly festive affair, with him interacting nicely with the guests. The night desk clerk was sullen and arrogant, although the
day staff was great (particularly the veteran bellman. What I also didn't like was how ads for pornography were so available
on your tv menu. Maybe your European guests like it, but my wife and I sure didn't. And we're by no means prudes.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice lobby, wine reception, though not anywhere near as nice without Keith, the former manager.
review.negativeRemarks: Get a more friendly and respectful night desk clerk. Get rid of the too easy access to porn.
review.locationRemarks: Good location at the center of things in Nob Hill and Union Square.

review.title: Great Location, Enjoyable Stay
review.reviewText: We wanted a location close to Union Square and the Vintage Court fit the bill. The staff was very courteous and helpful. We enjoyed the afternoon wine tasting and meeting other guests. Our room was clean and comfortable though the bathroom was a bit small and the tub without any grab bars. The free in-room Wi-Fi worked great. We took advantage of the self-parking in the garage a block away at a good daily rate for the area. Garage personnel parked the car and brought it to us promptly. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay at the Vintage Court.
review.negativeRemarks: A mat or grab bar in the tub.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square and the Embarcadero and its restaurants and Bay Bridge light show.

review.title: San Francisco stay
review.reviewText: We found the staff very helpful, the room was clean and quiet, the location was very effective, the wine served was quite good, other guests were friendly and interesting.
review.positiveRemarks: It was helpful that there was parking nearby at an affordable rate. The staff at the parking facility were very polite and prompt.
review.negativeRemarks: Very little.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel had good resturants nearby, Chinatown was 2 blocks away and the cable car tracks were less than a block away.

review.title: Good hotel close to Unions Square and Chinatown
review.reviewText: A nice, centrally located hotel. A bit difficult to find in the general chaos of San Francisco. Parking is available one block away and difficult to find, particularly if it's a first-time visit. Be prepared for lots of driving around before you find a parking space before checking in! Nice open fire in the lobby surrounded by comfy chairs for those cold days. Very good restaurant in the hotel if you don't feel like going out for dinner. Free wifi, but didn't quite reach up to the 8th floor. Overall, good value for money in a very expensive city.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable staff. I appreciated the wine tastings in the evening from 5-6pm. Very good restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms were just OK and clean, and could be modernized. Parking was difficult as there was only one valet parking space outside the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping around Union Square. Take the cable car to Nob Hill. Visit Alcatraz. Eat dinner in Chinatown.

review.title: Nice stay in san fran
review.reviewText: Great hotel in downtown san fran. You can easily walk anywhere (if you are not afraid of hills!). It is surrounded by great restaurants. The room was actually large and clean. We had one of the rooms on the front over looking the street and there was little noise from traffic. The windows open for fresh air too. For an old hotel it is kept up really well. For the price compared to other around it is really nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Great cheaper hotel in san fran.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location and good value. The staff were helpful and friendly and the lack of a bar was made up for by the complimentary wine tasting each evening. The hotel room was a bit small and shabby and looked onto another building. However the room was clean. The bed comfortable and the shower worked well.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms need updating
review.locationRemarks: Convenient for union square, Chinatown and the financial district.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText:
The staff were really helpful with booking restaurants and cabs, The desk was attended at all times we needed to speak to someone.
Although a little dated the hotel was comfortable, but noise from early morning traffic was a nuisance.
review.positiveRemarks: The suite had a Jacuzzi which was a bonus. A reception provided by the hotel every evening, with wine was very welcome after a busy day sightseeing.
review.negativeRemarks: The lift was rather slow.
review.locationRemarks: Good location. Ideal for shopping, restaurants, seeing sights and for Union Square

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Really convenient to everywhere in SF. Easy to catch public transport to all areas. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Clean
review.reviewText: We were happy with this hotel, it was clean and comfortable. Need to extend the breakfast choices though.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and the wine happy hour
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast cahoices
review.locationRemarks: Good location , but be prepared for a steep walk up the hill.

review.title: Hotel
review.reviewText: Great for the hotel you just need to sleep in. Clean, pleasant but noisy and hot.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and uncomfortable nighttime temperature

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location, nice staff, pleasant rooms and good atmosphere. Free wine hour - what more could you want!
review.locationRemarks: Great location, easy to access all areas of San Fran

review.title: Nice hotel, shame about the concierge.
review.reviewText:
The hotel itself was in good shape, with clean rooms and good fixtures. The bathroom was clean and the shower was quite inviting.

My only gripe lies with one particular concierge who was very rude, sarcastic and made snide remarks not only to me and my partner, but to two other prospective customers. His tactlessness was unnecessary and made me feel like I should have taken my business elsewhere.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: It is very central to the city, good location, staff very helpful, the only down part to my stay was the bin collection each morning very noisy, but my room was facing the ally, other than that I had a great stay.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The wine tasting was also a very nice way to meet people as I was on a business trip.
review.negativeRemarks: Nose above me was bad.

review.title: excellent hotel, clean, best location, nice staff
review.reviewText: I spend there 4 nights by my own on the beginning of April, 2013. I actually spent some time. Becouse I needed the practice a presentation for a conference I was in. The place is clean (and I have high standards), the staff are nice and helfull (for exemple you can print whatever you like with no extra charge) and above all - it's 3 min. walk to Union Square (on hills) , 3 min. walk to China town. Very central, have restaurants, starbucks just mintues away. I really recommend it for everyone! !! BTW I don't know if they have bigger rooms for a family but can be appropriate for them as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing
review.locationRemarks: Central !

review.title: Decent hotel in superb location
review.reviewText:
The best thing about this hotel is the location. I easily got there by BART train from the airport (10 minute walk from Montgomery or Powell station) and I always felt safe in the area, even walking around at night as a single female traveller. My room, including the bathroom, was spacious and clean and in generally good condition. The free organic filter coffee and organic toiletries were a nice touch. The bed was new and very comfortable.

The negatives were already mentioned by other reviewers. Yes, the room did have a fairly pungent smell and I am not quite sure where this came from. I found it quite bad to start off with, but got used to it quickly. I suspect the smell has to do with the old plumbing. There also was quite a lot of noise, but I suppose this would not be different in most other downtown hotels. Overall, the hotel seemed quite good value for money compared to the hotels some of my colleagues were staying in. I have had much worse and more expensive rooms in other large cities in the US and elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell and noise
review.locationRemarks: The location is superb if you need to be in downtown/near Union Square. Easily accessible for all public transport and area feels safe.

review.title: Free wine tasting close to the cable car line
review.reviewText: I stayed for three nights at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court. Hotel is very well located, close to the cable car line and, from there, basically to all San Francisco has to offer. Staff was very friendly. Room was small but functional; it certainly falls under the no-frills hotel category with a fair price for the night. But then theres something you wouldnt expect in this category: a free wine tasting every evening! Overall, I was very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone wishing to know San Francisco from a very centrally located hotel, fair-priced, with the essentials you need (and you may include a free glass of wine in that list, if you will).
review.negativeRemarks: Very small room
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Comfortable rooms, unfriendly staff
review.reviewText: My stay here was quite comfortable. The room was spacious, price was affordable, and location great considering the cable car stopped just metres away, which took me seamlessly to Fisherman's Wharf, among other stops. The heater, however, was very slow to warm up my room which was problematic on a cold winter's night. But most disappointingly, the hotel staff (in particular the man at the front desk) was unfriendly, and plain rude. Upon checking in (after a 15 hr flight, mind you), I was told that my room wasn't ready, although I had requested a early check in. Then, when I asked for my luggage to be put away until my room was ready, I found them still sitting in the middle of the lobby unattended 10 minutes later, which irritated me considering I had valuable goods in there. But I decided to ignore the staff and go about my business, and I had a comfortable stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Spacious room, comfortable bed, generous amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Unfriendly staff unwilling to accommodate my needs.
review.locationRemarks: Central location, metres away from the cable car stop.

review.title: Small cozy hotel in prime location
review.reviewText: WE enjoyed very much our stay though the room was very small, and the sink was in a closet. The location is superb. The staff very kind and helpfull.I would summarize my experience as nice and cozy, clean and very well located. I will return to this hotel whennext time I visit SFO.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room
review.locationRemarks: Few steps from cable car stop. Two blocks away from china town gate. Five minutes stroll to union square.

review.title: Location. Comfort and Value
review.reviewText: Great location, old world charm in the heart of San Francisco. This was our second stay at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court. We enjoyed a few glasses of wine at the end of the day and just before heading out to dinner. For value and comfort this is our hotel of choice while in the great city of San Francisco, we cannot wait until our next visit.
review.locationRemarks: Close to public transit and within walking distance of almost everything.

review.title: Great hotel for the location
review.reviewText: The location was great for our travels. The room was clean and quite comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: none
review.locationRemarks: The location was just perfect

review.title: Spend the extra money.
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a great spot to see the city. It is an older hotel and somewhat shabby. I am taking into consideration the fact that hotel accommodations in San Francisco are very expensive and I picked it for the price. The toilet handle had to be held down after use, the phone didn't work and we asked three times for it to be replaced and the TV didn't work either until we asked for it to be fixed. It was very clean, but shabby. The hotel was built in 1912 and that is to be expected. I did not look forward to coming back to the hotel after a day in the city. The staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was shabby.
review.locationRemarks: Convention district

review.title: Outstanding value for money
review.reviewText:
Great value value for money hotel, we enjoyed it.
Oh and Rich, the was very helpfully with his local knowledge.
review.negativeRemarks: Room very small

review.title: It was alright
review.reviewText: Friends had told us to stay in union square, not knowing SF very well we picked this hotel since it was near Chinatown. Well, it is on the very edge of union square in nob hill right next to tenderloin. The area is a bit sketchy. The staff was wonderful, it's right next to the cable cars and the valet is a block away. The rooms are kinda small and strangely laid out. Their is an odd smell to the place and garbage pickup on the street was loud at 6 in the morning. There were only blinds on the windows, no curtains so it was pretty bright in the room early too. I'd pay a bit more next time and stay somewhere more central.
review.negativeRemarks: Loud and bright mornings
review.locationRemarks: Kind of sketchy

review.title: I would avoid it next time!
review.reviewText:
The room was freaking cold, even with the heater on all the time. I caught cold as a result...

Also some of the staff are ok, but not all are the best.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText:
Very good price/location relation. The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially with my orders coming almost everyday from Amazon, even a day before my arrival. The location is perfect, I was in San Francisco a week for attending a conference at Moscone Center, every day I went there walking.
In the evenings they offered wine tasting which unfortunately I could not attend. Should only improve a little musty smell in the hotel corridors. The room was very good and the cleanliness perfect.

review.title: This is a quiet hotel in a great location.
review.reviewText: The location is superb. It is very close to everything you need and transportation. The restaurant had recently closed but the neighbourhood had numerous good eating establishments.
review.negativeRemarks: no restaurant
review.locationRemarks: downtown and close to transportation

review.title: Great for everyone!
review.reviewText: We loved everything! The staff, the 5PM wine, all of it ...quiet room. Look forward to our next visit & your reasonable rates.

review.title: Could be better
review.reviewText:
As we arrived late, the room is fine for our one night stay. The bathroom is tiny as is storage space. There is smell outside in the corridor and the room we had (can't remembered the number) had a constant noise from the ventilation or air condition from outside. The bed was comfortable and is nice to have coffee making facilities in your room as well as downstairs in the lobby. The price we paid we cannot grumble.

If you were to stay, bear in mind the price reflect what you are getting.
review.positiveRemarks: comfortable bed and coffee making facilities
review.negativeRemarks: smell and small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: central but up hill

review.title: too pricey for what it offers
review.reviewText:
It is tiny; the room was so small we had no place for the luggage, which ended up on one bed as we squeezed into a full size bed. The sink is in the bedroom, so you go to the toilette, then very unhygenically open the toilette door to access water to wash your hands. The showe was made for someone 7" tall; there was no way to properly direct the flow of water, which made it truly uncomfortable. The second floor room had windows that looked at the bottom of a road, and was truly noisy.

Overall, I doubt I'll ever go back.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: not as close to Union Sq as it appears on the map, since you have to go 3 blocks uphill!

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
Great location, two blocks from Union Square and many other restaurants and shops available at walking distance.
What I didn't like was the size of the bathroom. To small, and very weird, but the sink is outside the bathroom, between the desk and the tv, why? I found that annoying.
The shower was dripping since the day I arrived, and it was never fixed, bad maintenance.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText:
Perfect central location for all sights and access to transport.
Requested quiet room upper floor away from traffic the week before and they accommodated us perfectly.
Wine tasting evenings made it very sociable and an opportunity to meets other guests you wouldn't normally see.
review.negativeRemarks: Cold in February but hotel provided extra heating
review.locationRemarks: Central and easy accessible to all sights

review.title: Nice location near Union Square and Nob Hill
review.reviewText: This is a small, older hotel, but in a very convenient location for most of what you're going to want to do in SF. The daily wine reception in the lobby is a nice touch and they actually serve and know pretty good ones. The lobby itself is actually very cozy and nicely decorated with a fireplace, the kind of lobby you actually want to hang out in. Staff very friendly and helpful. They sent a fax through for me and when I asked if they could just charge it to my room, they said there would be no charge. When one of our party got delayed arriving into SFO, they assisted with trying to find transportation for him. Rooms are clean, but are a bit small and dated (full wall of mirrors in my room). I was by myself so not much of an issue for me. Beds very comfortable. Some noise from garbage trucks in the alley late at night. SF is not a place to hang out in your room, so if you do alot of that, you might lean towards the larger, more well known chains. And larger prices! We got ours for less than $100/night, hard to do in this area. I would return to EHVC although I would suggest they consider shortening or changing their name to make it easier for people to remember. ;-)
review.negativeRemarks: Slow elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: within walking ditance of union square + chinatown
review.reviewText: smallish rooms, but within range of what you expect for a big city hotel. room not thorough clean. ice bucket not emptied of melted ice, dirty glasses left in room, not replaced with clean glasses.
review.negativeRemarks: maid service
review.locationRemarks: ideal for visiting major tourist sites in SF

review.title: a repeat visit.
review.reviewText:
First, the staff was amazingly friendly and helpful throughout our visit. The cleaners worked with our hectic schedule to squeeze our rooms in during times that suited us. All of the staff that greeted us - behind the desk, during the wine happy hours, or simply crossing paths on the elevator - all of them made us smile.

We've stayed here before and would stay here again.

We enjoy the free wine happy hour and used it as an opportunity to talk with many other interesting travelers staying at the hotel - some for business, some on holiday. It's great sitting around the fireplace and getting comfy on the couches in the lounge.

If I had any cons to list it would be the musty smell in our room, but that's one you find in many buildings of that age in that area in san francisco. My only other complaint would be the shower stall. It's quite small, too small too accomodate the new fancy showerheads that they've included. The shower aims at the wall instead of downward. It'd be fine if you were tall or average height, but shorter people will find the water hits the wall before it hits them. It's aesthetically pleasing, but doesn't work well in the space.
review.locationRemarks: great location downtown and close to all public transport

review.title: Not as good as I thought
review.reviewText: The room smells really bad, same as the hallways, you can hear your neighbors and people in the hallway, the sinks in the bathtub doesn't drain well, but it was cheap so can't complain too much, but I wouldn't stay again!

review.title: Fit the Need
review.reviewText: Two separate desk personnel were rude. Hey, you're asking me to write more, but I don't think I need say anything else.

review.title: price good for value
review.reviewText: this is a very old boutique hotel. it is good for the price and had a refrigerator and microwave in it. the room i was in had some sort of water leaking which they tried to say that water was dropped and they promptly cleaned it up but then it was back so something else was wrong. they park you car for you and will bring it back anytime, that was nice. the staff was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: the carpet smelled
review.locationRemarks: location is good and close to the cable cars on powell

review.title: Small, quiet and comfortable
review.reviewText: The lobby was beautiful, I wish my conference ended early enough that I could enjoy the nightly wine reception. The room was comfy and had personality, I loved that I could open the windows for air and the fridge was convenient. Every morning there was fresh brewed coffee in the lobby too. Staff were helpful in getting me into my room early, giving directions and arranging transport to the airport. They also provided coupons to excellent breakfast places close by.

review.title: Good value, great location and wonderful staff.
review.reviewText: Picked for price and location and was very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel relative to price. We had a great stay, the staff were very friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and the fact it was not a new cookie cutter corporate facility.
review.negativeRemarks: None.
review.locationRemarks: It is near Union Square, walking distance to everything.

review.title: Great hotel to AVOID
review.reviewText: From the beginning to the end, this place was bad news. We encountered a couple of issues in the beginning and at 6pm on a Friday night, there was not a manager present to take care of them. The staff actually present, could not make any decisions and it soon became obvious that they didn't care. Don't let the well appointed lobby fool you, because it is downhill from there.
review.negativeRemarks: The staff and the lack of management.
review.locationRemarks: Not a bad part of town

review.title: decent for the price
review.reviewText: Not a bad place for a reasonable rate for SF. The location was good for our purpose. Rooms were small but decent...a little musty. Nice staff.

review.title: Nice smaller hotel in Union Station area
review.reviewText: Staff is very friendly and the service was good. The hotel is old similar to the other hotels in the area. However, it is well kept. The room was large and the amenities were ok. Being a bit north of Union Station, the location was very nice.

review.title: Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a convenient, short walk to union square, but one must remember the hills in San Francisco, so it's at an incline. The staff are friendly and helpful. It is old, but clean. The best thing is the free wifi, which is rare in San Francisco. The only problem is the thin walls, so you can hear all the traffic in the early morning and also all the conversations from people roaming the streets especially on weekends, which makes is hard to sleep. Of course this is no fault of the hotel, but I would not recommend it for people wanting to sleep in.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls, street noise
review.locationRemarks: Convenient access to Union square

review.title: Good hotel for the price in a quaint part of SF
review.reviewText:
The room had not been dusted up high in months. The light fixture in the bathroom had quite a case of fuzz-head.

The toilet paper roll is in such and odd place that TWICE i knocked it into the toilet bowl. Yup! Two rolls wasted.
review.negativeRemarks: The dust up high.

review.title: Vintage Hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel was perfect for our visit. It was conveniently located to all the different modes of transportation and was walking distance to shopping, china town, union square and much more.
I would highly recommend this hotel for someone looking for a great location, great price and vintage style hotel.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText:
I find the hotel very convenient for everything I like to do in San Francisco. The cable car is one half block away. Chinatown is two or three blocks away. Union Square is four blocks. The muni and F line are six blocks. What this does is allow you access to the entire city for a very reasonable price.
I suggest trying the little French Bistro's within two to four blocks, the food is wonderful. Also try Oz, were else in the city can you hear first class jazz for free and have a great burger for under ten dollars. Oz has a bagel and a smear that can easily be shared by two people with the salmon piled high on the bagel.
Yes I will stay here again. If you want an extrodinary dinner experience, try Masa next door. Pricey but worth it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the happy hour.
review.negativeRemarks: rooms are small
review.locationRemarks: wonderful

review.title: Great business hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff. The noise from the air shaft was a bit noisy, but the the bed was comfy and the coffee was hot.
review.negativeRemarks: air shaft noise
review.locationRemarks: Just a block from Union Square. Local to SF business district.

review.title: conveinent and good value
review.reviewText: Execellent location. Quirky property. Staff accomodating. Room was old and musty smelling, but clean. Wine tasting is fun. Would stay there again. Good value for the price.
review.locationRemarks: very conveinent

review.title: Great Price
review.reviewText: Great location!!!!! Staff was nice and gave us a few vouchers to wine country!

review.title: Older boutique hotel
review.reviewText: A good hotel in a pinch, albeit the rooms had a serious musty smell. The hotel has done repairs in the last 1-3 years and some rooms are updated and some not. The staff are friendly and the hotel is clean. My major complaint was the noise level from the streets waking us up in the middle of the night. For that reason alone, I would not stay here again. As I type at my desk at work, my eyes are heavy. If they replace the windows I would return but again, if you're budget conscious, go for it but get a room off the street!
review.negativeRemarks: Smell in the room and the noise coming thru the thin and old windows.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Quick pleasant stay
review.reviewText: When I first read the negative review, I was pretty worried about my stay in this hotel. But as it turns out, I was pleasantly surprised by what I actually got. Although it is a little old, with the rates that we are paying, it is of fantastic location, friendly staff and comfortable bed. As we don't stay in the hotel for long, that was really all we needed. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want something reasonable in a good location.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage - there is better
review.reviewText:
No coffee machine on the rooms.
Funny smell in the lobby and hallways.
Wine tasting at 5pm was a nice effort.
Parking is too expensive $50 but probably is the same for all hotels in the area.
review.negativeRemarks: Funny smell
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Good hotel for a business or a family vacation.
review.reviewText: The hotel was older than expected. However, it was generally well taken care of. The rooms are somewhat small, but hopefully you won't live in your room when you visit. The complementary bottle of wine in the room was a nice touch. This hotel is well located close to China Town, Union Square and many other shopping areas with a short walk. I may even stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Traffic Noise
review.locationRemarks: Close to areas of interest

review.title: Great hotel at a very reasonable price.
review.reviewText: This is a great little hotel. Easy access to Chinatown, cable car line, and Union Square. Shopping and restaurants nearby. The staff was super friendly and helpful. Overall a great experience at a very reasonable rate.

review.title: Good for walk in SF
review.reviewText:
The location is great, 5 min walking from Union Square, and the stuff is very helping and friendly.
However, the hotel needs to be refreshed and fixed.

review.title: Weird smell
review.reviewText:
I was astounded by how much the room smelled! We couldn't pinpoint the smell, but it was kind of like gym socks? We stayed for 3 nights and it never went away.

The front desk staff (esp. one guy) were kind of stressed/unfriendly too...wouldn't stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The awful smell, customer service
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown

review.title: Cool place, lots of character
review.reviewText: Cool hotel, lots of character, good cheaper alternative to more expensive big names. Its an older place so a bit musty smelling but pretty cool and cheap. Close to shopping, restaurants, etc.

review.title: Convenient, but not elegant
review.reviewText:
The beds are very comfortable, with great pillows and comforters. The room was noisy, though, from the Bush Street traffic. And they need to put curtains on the windows, not just wooden blinds because the room was very lit up at night from the buildings opposite.

The staff is friendly, but it's the little things in the room that were odd: the hair dryer hanging from a metal wall fastening that looked like an outlet base, the A/C unit (which I used to block street noise) having a busted on/off switch, and a fridge that took up a lot of room so that the desk was almost blocking the doorway.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise and light at night
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks off Union Square

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location in downtown San Francisco. The room and bathroom were decent size. The wine happy hour each night is also good to start off the evening
review.negativeRemarks: No exhaust fan in Bathroom

review.title: Location and Staff
review.reviewText: Great location, close to union square. The staff was great and helped out. They answered common questions about the area.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location, let down by the rooms.
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in a great location.
Staff are very helpful and the evening wine tasting sessions were good too.
My room was a nice size and the bathroom was good, unfortunately they are very much in need of renovation and the smell from the carpet was unpleasant at times.

review.title: Well located, clean, but with a little smell
review.reviewText: It is an old, but clean hotel/room. But there's a little smell that you got to get used to. Very well located. AC was very loud, but didn't have to use it.

review.title: Nice stay, spotty internet.
review.reviewText: This was a very enjoyable stay for us. The location was very good. Close to everything and public transit. The only drawback was a wicked hill to climb in the last block. Not a problem, but if someone has difficulty with mobility, they should know. My husband's only complaint was that the internet kept going out. He had to use it in the lobby because he could not get a good connection in the room. All in all, it was a very nice stay and I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The room was lovely and the staff were helpful with directions.
review.negativeRemarks: Internet connection spotty.
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks up from Union Square

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText:
We enjoyed our stay. The location was close to Union Square, Chinatown and had easy access to the cable cars, which, at the end of long days of walking was a relief to be able to jump on and ride to within a half a block of our hotel. While this was a great location, only thing we found is that we were down by the Wharf alot and wound up there most evenings for dinner. While we enjoyed our stay; for a change would maybe try closer to the Wharf next time, (but realize this will be more expensive!) Building is also older & while everything was very clean and well maintained, there was a bit of a musty odor. I had read this in a previous review before our stay; so brought a candle & made it so we didn't even notice.
Great Hotel for the price!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, proximity to cable cars & transit, Chinatown, Union Square etc.
review.negativeRemarks: Older building that has lots of charm, lobby was warm and inviting. Room had a bit of a musty odor, but not so bad that I wouldn't recommend.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, convenient, clean & well maintained & price fit our budget!

review.title: Great hotel near Union Square and cable car line.
review.reviewText: A nice older hotel in a prime location. Easy to walk or take the cable car to restaurants and the wharf. I used the exercise room and got coffee in the lobby every morning.
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square and the cable car line

review.title: Very well located, small room and shower.
review.reviewText:
Good place to stay and visit the city, not for more than 3 or 4 days.

Very well located, which is its main feature. However, the room was very small, the shower and sink were in different parts of the room (one door for the shower and toilet, and another door for the sink). Both were very small too.

This hotel is perfect for tourist in San Francisco because it is close to main streets and Union Square, and its close to MUNI stations.

We didnt have the oportunity to eat at Masas but it seems to be very good restaurant.

review.title: A little run-down, but overall a good value
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. Room was a good size. Staff was friendly. The 5pm wine reception was a nice touch. Only complaint was that multiple items were not functional. Wifi did not work in my room. TV quality was pretty poor. The hair dryer went off after about 5 minutes of use. And the treadmill in the fitness room was broken. Basically, everything was just a little old and run down. But it met my needs, and it's not like I was in the hotel much. Also it was clean and the beds were comfy.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText:
Perfect location to visit all city's attractions and as well as for enjoying nightlife.
Easy access to transportation (including cable-car right a the corner).
Lower Nob Hill.
Staffs are helpful.
Bed very comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Room bathroom would need to be renovated. (But was clean)
review.locationRemarks:
Love the location.
Near union squareand Nob Hill.
Cale-car right at the corner.
Restaurants and coffee places nearby.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location!!!! We felt safe there. The service was great. The room was clean. We had a good time there:)

review.title: Would return again
review.reviewText: A very pleasant stay while in San fransisco. Close to everything and in a good area.

review.title: lucky surprise
review.reviewText: I was absolutely delighted with this hotel. Although I had chosen it because I was looking for the least expensive hotel that still had good reviews, and was within walking distance of the Moscone Center, one would have thought that I had spent a lot of money for this gem. The front desk person checked me in/out quickly and efficiently, and was always helpful with directions and transportation suggestions. When I had emailed some questions to the staff prior to my arrival, they responded quickly and completely. My room was extremely comfortable, clean, charming, and spacious. It was a very easy walk to/from the Moscone Conference Center, and I felt safe. Although I didn't have the opportunity to use it this time, the fitness room was right across was right across from mine, and they have a few nice machines, weights, and exercise equipment that seem quite adequate for use. I didn't get a chance to go into the hotel restaurant. My only complaint: on my last night, I called the front desk regarding a wake-up call and requesting a late check-out time. Only a voicemail answered, as the person wasn't there, so I left a complete message. Unfortunately, no one listened to the message, so I didn't get a wake-up call and I still had to negotiate the check-out time. That's important to keep in mind; however, I would definitely recommend the hotel.

review.title: Decent place for single travelers
review.reviewText: Cheap price for the location. Not the best rooms for the price. Feels more like a loft with a rest room than any type of upscale hotel / business suite. Showers were OK; decent water pressure. Location is the best part about this place. If you have a limited budget, this place might work for you. I would not recommend this place as anything close to a romantic getaway, that is not what it's about nor would it ever fit the bill. Single people would get the most out of the rooms there.
review.negativeRemarks: Did not resemble a nice Hotel Room; rather it was like a cheap studio flat in an older building; walls are paper thin; AC and views are a total joke
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location

review.title: Ugh! First experience but some might like location
review.reviewText: Quaint and good affordable location near tourists spots in city. Got there early and as anticipated couldn't check in. Jonathan on duty less than helpful but warmed up later. No secure place to hold luggage and no real bell to help. However luggage was left with tags and all intact when came back. Presentation at check in by Jonathan not as informative as one being given by Ken....See if he is on duty. Has info re: Jazz clubs n flavor of the city. Room with king bed tiny, but enjoyable except for window air conditioner which is directly across from the bed and loud. Kept awake all night with loud noise and econo mode was on n off in short intervals which for lite sleepers is annoying. Bed could have easily been put on opposite wall. Refrigerator in room a plus with snacks n drinks for sale. Tv had limited channels but since sightseeing little time in room. Wine tastin from5 to 6 a plus. Now for the bad part. On 8th floor which is it n elevator breaks down. Had to climb stairs night b 4 leavin. Told by mAn on duty would be workin at check out next day n if not help would be available in AM for luggage. Guess what elevator not working n had to call for assistance which consisted of one person who arrived after we drug bags half way down n had to be called back to assist with third bag. Asked to at least be comped for shuttle to airport . 28.00 and told they could not do. Something to be said for larger chains. Won't stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: People skills n interaction of staff except for Ken
review.locationRemarks: Good access to all

review.title: San Francisco in October 2012
review.reviewText: We had an 8th floor Queen bed room for a stay of 4 nights. Linen was excellent.Bathroom very modern - lovely shower and toiletries. Bed is comfortable. Staff, including housekeeping, were friendly and gave excellent. service. Room decor was so tasteful and in keeping with the period of the building. As first time visitors to San Fran. we discovered the location of the Vintage Court Hotel was very convenient. Short walks to Union Square and Cable car. There was daily Jazz at the nearby Oz Restaurant, a lovely french restaurant is just down the hill as is the historic Notre Dame Catholic Church which has a stirring choir and lovely service.
review.negativeRemarks: The slow elevator.

review.title: Charming with character
review.reviewText: Quaint but charming, with character. It is in an OLD building and is starting to show its age, but everything was in working order. Staff was a little standoffish, but once you asked them a question they were friendly and informative. I hadn't been in the city in a long time and the noise levels from outside, traffic, garbage trucks very early in the morning, etc... was a bit loud for my liking. Easy walking distance from BART straight up Powell street, but be warned the last block up is very steep but doable. And the hotel doesn't take credit but there is a cable car stop less than half a block away from their front door! Wine reception was very nice each night with an opportunity to relax by the fireplace before heading out for the evening.

review.title: Nice n Cozy, Very Convenient
review.reviewText: It was a good experience the room was nice and cozy. The location of the hotel near Union Square was a huge plus for us. The only con we had was the very small bathroom, especially the shower it was too small for even simple movement to bathe yourself, but we were there only for a short time. Also, the pros seemed to out weight the single con we had so we learned to overlook it during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom/Shower
review.locationRemarks: Small but convenient right in the heart of the city

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great location, helpfull staff, we will certainly stay there again

review.title: Decent hotel close to financial district.
review.reviewText: Overall a decent hotel, not the greatest. If you want to be within walking distance to some of the usual building in the financial district, then this isn't a bad hotel to stay in for the price. Pretty close also to Union Square. For some reason the sink is separate from the rest of the bathroom/toilet, behind a door... like it's in a closet. The bathroom/toilet didn't have a proper exhaust system. Room was a good size, more cozy that feeling cramped.

review.title: great value for the money
review.reviewText: For the money it's a great value in SF two blocks from union square and surrounded by foodie restaurants
review.negativeRemarks: the room smelled musty

review.title: Great location and experience
review.reviewText:
Lovely little hotel in a great location, a block from Union Square and Chinatown. A more boutique hotel than some of the big chain hotels around this area.

Our room was very clean, spacious (for a big city) and well finished. We had room 201, which is on a lower floor and there was no view, but really, you shouldn't stay in your hotel long enough to care as San Francisco is an amazing city.

The reception area was lovely, with free pc/printer to print off boarding cards, plenty of seating and a wine reception, staff were very friendly and helpful. Valet parking good value (again for a big city) and in lobby some lovely juicy apples free of charge. Free Wi-Fi was good quality too, as were bathroom and products.

We only stayed one night after 10 days in Tahoe but it was a perfect hotel to explore Union Square and Chinatown. I would definately recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Only slight disappoint was no view in our room (low floor)
review.locationRemarks: Great for Union Square (and shopping) and Chinatown. Hotel is on same street as Chinatown Gate.

review.title: Great little hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location. Friendly staff. Would definitely recommend!

review.title: Nice Boutique Hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location and close to all. I had my car valeted after a long day working and just went for a fun walk around the area. It's right next to Powell St. and the cable cars. The only bad thing was the toilet was in a cramped alcove in the small bathroom making a very uncomfortable experience. Not sure if all rooms are designed that way. There is also only a shower, no tub, so my wife won't come back with me.
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom sucks
review.locationRemarks: near Union Sq. and next to the cable cars

review.title: Affordable, friendly and you cannot beat the price
review.reviewText:
The staff is on top of everything! Very attentive and friendly. The location could not be better, two blocks from Chinatown, one half a block from the cable car, three blocks from Union Square and five blocks from the main Muni hub.
Masa, a fabulous French restaurant, is in the same building, a must. As a hotel guest you are treated as someone special and you are alllowed better pricing being a hotel guest. It is worth it!!!!!!!!!!!
If you looking for a big room, spend more money and see what you get. You're in San Francisco not living in a hotel room.
My wife and I will definitely be back.
We live in Mendocino, CA to find a hotel in SF for under one hundred dollars is unbelievable. The Motel 6 in Fort Bragg, CA is about the same price.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the wine happy hour every night.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise of the garbage truck in the morning. Stay on the east or south side.

review.title: ok fo the price on short stays nothing for longer
review.reviewText:
Well the big plus is the price and the location. Minus was that we had a bit of funghi in the bathtub, one of the lamps was broken and there was an awful smell in the room that seems to sit in the carpet or wallpaper and is present in the whole hotel. There were many small things that kind of make it feel less value. The details.... It definitely could use a round about renovation. Sleeping with open window fixes the smell but lets the street noises in, I sleep always with earplugs so no problem, sensitive souls will have problems here.
They offer a free wine tasting and warm drinks until 9am in the morning. However no breakfast. We didn't take part but for some this might be important
To sum it up for a fast stay it is reasonable priced (for San fran and if you get the unpublished prices) I would not recommend it for any longer stay.
review.negativeRemarks: smell
review.locationRemarks: well close to union square and 3 min from cable car that is the best transport. Who likes to eat in china town is perfect here.

review.title: Just what we hoped for.
review.reviewText: Our room was just what we needed - a place to rest after running around the city. The location was great, being so close to Chinatown and Market Square. The hotel staff were great, also.

review.title: Nice for biz trip in the Financial District
review.reviewText:
I was here for 4 nights by myself (business).
Positives:
1. Nice staff. I had asked for a room NOT on Bush St since I am a light sleeper. However, they had assigned me a room on Bush St, which looked very nice. I complained and they switched me to a room off Bush (a bit smaller, but quieter) and apologized.
2. Generally nice room.
3. Nice shower with a lot of high pressure water.
4. Great location.
5. Free apples and other refreshments in the lobby (I only got the apples)
6. Masa's restaurant is there. Expensive, but it's supposed to be very good. I did not try it.
Negatives:
1. Very noisy, if you are on Bush. Some people don't care. I do.
2. Blinds do not block light at all. Luckily, I was on UK time, so I would get up around 5:30, just as the sun was coming up.
3. Weird, unpleasant smell in the room. As if there had been a not so clean dog in there (I don't think there was a dog, but that how it smelled like). You get used to it, but each time you get back into the room it hits you again. Not good if you invite over a friend. I had read this comment before on Expedia, and it is definitely true (I was in room 611).
4. Lobby looks rather shabby, but there is a fireplace.
5. It is rather tricky to get a cab at times on Bus. On Sat evening it took a goo 20 minutes for the guy outside to flag one...
review.negativeRemarks: Bad smell, noise, light,
review.locationRemarks: Nice location.

review.title: Mold and Mildew stench problem.
review.reviewText: For the price and location I would never have expected for the rooms and common areas to reek of mold and mildew. We arrived early and our room wasn't quite ready. They offered us a king size room which upon entering was even worse with the smell. We opted to check our luggage and wait for our room. Chinatown is down the block and we returned in a few hours and our room was clean and ready and didn't smell too bad once we aired it out. We had no view and a garbage truck comes by really early in the morning (6-7 am)and being on the 6th floor did nothing to muffle the sound. The smell clearly is my only real complaint. And I would stay there again if I knew they fixed that problem.
review.negativeRemarks: Smelled, no view
review.locationRemarks: Great location steps to Chinatown and very close to all kinds of public transit.

review.title: Amazing for a night on the town
review.reviewText: This is an awesome deal for SF, with the wine hour and comfy linens in such a convenient place I would go back any day. The front desk brought us a free bottle of wine and gave us a room upgrade, they were so sweet!
review.locationRemarks: Central

review.title: Good location, but a little dated
review.reviewText: The hotel has a good location and is clean, but is quite dated in terms of decor.

review.title: 3 star hotel.
review.reviewText:
The shower door leaks from the corner of the tub every day after we took a shower. There is a coffee maker but no complimentary coffee bag or tea bags, which you might get from most of the 3 star hotel or motels.

There are ice water and apples in the lobby everyday, and a small fitness center, which is a plus for your stay.

When we checked in after 11pm, the front desk person was not too friendly and not too informative about bringing the cart back down, and about the parking garage.

Overall, this hotel deserves how it is rated, 3 star hotel according to the USA standard.
review.positiveRemarks: Ice water & fresh G.smith apples everyday in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: The leaking shower door, and we have to endure a wet, small bathroom during our stay.
review.locationRemarks: Good, 15min to shopping and China Town for food.

review.title: Exactly what I'd hoped for
review.reviewText: As a single traveler I was overjoyed to find that the hotel was easy to find and in a very safe neighborhood. The staff was kind and helpful and I enjoyed the evening wine tasting in the lobby. I would definitely return here.
review.locationRemarks: safe, convenient

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: Was a bit dingy. Room was very small. Location was in a bit of a seedy area. Just overall disappointed. But, the room was clean and staff was friendly.

review.title: Trip to San Fransico
review.reviewText: IT was very nice,cute hotel, staff was very friendly and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: Location, near shoping and loads of cafes, nice staff, very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: nothing
review.locationRemarks: IT was perfect!

review.title: Overall Ehhh
review.reviewText: Overall it was ok, nothing special, decent for the price. It's definitely no frills, no extras, nothing fancy. It's old, but decently maintained. The location is good, so's the free internet. Little things like no plastic bag for the ice bucket, the room key not working a few times, or no late checkout because they don't offer it, were annoying. The room was tiny, which I knew it would be small because it only had one bed, but it was dorm room tiny. Also, every room looks across a small alley directly into another room, so don't open your blinds.

review.title: Nice hotel--great staff
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a old building. The rooms need a deep cleaning--mouldings, walls, carpet, etc. Other than that, it was well maintained. The bathroom was very functional. A lot of hot water, good drains, etc. The bed was very comfortable. What really made the stay great was the hotel staff. The hotel staff was outstanding. I would have only excepted the level of service we received at a much more expensive hotel. The desk person and all other staff including housekeeping were friendly, helpful, and really went out of their way to make the stay enjoyable. The location is very good. Close to China Town and the Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: The need for some room renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent. One could not do better for the price!

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText:
We had a pleasant 3-night stay here. This is an older hotel without the bells and whistles, but it provided what we needed. Not the place for a light sleeper though because of the trolley cars one block over. However, noise from other rooms was not a problem despite being next to the elevator. We liked the fact that there were windows in the bathroom and bedroom as we prefer to sleep with windows open. There was an overhead room light which you don't see much anymore and a decent bedside reading lamp!

On the downside; towels are thin, elevator is small and extremely slow, and we'd prefer to have room in the fridge for our stuff instead of it being stocked with very pricey items.

The wine reception at 5:00 was a nice touch, but some crackers would have been welcomed.

The man at the desk at check-in was a bit snobbish, but everyone else was nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Windows that open, reading light, comfortable bed
review.negativeRemarks: towels
review.locationRemarks: excellent location--walking distance to most places (within 3 miles) and easy access to public transportation

review.title: pleasing surprise
review.reviewText: The ONLY issue was the old building odor in my room. I've had it before in old houses. It may bother some people.
review.negativeRemarks: smell
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: "All in all, more positive, then negative"
review.reviewText:
Located in Chinatown section of S.F. Built in 1912 but restored/updated nicely. Near most needs. Biggest grief was the paid parking at $34.00 per night, or risk being ticketed or towed if you leave vehicle on the street. Expensive restaurant on premises but lots of others a short walk. Wine happy hour is a lead-in to wine 'sales' so we skipped all 3 nights.

All in all it was a good place to stay, comparable to the zillion others in old apartment buildings. No free lunch, and no abargains in downtown S.F. or anywhere else.

BTW if you're squeamish, be alert as the entire city is flooded with homeless/beggars, while a very short ways away from the 'good area' is the mission district which looks as if it is a combination of a Mad Max movie, the NYC Bowery and a third world nation left to die. Sorry but you need to tell it as it is.

review.title: Worn but decent location
review.reviewText: Room was quite worn and past need to renovate. Noise from garbage truck at 5 was unfortunately amplified by back court up to room. Location is fine by union square.

review.title: Busininess Trip
review.reviewText: Old hotel building, stink of old apartment building, especially when you just enter.

review.title: Frequent Guest
review.reviewText:
My first choice of lodging while in SF. I stay there several times a year there while in town for business, and have brought my family for weekend trips.

Comfortable, friendly staff - helpful to visitors, good value, not snooty or fake trendy. Nice feel to the place. Convenient for dining and shopping. Easy walk to North Beach, Financial District, etc. Walkable to PacBell Park and SoMa.

I am a former long-time San Francisco resident.
review.negativeRemarks: Could have a bit better wine for the afternoon.
review.locationRemarks: Real SF feel, close to China Town, Union Square, Powell St. Good dining and bars close by.

review.title: Extremely Rude Staff
review.reviewText:
The receptionist on duty when we arrived was extremely rude (borderline racist) when saying that my picture ID, issued by a foreign country, is not accepted in the US. He continued to be extremely rude when describing the hotel's amenities.
I've stayed in dozens of hotels in the US with the same ID and never had any issues.
I do not recommend staying in this hotel if you like to be treated with respect and courtesy by the staff.

review.title: Good location and overall experience.
review.reviewText: Good location and overall hotel experience. Pillows were very soft. Had to call front desk to turn off fitness room TV at 11:00 as it closed at 10:00 and we couldn't get in to do it ourselves. Our room was close by and it was loud. They prompted got it turned off.

review.title: Okay for one night.
review.reviewText: Hotel room definitely needed attention. Buttons missing on the headboard. Location was excellent. Easy walk to the Ferry Building or Union Square. Close to China Town. The price seemed okay for a last minute booking. Valet parking was a little different since the guy outside the hotel was only parking for the restaurant and not the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Room needed refurbishment and valet parking.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Chinatown, a few blocks to Union Square and a brief 15 min. walk to the Ferry Building

review.title: All you need for the right price!
review.reviewText: great hotel location, easy access to everything in the city, loved the wine hour, staff made it super easy to get information and book our sightseeing times. Hotel is a bit older but clean and comfy. Will be back!
review.negativeRemarks: a bit noisy when the city had garbage day - but that is city life!
review.locationRemarks: easy but up one hill from union square

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little dated and the rooms are a little small but the location is great. A good value in downtown San Francisco. The staff was very helpful. The late afternoon free wine tasting is a nice touch. Would stay there again.

review.title: Executive Hotel
review.reviewText:
We picked this hotel because it was within walking distance of the Masonic Lodge, where a graduation ceremony was taking place.

Overall, our experience was good. Price is reasonable, considering the location.

Parking is an issue, as expected for all downtown locations. Even though the garage is self-parking, you have to surrender your keys, which made us feel very uneasy about the safety of our belongings. Nothing was stolen however. Perhaps this is normal for this kind of location. But i expected self-parking to allow us to keep our own keys, and be less like the valet experience that it was.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff helped temporarily store belongings after checkout, so we could see SF sites without having to load our car immediately. This was a big help.
review.negativeRemarks: Upon arrival, we were pushed by staff to quickly unload car. As a result, we forgot to get everything out. Had to go to parking garage to unload more
review.locationRemarks: Location was within walking distance of our graduation event at Masonic Lodge. That way we did not have to fight traffic.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The hotel was...okay. The staff was mostly very congenial and helpful. The rooms were just a little dated. The first day, the temperature outside ranged from the low 50's to the mid 70's and the room really reflected this variation, being cooler or warmer than you might expect in such a comfortable range of temperatures. The heat and air worked, but getting it to a comfortable range proved a little taxing. Also, the bathroom looked like it could have used a little updating as well. All that being said, it is not as if I worried about the cleanliness or the like, but it just could have been a bit more comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Some elements were outdated and in need of renovation
review.locationRemarks: Very good for conferences- close to Union Square and Chinatown, though about 1.5 miles from Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: This was our second time with this hotel. I believe it's a very good value. The older building is well maintained and charming. We plan to come back in the future and until we have a bad experience here, it will be our 1st choice hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed and very friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Not much of a view unless you get the right room.
review.locationRemarks: Close to terrific dining at reasonable prices. Also well located as a launching point to many adventures in the city.

review.title: Great Location
