review.reviewText: Perfect location! Fair price. Room had a musty odor but you got used to it after a while. Air conditioning was super loud but didn't need it much anyway.
review.negativeRemarks: Slight smell
review.locationRemarks: AWESOME for downtown. Close enough to walk but far enough to not hear the noise.

review.title: San Francisco Gem
review.reviewText: HVC has a great location and I have been staying there for over 25 years on my visits to San Francisco. The staff is very attentive, the corner room is great and the rates are very competitive. We love walking from the hotel up to Nob Hill to start one of our treks through town.

review.title: Location is great, little dingy now though
review.reviewText: A bit dingy, but the location is excellent for the price. It seems like something that was probably an upscale place 15 years ago, but they haven't invested much since then. Apparently they have some free wine thing in the afternoon too that I didn't take advantage of, but looks pretty fun if you're traveling for pleasure. Don't expect the world and you won't be disappointed.

review.title: Tight
review.reviewText: Bathroom was too small...I could barely bend my elbow in the shower...
review.negativeRemarks: Space n noisy
review.locationRemarks: Excellent

review.title: Best value and more.
review.reviewText: It's a great little place with a European feel (and often European travelers). Rooms are a little smaller but nice. It's just a few blocks from Montgomery and the office so it's great for my biz travel. For the price, it's absolutely worth it. Great service, although I haven't been able to take advantage of the restaurant or wine tasting...yet. I'll definitely be back as will my employees - I've made this the hotel of choice for our company when going to our SF office.
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee is good,but SO hot, I burned my tongue.
review.locationRemarks: I have to walk uphill a bit but the exercise is good. It's near so many things, very convenient.

review.title: Mother/daughter San Francisco weekend.
review.reviewText: Nice little hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Service equal to that of the big chains. Walking distance to most attractions. I would stay here again.

review.title: Great location, great value and friendly staff.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Friendly staff, a bit noisy due to proximity of Cable Car line. Overall well worth visiting.

Use the cable car for convenient transportation, get a City Pass and it works out a bargain.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and access to cablecar network.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise pollution, windows need upgrading
review.locationRemarks: Handy for Union Square and Powell-Mason cable car.

review.title: Small gem in SF
review.reviewText: Located within blocks of China Town and just a few blocks further to the Convention Center, this is a wonderful hotel. They provide a wine tasting every evening at 5, and a good time to meet other travelers.

review.title: Our OK Stay
review.reviewText: Older room. Room small, no view, could hear noise from street. Slow/small elevators, floors/stairs crickety. Staff polite, wine tasting pleasant. Parking is one block away. Go with the self-park rather than the valet. Convenient location.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Chinatown, transportation

review.title: Filthy, stinky, and rotting...
review.reviewText: The room was filthy, small and stank of decay and mildew. I could not stay in this space - my allergies and athsma could not handle it.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location, can get to all the main attractions very easy. Dining for every appetite is also close by. The hotel is older but clean. The beds are extremely hard I thought and the pillows were very soft and small. I would recommend this hotel to mostly couples and business guests as I think the rooms are too small for a family. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Arranged for hotel shuttle to the airport which was very much appreciated. Overall we had a wonderful stay.
review.negativeRemarks: the hard beds
review.locationRemarks: Excellent 2 blocks from China town, 1 block from cable cars and 3 blocks to major shopping... EXCELLENT.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Convenient Location, walking distance to Union Square, Old but nicely reonnovated, Comfortable mattress. and Wine related information at lobby. Plus, free tasting of wine between 17 and 18 daily.
review.positiveRemarks: Decoration. Classic look that is rare in my country of residence (Asia)
review.negativeRemarks: Pilow. Two types of pillows are offered, but none of them fits me/my neck. Better pilow can complement quality sleep.
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks away from Union Square. Very close to China Town.

review.title: Loud Hotel
review.reviewText: Overall this place is alright, but the rooms are very noisy.

review.title: nice place to explore Union Square area
review.reviewText:
Excellent location close to Union Square, cable car stop just a few yards away.
Friendly staff, clean room.
Free wine tasting at 5 pm is a good way to begin a nice evening!
ideal location to discover San Francisco by foot & cable car!

review.title: Great Hotel For The Price
review.reviewText:
The hotel has a great location, is reasonably priced. It was clean and the staff was friendly.
The rooms are small but ours was clean and nicely decorated. One strange thing.. no headboard. Since there was only one chair in the room you had to sit on the bed. It would have been more comfortable with a padded headboard. I had to ask for extra pillows. The hotel offered wine tasting and had a FREE workout area. We felt very good about choosing this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny room
review.locationRemarks: Location was excellent

review.title: A real gem
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect spot, very close to China Town and downhill but not far from union square. It is a good walk to Fishermans wharf if you like walking however transport is available. The wine tasting between 5 and 6 is a great idea as it allows you to meet other people and also prepares you for the night out.WI Fi internet was in the room and was very good. I can understand why some people have been coming to this place for over 25 years.
review.negativeRemarks: Bath towels pretty thin.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great, affordable find in Union Square
review.reviewText: Fun, classic, botique-style hotel right in Union square near lots of great restaurants, Chinatown, the trolly stop etc! We really enjoyed our stay here. Beds are just average semi-comfortable in the regular queen rooms, but we upgraded to the suite with a king and it was great! I loved that each room was named after a local winery!
review.positiveRemarks: Location was great, and they have a complimentary wine tasting in the lobby every evening from 5-6:30, and coffee each morning!
review.negativeRemarks: the bed was a little hard, but I am a bed snob so it may just be me
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for Union Square, Chinatown, and close enough to the wharf! great restaurants very close...Masa's in the lobby, Belden Place- Plouf was FAB!

review.title: Great stay!
review.reviewText: Quiet and comfortable room; helpful and pleasant staff. A great value in San Francisco.

review.title: Fun weekend at Vintage Court near Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location. Really nice lobby area to relax for the free wine taste every night or morning coffee and the paper. Rooms are comfortable and affordable.
review.positiveRemarks: Lobby is spacious with nice furnishings and good coffee and wine
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator, very slow. Grab a room on lower levels!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to shopping, the waterfront, Union Square and Nob Hill

review.title: OK budget hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in February.
Bad things 1st: The room was tiny and had stale, heavy, smelly air but nothing which couldn't be fixed by opening the windows which unfortunately were dirty with stains on the blinds, the toilet was not secure in place, on the weekend during morning peak hour the hot water ran out. There was no ventilation or air circulation in the room so we had to turn AC(only fan) on which made it very cold and very loud at night. The sink is separate from bathroom and located inside the room. TV remote had super tough buttons, we thought it was broken at first. Cleaning lady knocked and tried to get in every day between 8 and 9 am. There is no breakfast/bar at the hotel but plenty nearby. The restaurant (Masa's) was way too good/expensive for the hotel its at.
Good things: The staff was nice, helped us out with a few things, offered coupons for nearby restaurants. Wine reception was great perk - some nice finds there.
review.negativeRemarks: room
review.locationRemarks: great location right next to union square, cable car stop and china town

review.title: good value - very san francisco
review.reviewText: small room but functional. older but well kept. excellant restaurant next door and nearby. Very convenient to Powell St cable car, Union Square and Market street. Daily 5:00 pm wine tasting hosted by wineries on weekend - very nice.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText:
Great location, friendly staff, room size ok for me, maybe a bit small for American standards.
But very elegant and with a free wine tasting as bonus. Reasonable rates.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size
review.locationRemarks: Just perfect. a couple of blocks away from Union square, on the route of cable cars.

review.title: Not bad.
review.reviewText:
Ups: The room was nice and comfortable, complimentary services and free wifi were a plus, and the staff was generous to give us a late checkout. It was very clean, which is a necessity in San Francisco.
Downs: Greeting staff was awkward, and I couldn't tell if they were judging me as someone who wouldn't normally stay at their hotel or if the employee in question just has severe social anxiety. Front staff should always be warm and friendly to all patrons.
Also, some hotel upkeep is needed. Wallpaper was coming apart in the bathroom and the shower head was leaking all night.
They don't offer parking either, which is typical in San Francisco.

All that aside, I'd recommend this place for the amount of cleanliness and comfort they offer at their price. You wouldn't find a lot of decent places like this in the city.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable bed! Coffee maker and free wifi as well.
review.negativeRemarks: Tiny sink area, awkward staff.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from Chinatown and Union Square, however the closest parking garage is about $30 a day, and it's impossible to find street parking.

review.title: Great find in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: This is a nice boutique hotel in a great location. Perfect for a business traveler on a budget.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Sutter Stockton garage, close to Union Square and the Financial District

review.title: Something to be desired
review.reviewText: I looked like the room had not been updated in at least 8 years. The shower faucets were broken, there was one tiny garbage can for the entire room, and the TV was an old CRT with poor reception. For the price I guess it was fair but my room looked nothing like the pictures on line.
review.negativeRemarks: Outdated room
review.locationRemarks: lots of food and shopping options

review.title: Ok to stay, but seems the rate is still high
review.reviewText: Ok to stay, but seems the rate is still high compares with hotels with similar services
review.positiveRemarks: location is OK and hotel staff are good
review.negativeRemarks: room is little bit small, no breakfast but only coffee and apples, not value worth at this market price
review.locationRemarks: near China town gate and also the union square

review.title: Jan 18 trip
review.reviewText: The night of our arrival, I got sick and had to go home the next day. Not much of a birthday trip. It would be nice if I could have gotten my money back for the Alcatraz tour which was scheduled for Friday Jan 20.
review.negativeRemarks: Old
review.locationRemarks: Location was good

review.title: Very happy
review.reviewText: This hotel was incredible, the staff were very friendly and helpful, the room met all of our needs and the location was convenient. The evening wine reception was also a nice touch.
review.positiveRemarks: The lovely staff, value for money and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Having to leave.

review.title: Friendly and Helpful Staff
review.reviewText: Great location, price, and staff. Wine reception is nice.

review.title: executive hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice, best location in between Chinatown and Union square, the hotel service was good front desk very helpful and friendly
review.negativeRemarks: time spent there
review.locationRemarks: Best

review.title: Blah
review.reviewText: Bed was hard as a rock. Very uncomfortable to sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, close to China Town and Union Square

review.title: Good value and great location
review.reviewText: Good value for the rate. Staff was very friendly and location was great. Near shopping, China Town and restaurants. I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to go.
review.negativeRemarks: Old towels and mattress was a bit uncomfortable.
review.locationRemarks: Ideal location.

review.title: A gem in the heart of SF
review.reviewText: This is an older but well kept small hotel. We were pleasantly surprised that there were no musty smells as previous reviewers mentioned. We were immediately upgraded to a larger bed. The decor was beautiful; bed comfy and everything was in working order. The location was perfect. It is a block away from the Stockton Public Garage where we parked. Their parking garage was further away and required assistance for "self-parking". We did not need to use our car because public transportation and close walking distance to everything we wanted.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to everything we wanted to do without using our car. It was a small hotel, well-kept and clean smelling.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing.
review.locationRemarks: Fantastic location.

review.title: Why Four Season's rates?
review.reviewText: If you're looking for a boutique hotel in Union Square that is relatively cheap then look no further. They just renovated the lobby and it looks great. The rooms are outdated, however they are clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. This was my 5th time here in the last 5 years and it keeps getting better. The restaurant next door (Massa's) was awesome!
review.positiveRemarks: Free wine tasting, location, location and location.
review.negativeRemarks: Outdated rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect!

review.title: not recommended
review.reviewText:
I will recommend to go to another Hotel.

We have problems because one of the card keys they gave us didnt work. They didnt allow access to my wife, they even didnt want to give her back the card key until I arrived and the personal of the hotel was rude.

The room look old and didnt smell fresh...

For the price you pay you can find a better option to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: staff
review.locationRemarks: convenient

review.title: an okay stay
review.reviewText:
Pro - Check in was a breeze. Front desk was very helpful. Bed was comfortable. There's a fridge in the shelf at crazy prices. They have a map of the SF and know the surrounding area. It's located 1 block from Union Square. Easy access to the surround hills. It's very hilly around there too.

Con - Parking is a pain. It's located about a block away and cost 30 bucks a day per stay. You can pay for the parking at the hotel front desk. The room is small, but if it's just 1 or 2 people, it's more than enough space. The building is OLD. It has been remodeled. The restroom is very small and can only fit 1 person. The room also smells. I think it's because it's an old building. I can tell our room was not checked in for awhile because after 1 day with the ac and fan on, most of the smell went away by the 2nd night. I recommend that the hotel people turn on the ac or fan for their guest before they check in to alleviate the smell. There is no window at the 5th floor for me because the surround building blocks all view and most natural sunlight.

The rate is cheap but with the parking fee, it kills the value, but than again, you do not have to worry about parking if you check in here.

review.title: Find somewhere else to stay
review.reviewText:
Worn down, old hotel -- 2 of the 6 nights, the room heater didn't work. Mildew in the bathroom. Filthy windows -- no point in trying to look outside. Window air conditioner was not sealed, so in addition to cold drafts, all outside noises came right into the room all night long. Mildewy, urine-like smell to the whole property.

Convenient to union square.

Staff was OK -- some helpful; others quite indifferent.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell, noise, cold, old and not very clean
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to Union Square

review.title: Union Square stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good area in the heart of Union Square. Staff is friendly and helpful, and the rooms are excellent value (good price). I would recommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: No food service
review.locationRemarks: Good location in Union Square within walking distance of excellent dining establishments and entertainment.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The room was tiny. The sink was in a closet. The staff was rude and unwilling to be helpful except for the day we left. We asked for assistance twice and were treated as if we were a huge imposition and then were given incorrect information. The room was very loud with street noise due to its position in an alcove in the building. The noise funneled right up to our room. The day we checked out a new crew was working and they were much more accomodating. This hotel was a huge disappointment overall and misrepresented.
review.negativeRemarks: Size of the room. Rude staff.

review.title: Good location, a bit old, w/ disappointing service
review.reviewText:
An old hotel, so utilities might be a bit aged (only a small a/c unit and heater in the room with primitive, so not the most effective air conditioning. Likewise, the overall feel of the hotel seems antiquated in terms of decor and utilities (old, smaller albeit technically still flatscreen tv). Service of the staff was a bit disappointing, the staff seemed a bit lazy - the receptionist was hesitant to help me flag down/call for a cab, so we did it by ourselves (and had to walk a few blocks into a busier area).
Overall, the hotel was acceptable, in a good location (walking distance of walgreen, 7/11, also just a few blocks from Top of the Mark), but if I came back to San Francisco, I would probably look for a different hotel to get a different experience.
Of note, we missed out on the hotel's daily (I think?) wine reception, so that might have been a missed opportunity for us.
review.negativeRemarks: Disappointing service, old utilities.
review.locationRemarks: Great location by Union Square.

review.title: So cold room because of too weak heater.
review.reviewText: I stayed here in the end of Dec. My wife and I feel that It's so cold in my room because there has only small heater attached below where is between the window and the bed. I turned it on and waited for about 1hour, but the heater didn't get warm so much. I called front desk and front man said that he let someone else go to your room. But the man he said didn't come. My wife called the front desk again and he said same thing he said to me. After 10mins, the repair man came to my room and check if the heater was working. He said that this was working and getting worm for a while. I waited for 1hour again but the heater didn't get warm. After all, the repair man finally took the additional electric heater to my room. It took about 2.5 hours to resolve this issue. I will never stay in this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Bad heater.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to go to the market place.

review.title: very impressed would use the hotel again
review.reviewText: The staff were very helpful and welcoming upon arrival, arranging our trips and giving us ideas of places to visit

review.title: The difference between night and day
review.reviewText:
It is a rather stately old hotel that is starting to show its age. Front desk service ranged from very helpful and "eager to please" during the day, to "leave me alone" bored indifference at night. Apart from that, the amenities are fairly good and housekeeping staff were prompt and attentive when called upon.

The hotel is located in a safe and convenient area adjacent to Chinatown. Before booking I would review other options in this area. Worth staying a couple of nights!
review.locationRemarks: From our brief time in San Francisco I would recommend the area surrounding the Executive Hotel Vintage Court because it is seems safe and is close to Chinatown and Market street.

review.title: A nice hotel
review.reviewText: I have been to San Fran many times and have stayed a various hotels including the Sir Francis Drake which is about a block down the hill from this hotel. I loved the fact that the trolley stopped extremely close to the hotel. The staff was extremely helpful. As a female that was traveling alone, I felt comfortable and safe. I would stay at this hotel again for sure!

review.title: OK for the price
review.reviewText: Older hotel, with remodeled rooms. Main downside of my room was a sort of a sour smell, but it was not unbearable or enough for me to ask for a different room. I would probably go back if the price was the same. Fairly convenient access to downtown and convention center area.

review.title: A cozy and charming place
review.reviewText: I had a really pleasant stay and would definitely come back.

review.title: Go for the king!
review.reviewText:
We had booked a queen room and the windows looked out into the middle of the building and so there was no view and no light. The room was above the external aircon unit which made a constant noise. The darkness of the room and the lack of ventilation increased the mouldy smell which is unfortunately present throughout the hotel (no matter what room you are in). The room was clean however but the bathroom was tiny and in need of a refurb.

We asked about upgrading and were given a larger, more airy room (classed as a king room) with a more modern bathroom that looked out onto the street and had windows on two sides. The room was far better and we would certainly recommend paying that little bit extra for a king room from the outset.

The location is great, very close to the cable cars, shops and china town. The wine tasting was really nice and the staff were welcoming.

We would stay there again but would definitely opt for a king room.

review.title: Union Square Bargain
review.reviewText: The Vintage Court on Bush Street is well located to restaurants, shopping and transportation. The rooms are comfortable, clean and well maintained. While it is an older hotel, it is vey comfortable. I stay here whenever I am in San Francisco. The common belief that hotels in San Francisco are expensive is not true.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square has everything you want for a visit. It is close to the Wharf and the financial district, the walk to either is not very long.

review.title: Smell
review.reviewText: The hotel has a strange smell all the time , the room was so noisy, It was a machine all the time on producing the sound. The people that work in the hotel were nice.

review.title: Had a great stay in a great location
review.reviewText: We wanted a location close to Union Square and this was perfect. Lots of good restaraunts within walking distance and it was just up the hill to the cable cars. The hotel was older like we had read in some reviews before we got there, but it was kept up well. The 5:00pm wine tasting was a nice addition. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends. Might not bring kids here, but other than that go for it!
review.locationRemarks: Golden Gate Park, Chinatown for souvenier shopping, Alcatraz tour was interesting, Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: close to a cable car line.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price, close to Chinatown, Union Square & also Market Street for public transport. Was told that the area was quiet on an evening, being close to the financial district, but found enough restaurants/eateries & a couple of my sort of bars - The Irish Bank & Murphy's - to while the evenings away. Would use this hotel again if visiting San Francisco

review.title: Vintage Court
review.reviewText: This hotel was a very old building that smelled like moth balls. The room was so small you would bump into the furniture everywhere you turned. The shower curtain had mildew on it and was discolored. Would not stay there again.........

review.title: A good centrally located hotel
review.reviewText:
A small but efficient and welcoming centrally located hotel.
Everything was very clean and in good working order, though with only 1 lift and being locatedf on the top floor there was sometimes a short wait to be taken up/down, but this was not too much of an inconvenience.
Within 100 yards of the cable car, 200 yards from the entrance to Chinatown and about 400 yards from Union Square and with many eating places around this is an ideal hotel for the short stay visitor.
We would certainly reccommend to anyone and would definitely return if staying in San Francisco again.

review.title: Will return
review.reviewText:
I have stayed at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court a number of times in the past. It's a good location.

This last visit was for nine nights. The room I was initially given was small and dark. Knowing there are better rooms in the hotel (based on previous visits) but also knowing that a large conference had every room in town booked, I asked to be moved once the conference was over. This was done.

The room I had for the remainder of my visit was nice, bright and airy. I
appreciate the staff's willingness to accommodate me.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel is excellent. Close to Union Square and the cable car line. As there is no restaurant in this hotel you have to walk to find some breakfast, lunch and dinner but there are eating places close by. Hotel staff were very helpful and kind. I was travelling on my own and I found this hotel very safe.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText:
Hotel is in a great location. Our room was clean and a good size for a city. Didn't encounter any of the issues others have listed. Complimentary wine and coffee was great, so no need to use the coffee machine or fridge in our room.

Lovely diner for breakfast on the corner of Powell, and great Mexican a few doors down from there.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: For location this hotel is hard to beat. Right next to the Powell Street cable car and a short walk to Union Square, it's really easy to get around and there are plenty of bars, shops and restaurants within walking distance. There are no breakfast facilities but with so many eateries close by this wasn't a problem. I'd recommend Roxanne's on the corner of Powell. The hotel itself is warm and welcoming though the rooms are a little careworn and there's no view to speak of. The room attendants aren't exactly over zealous either, doing only the bare minimum and over looking details such as replacing broken bulbs and minibar items and failing to dust thoroughly. The room was pleasant and comfortable enough though and the coffee provided for the coffee maker was good. So much better than the sachets of sad Nescafe you get in the UK! Overall I'd recommend this for anyone looking for good value and convenient location.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText:
Vintage Court is a nice hotel for the budget traveler and is convenient to all the sites (2 blocks from Union Square, 2 blocks from the Chinatown gate/entrance, a block or two up to the top of Nob Hill/Grace Cathedral, and only about a mile or mile and a half to Fisherman's Wharf and the Ferry Building). The nightly complimentary wine reception was a nice touch, although I was only able to make it 2 of the 4 nights of my stay.

There are tons of great restaurants to choose from within walking distance as well. I recommend Uncle Vito's just across the street (if you go about 6ish, you'll might see the Brown Twins, they are a San Fran icon), Utopia Cafe and in Chinatown for their clay rice pots, and at Pier 1 and 1/2, next to the Ferry Building, La Mar for Peruvian cocktails (Pisco sours are great) and ceviche. Also, the "fast food" seafood shacks lined up together at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
Friendly service and really good value relative to its location.
Seconds away from Union Square and the major shopping area.
Everything within walking distance.
Really friendly staff. Nice idea of a wine reception in the evening.
Clean tidy and quiet.
For a few days - absolutely perfect.

review.title: Next to the best!
review.reviewText:
Will use it again. Its on the nice and picturesque Bush Street. Plenty of dinners around. And the best thing is a fine and exqusite dining at Masa Restaurant. We were absolutely spoilt in our dining experience. The 5-6pm wine tasting at the hotel lobby helps to break the ice among hotel guests.
Special mention to Bader (the concierge) who is friendly and deserve a mention here.

review.title: Jon P
review.reviewText: Good hotel in a great location. Would stay there again. Daily wine tasting was an extra bonus!

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: The staff was very helpful and I was appreciative of that. The hotel needs quite a bit of refurbishing and the refurbishing that is done is of low quality. There is not attention to detail or to doing things right. (no cover on light in bathroom, poor painting job, ugly patches on walls, poorly installed carpet, mismatched decor...) There was a lot of mold growing in the paint, wallpaper and shower of our bathroom. The chair and window seat cushion was threadbare and dirty. However, when I mentioned it to the front desk, they apologized and promptly and happily showed us two other rooms to choose from, both with remodeled marble baths. The rest of our week was a more pleasant stay. The wine in the evening was nice, as was complimentary coffee in the morning. The fireplace was always on but the lobby is not too cozy. For about the same price, I would better recommend The Larkspur two blocks away.

review.title: Aged hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Run down hotel but in very good location.

review.title: Cant wait to go back
review.reviewText: The only bad comment about the hotel is that the room smelled like humidity.

review.title: Terrific service, location, and price.
review.reviewText: Terrific service, location, and price. If they just took care of the mildew problem, this would be a jewel of a hotel.

review.title: San fran on the hill
review.reviewText: nice hotel, good restaurants in the area. try the mexican around the corner!!!

review.title: Good service, and location, let down by crummy old hotel
review.reviewText:
Quite a dated, old hotel and the hotel and room had a strange musty, old smell. We had to spray lavender oil all over the room to hide the weird odour...

The bathroom was old and dark, with very poor water pressure in the shower. Also, the wash basin was not actually in the bathroom but rather in the actual room itself (comes with old hotels I guess...). Further, there was also no fan in the bathroom so it made it very hot and steamy after a shower (not to mention, very smelly after the toilet was used...)

The room seemed clean enough, but because of the weird smell, it just didn't feel very clean.

The staff were all fantastic and friendly and were helpful when we needed them.

We booked here because it was affordable, and the location was convenient, however, I think next time I would pay a bit extra and get myself into a newer and more comfortable hotel.

review.title: Vintage or Plain Old?
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was very warm and friendly and its location was quite advantageous, a block or two away from the entrance to Chinatown.

However, the rooms were not only vintage but quite worn. Carpets, furniture, fixtures could all use replacements or repair. The bathroom was as small as a closet, so small that the sink was separate. The wireless internet service was finicky, and I wasn't given a password until a day after I arrived, after which the internet was still finicky.

If you're the kind of person who goes for vintage hotels, you might still enjoy it. But if worn-out, cramped surroundings grate on your nerves, then keep searching.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Comfortable, attractive room, clean, two blocks from Chinatown which is a real buzz, and handy to little convenience stores which sold enough for a simple meal and a bottle of wine to wash it down. Union Square is just down the hill, as is the Powell Street BART and buses. You could haul your bags the 6 blocks up the hill from the BART, but down the hill looks much more enticing. The hotel had a wine tasting from 5-6pm, showcasing Californian wine. The staff were helpful. WE were there in early September, so we didn't need the air con, but it was there. We'd go back in a shot.

review.title: Priced accordingly
review.reviewText: Located close to shops and Union Square. Staff warm and friendly. Noisy early morning from bin collection at back of hotel. Overall very adequate for price conscious traveller.

review.title: Quirky but charming
review.reviewText:
Location is half way up Powell - 2 or 3 blocks to top of Nob Hill. Room is older, small(ish) and quirky (toilet and shower in bathroom, sink and vanity in a closet in the main room) but clean, comfy and very quiet. Staff is courteous and helpful - free wine tasting at 5:00 is a nice way to meet fellow guests. The room also includes a power bar where you can plug in your cell phone, iPhone, camera, etc to re-charge batteries. This is something I rarely see but was much appreciated.

Highly recommend you pick up a one or three day cable car / MUNI pass for $14 or $21. It gives you on/off privileges for just about everything except BART - only place I've ever seen it available is at the booth just outside Powell Street BART/MUNI station. Considering the cable cars are $6 one way and MUNI goes just about everywhere, this is a great deal.

review.title: Good hotel for a decent price
review.reviewText: Some molding in the bathroom but overall nice hotel to stay in. Had only one main elevator so during the morning rush it took too long to come.

review.title: Great Service, good location
review.reviewText:
Pros: The customer service was above and beyond what I expected from any hotel. The area was fairly close to where I needed to be each day. I'm not used to the hills in San Francisco and with all the weight I was carrying it was fairly convenient to have a stayed close to downtown. Catching the trolly was really easy and convenient because it stopped right at the intersection which was not more than 20 feet away. Leaving a mess after I rushed each morning to applying make-up, I was extremely surprised at how well they cleaned the bathroom area. The hotel was very accommodating in storing my luggage as well on the day of my check out allowing me to do a little site seeing on my last day.

Cons: I didn't have an incredible view, but I was only there to sleep, shower and relax after a long day of walking so it didn't really matter to me. On the week of my stay, there was construction or repaving of the street outside the hotel which made it almost impossible to catch a cab and detoured a lot of people from even attempting to drive down the street. The Hotel is on a one way street so there would be many times where drivers would have to drive around the block to get to the hotel and it would cost me a dollar extra. When I would mention the name of the hotel to many people, Cab drivers, shuttles, tour buses drivers, no one would know what I was talking about, and I had to start stating the address each time I had to get to my destination.

review.title: Great place to visit.
review.reviewText: Very well kept older hotel in the heart of San Francisco. Loved the wine reception every evening. Great shopping, walking and sight seeing at your doorstep. Book in advance for the best price.

review.title: Worked for me
review.reviewText: Clean. Kind of quirky and cool, because the building's ancient. Room was small, but I didn't need any space (still had a closet and dresser). Price was right, location was right, folks were nice enough and helpful the little I needed help - storing bags for a day, answering some easy questions about the area. Free internet was great. Clientele were folks I didn't mind living in the same building as. The wine tasting was a cool touch, and was kind of a little mixer, though I didn't really have time to hang out and enjoy it. I really liked my experience. I have stayed in many budget hotels, and they're often scuzzier than advertized. This place was luxury in comparison.

review.title: OK Location for the price
review.reviewText: Great location. Staff was helpful. Dirty comforter. Mold in bathroom. Dirty windows and very dusty blinds.

review.title: Enjoyed San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: This little hotel was very centrally located. we jumped on the Cable Cars just a few steps from the front doors. We were able to get food just a few doors down in all directions. Chinatown entrance was just a block away. Enjoyed the free wine tasting in the evening if we were there. Great place!!

review.title: Not a bad spot
review.reviewText: Not far from Chinatown and other nice locations. Nice little hotel, not too expensive. Free wine tasting almost every night. Not bad for the price.

review.title: close to everything
review.reviewText: location is great. room was a bit small but i think that's typical of san francisco hotels. everything in the city is so close together and small but i like it. it's like new york with charm.

review.title: Great location close to the cable car & Union Square
review.reviewText:
Great location, just a one minute walk to the cable car and only 2 blocks from Union Square. Two diners and a pizza restaurant within one block as well as Walgreens (small supermarket/pharmacy chain). Great location for visitors. Hotel rooms are a little dated as this has obviously been an apartment building at one time, but it has been done well and the beds were comfortable. Not a four star hotel but good value for what you get and the location is great. Fairly quiet neighbourhood at night. You can hear other guests at times but it is good value for money and the location is what sells it. I would go back!!!
Mature travellers from Australia

review.title: Great location - Nice hotel!
review.reviewText: A great boutique hotel with a great location! Clean, comfortable room with a decent sized room and good bed. Bathroom is older but perfectly servicable and suits the boutique feel of the place. Good service and staff. Skip the wine tasting - not the best wines. Fab location - just a block away from much more highend/pricey hotels like the Ritz. Just two streets up from Union Sq and the Powell cable car stops at the corner. Go the other way and your at Chinatown gate in two streets. 3 starbucks nearby and a convenience store just a street down. Couldn't have done better for the price and location!!! Should mention that i got abig discount on the price booking three months in advance. Better than i could have got on Priceline.

review.title: Would recommend!
review.reviewText: High marks for location and service. Located between Powell and Stockton, it was next door to China Town and Powell Street Cable Car line. A taxi to Pier 39 with tip was less than $10. Staff was friendly and helpful. Daily wine testing allowed you to meet guests from around the world. We probably were the only Americans in the hotel. Be aware that hotel is well maintained but it is old. That means glass doorknobs, old style doors, steam radiators, etc. Hotel has 8 floors and 106 rooms. The one elevator was on the small side, 6 guests at a time. Ice machines only on 4th and 7th floor. We stayed 7 nights. Only issue was a leaky toilet which took 2 days to repair. We did not know that Masa Restaurant was closed between July 3rd through the 18th. We missed out on the experience.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
very close to the tram car line and Union Square also close to the Alamo car hire pick up. No food at the hotel but they have discount vouchers for breakfast at the cafe across the road and other restaurants.
Don't expect an interesting view from the room

review.title: Nice, Quiet, Boutique Hotel! Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Very nice Hotel. Rooms are small but clean. Front desk staff are all very helpfull as concierges. They gave us lots of restaurant recommendations and directions, and even gave us free passes to the trolly that were left by a previous guest! Very thoughtfull and helpful. Great location for shopping...right next to Chinatown and trolly station. Short walk to lots of shopping and a bit longer walk to fisherman's wharf. Wine reception is a bonus and I hear Masa restaurant on premesis is excellent although we didn't eat there.

review.title: Happy Honeymooners
review.reviewText:
The hotel's lobby was beautifully decorated and hosted a nightly wine reception, although short, it was complementary. The rooms were small, but did it's job of having a nice place to stay once we were finished with a long day of sight seeing. The concierge was helpful and greeted us each time with excitement.

Parking was a block and a half away and we were able to access our car 24 hours a day which was nice.
Cable car access was extremely close and took you directly to/from Union Square to Fisherman's Wharf or Ghirredelli Square. Union Square itself is within walking distance if you don't mind the hills.
Lots of local restaurants and cafes within walking distance (keep in mind you will need to walk up/down some hills).
Chinatown's main entrance is only 2 blocks away and on the same street as the hotel.
Overall, this hotel is very accessible to a lot of local attractions and it is fairly easy to get around from this area.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText:
Good rates through expedia.
Old hotel. Great location
Lobby and reception area very new but room was rough on insideold smelling paint peeling around bay window widows didn't close properly, had to check everytime to make sure windows closed when leaving room seems staff opened when cleaning and we where on 2nd floor with a landing outside window,. No others available unless we wanted to move every day.
Room has safe, no instructions, between myself and staff set it up how?
Last day found out out we should have had a coffee maker and bath robes.
If all you want to do is sleep and go its okay check rates though.
Staff very friendly.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: Really happy with this hotel. Perfect location in a nice area, close to restaurants and bars, and also is right on the trolley line. Convenient walking distance to lots of places as well. Loved the nightly wine reception in the very pretty lobby!! Rooms were fine, seemed nice and spacious with the high ceilings and mirrored wall... perhaps a bit stuffy due to the lack of a fan in the bathroom, which was on the small side, but perfectly adequate. Front lobby staff were very friendly and helpful, even though I had to ask twice for more towels and never received the requested teabags... not a big deal. Would stay here again if I ever get back to the lovely city of San Francisco.

review.title: Need more tea
review.reviewText:
OK so there was a funny smell in my room - I soon got used to it. The hotel was clean, bright, friendly and in a great location!
If only they had tea in the rooms instead of coffee.....

review.title: San Francisco - convenient to Union Square
review.reviewText: Convenient to Union Square and China Town - that's as good as it got. Room was on the back of the Hotel on floor 6 - on arrival the lift was out of operation. Windows faced stair well on hotel. Very dark. Checking in and out very easy.

review.title: olk for the price
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly. Bathroom needed some work. there was a homeless guy sleeping in the hall one morning when I left. Price good. Overall fine for the price

review.title: Excellant location
review.reviewText: Vintage Court is not a "posh" hotel but is exactly what we paid for....decent size room, clean room, comfy bed, adequate bath/shower etc. Its location was , for us, just right, 50 yards from a cable car stop half way up a hill and easy to walk down to Union Square where everything either started or ended. The only downside was theHotel's restaurant prices.We would have liked a meal in the hotel but it was just too expensive. But we found a great pizza place - Uncle Vito's - on the next corner and a great place for breakfast or steaks on the other corner - Roxanne's - both average prices. All in all, two very happy, very tired tourists.

review.title: lovely hotel, fantastic location
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel as it wasn't your standard, run of the mill, generic hotel. Yes it's old but that added to the charm. i could see that the rooms were small by American standards (having stayed in many a huge American hotel room, this is defently more cosy!) but fine by Europeon standards.the beds were comfortable, although we would have liked the option of extra pillows blankets etc in the room (we did get them when we asked!). we did request a quiet room, which meant the view was poor, but at least we slept like logs!

review.title: Great Hotel in Union Square
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Near Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, cable cars, MUNI and BART.

review.title: Convenient Location
review.reviewText: The location is superb-- close to Union Square and all the other sites in the city. The size of the room is a bit on the smaller side and the interior, though not dirty, is a bit old. You are definitely paying for the convenient location. If you are looking to spend more time outside exploring the city, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Really disappointed
review.reviewText: Dirty room and bathroom. Leaking a/c made awful smell..safe not working..it was a mess

review.title: Nice hotel and free wine
review.reviewText:
A good hotel in a good location with wine tasting each evening.
Room was decent.

review.title: Noisy !
review.reviewText: If you are noise sensitive make sure that you only stay on top floor of hotel as otherwise as well as loud constant street noise you will hear people above you walking on old floorboards. Staff very polite and as helpful as possible although initially a little incompetent as I originally requested as quiet as possible room so pre arrival was moved from a room opposite elevator to one behind the l elevator !!! On arrival it took 2 further moves and three hours to get to the top floor and a non street front room. This was obviously a waste of 3 hours of my 3 days in San Francisco. Also the old carpet smell is unpleasant. But its in an inexpensive and very conveniently located downtown position

review.title: Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Charming hotel in a good location. Great value.

review.title: Desk staff were super! Maids short on towels?
review.reviewText:
We could not have wished for better desk staff at this hotel!They answered all our tourist questions, were so great with directions, can't say enough about them!
Maid service was okay, BUT we paid for 3 adults and the hotel maids only ever left enough towels for 2, you try drying yourself off on a hand towel. We had to phone and ask everyday... and we were there for 4 nights, and had left a tip everyday except for the last night. Why not, well because once again they only left enough towels again for 2. If the hotel is short of towels, maybe buy some more?

review.title: Nice little hotel in good location
review.reviewText: We had a lovely stay, rooms not the biggest but clean, tidy & comfy beds - not sure what else you need. Friendly & helpful staff. The wine reception was a nice bonus as was the free WiFi

review.title: An ex cellent choice to see and be close to all of the best of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We have stayed at the Vintage Court twice before, and each time we are very well treated. Its location, extremely helpful staff and daily wine tasing make it a most desirable hotel. You can walk to Chinatown. The cable car is 1/2 a block away and all sites are within easy reach. The rooms are quaint, well maintained and there is a very fine personal quality about all of the service.

review.title: Great little spot
review.reviewText: Steps from China Town and a short walk to many great spots in Union Square area. Loved the little wine receptions. Great for meeting travelers. Rooms were very comfortable. Elevator was slow...

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Loved the friendly & helpful staff, didn't love the head-marks on the wall above the bed.
Loved the fresh verbena scented soap and the endless HOT water, didn't love the threadbare chair.
Loved the mostly quiet room and the Very convenient location, didn't love the weekend, nightlime street noises. (single glaze windows)
Loved the crisp comfy bed, didn't love the view from my room.
Loved that there was an ironing board & iron, loved that there was a clean shower robe, didn't love the noisy ladies in the hall at 1am.

review.title: Very impressed. Can't say enough about the hotel!!!
review.reviewText: The Masas resturant was outstanding. The hotel and resturant complimented each other. Outstaning staff for both!! Can hardly wait to come back!!!!

review.title: Great location - but room was smaller than I expected.
review.reviewText: Everything was o.k.

review.title: The Golden City
review.reviewText: Couple in mid/late 20's. King room. People have complained about the smell of this hotel to be a little musky so we bought an air freshener before we came. There was a slight smell in the lobby, but it was just old hotel smell, it really isn't anything to worry about. Front counter were always helpful and of course there is the nightly free wine. My key cards had to be reset on two different occassions, but that was my only issue. Location was great and you are right next to a cable car line on Powell and the Bart on Market. If you want to work off the great food in this city you can totally walk wherever if you are up to it. We walked from the hotel to Fishermans Wharf, to Haight/Asbury, to the Mission and back one day. That was 15 miles and my feet were killing me, but it is all possible. I'm from DC so I'm not worried about crime so mucn. The people here aren't as harassing as the East Coast, and I would only recommend not traveling in the Tenderloin area at night if you are easily scared.

review.title: san fransisco,ca
review.reviewText: bed was comfortable annd location very good about 3-4 blocks ,your in union square and cable car ride 1/2 block away and there it is. as well shops,cafes,and stores.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court - highly recommended
review.reviewText: the hotel was perfectly situated around Union Square area, easily walkable to shops/restaurants. room was of a decent size and bed was comfortable. hotel was clean etc. i would highly recommend as good price.

review.title: Liked it
review.reviewText:
After reading various reviews about this hotel was slightly worried but it was
very clean, did not smell at all musty and I certainly did not see any bed bugs
as several reviewers mentioned.
The position was perfect. Would liked to have breakfast included but plenty
of places nearby to eat. There is a restaurant joined to the hotel they could
have provided a Weekend brunch but only seemed to open in the evenings.
We were at the hotel for 7 nights and as we are tea drinkers would have liked
a kettle instead of the coffee maker but Starbucks just a few blocks away.

review.title: Lovely Historic Hotel Captured Our Hearts
review.reviewText: The hotel is quaint and has an authentic historic feel with tall baseboards and beefy mouldings. The service at the front desk is so courteous - they knew all the best spots to eat and to visit. The bed was rock hard, however and the pillows too soft - but we were so tired from walking the city we barely noticed. The maid service was decent, but they did tend to leave hair on the floor behind the door of the bathroom. The evening wine tasting was a wonderful cap to the day. We met so many of our fellow guests and it made for an almost community feel. I have never stayed in a place that worked so hard to deliver good service, and make us all feel like family.

review.title: Good for the money!
review.reviewText: Nice!

review.title: Loved our San Francisco trip!
review.reviewText: This hotel was recommended to us by a couple of different sets of friends of ours. It was wonderful! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. It's an older hotel, but the rooms were clean and quaint. The bathroom was small, but that was OK. The location was terrific. The main shopping area and public transportation were within easy walking distance (be prepared for the uphill climbs on the return trip, though.) The staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable. And of course the wine receptions that occurred every evening from 5 to 6 pm were a great way of meeting fellow guests, enjoying some great wine and gaining some great additional information about San Francisco.

review.title: Great for the price
review.reviewText: Great room for the price. Parking is not included and is horrible in the area. Rooms are older with new furnishings but maintained well. Has a great vintae feel.

review.title: Fine place to stay!
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located, within walking distance of many of San Francisco's sights. The complimentary wine gave us an opportunity to meet other interesting guests. We think this hotel offers great value and a fun vacation!

review.title: A great hotel in downtown San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our stay was great. The rooms were small by some standards, but for the rate and location - downtown - it was great. I would definitely recommend it and I would definitely go back.

review.title: Great Birthday Weekend
review.reviewText: We booked 4 rooms at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court for the weekend. It was a big 60th birthday celebration. My son arrived from Texas and my sister came in from New York City. None of us had every stayed at the hotel, but it lived up to all of it's advertising. The evening complimentary wine served in the lobby (more like a comfortable living room) was beautiful, mellow and everyone had a great time visting. The hotel had all of the amenities that we were looking for in our hotel stay.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The staff was great & my room was clean. It was perfect for what i needed

review.title: Location is everything...
review.reviewText:
When they say Vintage they mean vintage. The hotel is OK not my typical stay. But the location cannot be beat. You are central to just about everything. The beds are hard and the pillows are teeny and way too soft. Bring your own if you can fit it in.

We bought an air freshner at the nearest Walgreens to rid the room of the damp old church smell.

Other than that. We were in the room very little and it really did the job for the $$ we paid.

review.title: Best Getaway ever.
review.reviewText: The Best Hotel stay in years. My wife and I loved it. The staff took grat care of us and we loved our room. Most excellent location. Very romantic. If anyone from this hotel reads this, Thank You. I Think about our getaway in San Fran almost every day. You Helped make it a dream getaway. Thank You again.

review.title: The best stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
The hotel was located in Union Square...a great location for shopping and touring. We were surround by great restaurants and China Town was just a few blocks away.

The hotel has a wine tasing every evening. We met our fellow travellors and greatly enjoyed them.

The hotel is older and very charming with all the amenities we required. We had WiFi; a desk for the computer, a refrigerator, coffeemaker, a safe and a flat screen television.

With all of this and a great location it was affordable. It cannot be beat!

review.title: When privacy is breached
review.reviewText: When I first got to the motel I spent 20 minutes at reception waiting for them to find my booking because they could not find it (this is most likely related to the fact that the receptionist was fast asleep upon my arrival snoring like a chainsaw). Then once they found it they had me booked in for only one night even though I had paid for 4. Then after that was sorted I went into my room and it smelt like mould. Over the next couple of days, my key continuously stopped working which I later found out was because they had given me key to other guests who they had booked in the same room. I was fortunate enough to be in the room on these occasions. The only good thing about this motel is its location.

review.title: close to union square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a pre 1906 building which is still in good shape on the south side of Nob Hill . The decor is pleasant and the room while not spacious was large enough to be comfortable. A comfortable king size bed was much appreciated. Parking is provided in a secure lot one block away. We spent two days in the city and we were away from the hotel most of the time but it was situated next to the cable car line going up Nob Hill and over to fisherman's wharf and just 3 blocks from Union Square. A pleasant cafe for breakfast was just across the street. We are planning to return next year for our annual visit to the Dickens Christmas Faire and intend on staying at the facility again.

review.title: Decent!
review.reviewText: Although I wasn't very impressed with the hotel room iteself, or the location of the hotel, it was good for the one-night stay and the convenient proximity to the Masonic Temple for a show. The hotel wasn't clearly marked when we were looking for it and at first we drove right past it. There were no places to park, so driving around the block a few times was necessary, as was the valet parking (you won't find ANY other place to park, so plan for that small expense.) The room was small, but comfortable. The bathroom didn't have any fans or ventilation, so it did fog up our room, but it wasn't a big deal. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly, and I recommend the hotel for a short stay in the city. Another good thing is all of the restaurants on the same street; the prices are a steal compared to the hotel's prices.

review.title: Major Disappointment
review.reviewText: Wow! Where do I begin with how disappointed I am in this place. Well, it was my 6th wedding anniversary, so I thought to get a room next to the fancy restaurant Masa's. This way we didn't need to worry about driving after celebrating. Anyhow, We were barely greeted at the front desk. We get our room, but there was no heat. I understand that they need to air out the room, but it was freezing. So, that was not a great impact. Naturally we checked the heaters which did not turn on, so we called. My request was ignored by a walk through fix over the phone, and then I was told that the heaters take about 5-10 minutes to turn on. After insisting that someone comes to look at the heaters, the house-man gets there to review the phone instructions with me, all which I had to decipher through his broken English. He saw that the heaters were not working, so he offered to come back with a space heater. 5 minutes, 10 minutes, 20 minutes go by and no space heater, so I call the front desk again. Turns out the maintenance man left for the night, his shift was over. Right, so I re-request a space heater, but turns out the maintenance man is the ONLY guy in the building who has a key to the special space-heater closet. Ok, so I go down stairs to the front desk and vent a little, while asking for extra blankets. Nope, no extra blankets in the room, as they normally would be, and none that the front desk could offer. All this BS while our dinner reservation is 10 minutes away.

review.title: Vintage Court as a relaxing and enjoyable 'home' to stay in whilst in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived late in the afternoon we found Vintage Court a welcoming place to stay. The staff were all courteous and nothing was too much trouble and any requests made were followed up or notes made so that personnel on another shift were aware of our needs. The only minor thing we would have enjoyed were larger pillows - and this is being picky. The room was comfortable, friendly and nicely furnished. The fact that every room carries the name of a winery or wine made it feel personal, and also the wine tasting time between 5 and 6pm where you met other travellers to discuss your day was a pleasant experience. Being close to the centre of San Francisco and great shops but not right in it made it easier for bus pickups and drop offs. Would certainly recommend the Executive Vintage Court and when we return to San Francisco will return to this hotel where we felt so welcomed.

review.title: Was great for the price.
review.reviewText: The Vintage Court turned out to be a great value. the Hotel was comfortable, and very convenient. can't beat it for the price.

review.title: Met our expectations.
review.reviewText: Room was quite small. with sink separate from bath and commode (surprising) but we became accustomed to it. Evening wine tasting was fine though some crackers and cheese would have been welcome. All in all, a good value.

review.title: Noisy and not maintained. Would not go back.
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a good location. Okay neighborhood and close to Chinatown but that is pretty much the only good thing about it.
The staff are not friendly or concerned about guest service. The person who checked us in wasn't very happy and one late night I walked into the hotel to see the front desk person snoring loudly. Another front desk person was on a personal call and texting on her cell phone at the same time.
The room seemed outdated and needs to be redecorated. We didn't sleep very well because we could hear the person in the room on the floor above us walking around. The window in our room didn't close properly so you could hear the wind blowing through it.

review.title: Very appropriate
review.reviewText: I'd never been to San Francisco and I felt like staying at a place like this made the experience more interesting. It's not the nicest, but it isn't bad. Yes there's a smell in the hallway but it isn't gross or anything...just smells old. If you look at the building it's old but like I said I felt like it was one of the more interesting things of San Fran. Really good location in terms of distance to Union Square and all...once it gets dark you may want to walk carefully but honestly I think that's anywhere in the city. Our room was spacious...bathroom was basic but clean. The front desk was also very helpful with any questions we had. Wine tasting in the lobby is very quaint and cool.

review.title: Great boutique hotel experience
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel was conveniently located in Union Square and to a lot of the local attractions. Transportation was easy with the Tram stopping just at the end of the block. The staff was attentive and courteous and the wine tasting was a great experience when we were able to attend for the one evening. The room was clean, wireless internet was free and everything worked in the bathrooms. I would stay there again.

review.title: I will never go back to that hotel and not recommend to any one either.
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is ok, however, the building is very old with strong stale odor. The room is very small. The noise from the street is very loud, day and night. Unless you are deaf, it is very hard to fall asleep.

review.title: Napa wine and San Francisco - a perfect match!
review.reviewText: This is a relatively small hotel, but with a lot of charm. From the ever-burning fire in the fireplace that greeted us every time we got back to the hotel, to the complimentary wine tastings, it was a very nice experience. Our room was clean, and although air conditioning and heating elements a little old fashioned, our room was very comfortable. The wine hour was nice in that you got to meet other guests from all over the country, and was always a nice start to the night. It is located well in Union Square, and my wife and I would recommend Cafe De La Presse for its excellent coffee and pastries and the Turtle Bar for a nearby neighborhood bar. The powell-hyde cable car stops just a half block away on its trip up Nob Hill, so very convenient. Internet was free and wireless, and maybe a little slower than usual, but no so much to be a major inconvenience. There is also a computer in the lobby for pay use. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: smelled like urine
review.reviewText: The main lobby smelled ok but as soon as you got into the elevator or walked up the stairs or down the halls, the overwhelming smell was of old urine. Getting into the room was a relief just to get away from the awful odor. Given a room on the street level so that had to keep the shutters always closed. This hotel was within walking distance of Chinatown but on the other side of the hotel, the area became shaky. Did not feel comfortable walking around the area at night.

review.title: Would stay here again
review.reviewText:
We arrived late in drizzling rain. The lobby was spotless,shining and inviting.
Check-in was quick and we were in our cozy room in minutes. Our room was clean and had a very comfortable bed. There was a lovely little window seat which was perfect for watching the people on Bush Street below us. The large flat screen TV was nice.

The location was ideal. Cable cars run less than half a block away, Union Square was a few blocks away and Chinatown was a couple of blocks the other way. Lots of free walking tour meeting places are close to the hotel.

The daily wine reception was a nice way to relax before venturing out for dinner at one of the many restaurants nearby.

We left early every day and usually returned some time in the morning. Our room was always cleaned by the time we came back. I liked the verbena bath products.

The staff that we interacted with were eager to help. The concierge recommended an excellent wine tour which picked up and returned to the front door. One man was always interested to hear what we had done and seen each day.

I would return to this hotel and will tell my friends to stay here.

review.title: Would definitely stay here again!
review.reviewText:
This hotel was great - very reasonably priced (particularly considering its excellent, central location), nice and clean and comfortable. Staff were helpful when we needed them, and our room was cleaned every day once we'd gone out, with no cleaners waking us up at the crack of dawn for housekeeping (as has happened to me in a number of other hotels). Vintage Court was also really easy to find (only 10mins from the BART/metro station - and that was carrying luggage!), and also is about 30seconds from the Powell Street where the cable cars run.

The rooms weren't huge (by American standards), but for an English tourist the room was as I'd expect for a city centre hotel, and was definitely more than big enough for the two of us staying there.

Another bonus of this place is the free wine reception every evening! We didn't take advantage of this every night but it was definitely nice to come back after a long day of sightseeing and have a glass of wine ready and waiting for you!

All in all, we had a great stay in this amazing city, and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Centrally Located 3 star comfort
review.reviewText:
The hotel is conveniently located in a central location and is just 10 min walk from the Market Street. Extremely comfortable, well maintained and serviced, with calming interiors, and 3 star comforts, the temperature was well controlled, though the rooms are a bit small. Restrooms are perfect. The price is a bit expensive... though if you can get a discount vide some offers... like through expedia, then there is nothing like it. The staff is well mannered and extremely co-operative. They have their own three star restaurant... "Masa's" which one ought to try out atleast once. However, the fine dining restaurant is on the expensive side costing around $150 per person for a 4/5 course meal, but, there is a discount for the guests of the hotel... which would cost around $50 per person for a 3 course meal.
Overall, a fantastic place to stay close to the centre of the city with easy access to every transport modality, shopping centres and conference venues.
Definitely recommended for people willing to spend around $120-200 per night for a comfortable stay.

review.title: Not impressed....
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel because of a promotional sale on Expedia. I was expecting something a bit better for a 3 star hotel. I am a very laid back traveler, and my expectations are minimal for an old boutique hotel as long as the place is clean but this hotel was a bit disappointing. The hotel is up a steep hill on Bush street...very close to Chinatown gates, and a few blocks from the Westfield mall and trolley start point so thats a plus. Stayed in a king bed room, and the size of the room was bigger than most boutique hotels I've stayed in in San Francisco. The bed was a bit hard, the giant fabric headboard as well as the bed comforter had some "questionable" stains. The pillows were like marshmallows with no support, and the bathroom was tiny tiny tiny. The tiles in the shower stall looked old and worn out, and kinda gross. Some pros were the flat screen tv, the desk area, the view of the noisy street (as i requested), a fridge, and plenty of space for two. The staff was overall friendly, the location was good, and the lobby was nice as well. But since I am a clean freak, I was quite disappointed. I would not stay here again unless the price was ridiculously low.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: We arrived early and the hotel staff held our luggage while we explored the city. The hotel is located only two blocks from Chinatown. The evening wine reception was a welcome surprise after a full day of shopping and sight seeing. We had a great time. Definitely would stay here again.

review.title: Good Home Base
review.reviewText:
Overall good experience and found it to be a very clean and comfortable hotel and a good "base" for our 3-night, 4-day trip to San Francisco. One problem we had was that we needed to buy some clothing early in the morning for sightseeing and asked the night before what time the stores opened (on a Tuesday morning) and were told 6 AM for Macy's. We asked "Are you sure?" as it didn't seem right, and were told yes by one of the hotel staff who worked the night before.
We got up early to buy the clothing, but the store did not open until 10 AM, which was very disappointing.

review.title: Best Place to Stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Old town, quaint, and great location do not do justice to this blast from the past hotle and location. The corner of Bush and Powell puts you in the hub of San Francisco, steet cars and a local Walgreens. City buses everywhere, lots of Starbucks and interesting people everywhere...who could as for more. The hotel is very early San Francisco, renovated many times over, not modern, but has WiFi and on demand movies. Safe, interesting and a real city experience.

review.title: Great!
review.reviewText: Great hotel for a great price. The one thing we didn't like was that there was no fan in the bathroom. Was a bit of a musty smell at first but it's an old hotel and that went away. Would definitely stay again and recommend it. They were very helpful with tours and airport transportation.

review.title: Great location and great wine!
review.reviewText: We loved the location and the staff were really helpful. The wine reception in the evening is a great way to start off the evening. The bed was comfortable and room was clean. An excellent place to stay for a romantic getaway.

review.title: Friendly boutique
review.reviewText:
We found the hotel to be delightful. Rooms are no smaller than any other hotel of a similar size and class. We were very comfortable.
Very handy for Chinatown, Japantown, the Financial district, Union Square and Fisherman's wharf. Bus routes to Golden Gate and Prsidio Parks in easy walking distance.

review.title: Excellent choice
review.reviewText: I stayed here on a bussiness trip. The hotel was clean, room was comfortable, and it had antique charm. The wine cocktail hour every day from 5-6 was nice. It is in a nice area, near Nob hill, but within walking distance to Union square. I would reccommend it highly.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText:
I stayed here just one night prior to a cruise. Every staff member I encountered was pleasant and very helpful. The location is excellent and I walked for hours in the area to the best attractions and shops.
It was very hot in San Francisco but the room was cool and comfortable. This hotel is old and the carpet under the air conditioner was soaked (probably an a/c leak). I reported it and nothing had been done by the time I left the next afternoon. Otherwise, I had everything I needed...iron/board/robe and lots of space. Nice to chat with the other guests over wine from 5 to 6pm. I would stay here again.

review.title: Convenient with annoyances.
review.reviewText: I thought this boutique hotel very convenient. The staff was friendly and efficient. I found nothing wrong with the room excepting a musty smell that was difficult to ignore. I asked another guest from another floor if they had the same odor. Answer: yes. So, either it was the oldness of the building or bad carpeting. It was, however, offensive. The other annoyance was I could not use my cellphone in the hotel. NO SERVICE! Everyone uses a cellphone so we can be mobile and don't have to sit in a hotel room waiting for calls. The front desk was aware of the problem but there was so notification or sign stating anything about no cellphone service. And, they charge for local calls even though you can't use your cellphone. What's that about??? I thing that problem needs to be addressed. That alone could deter business.

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: The hotel didn't quite live up to its description on the website. Overall, it wasn't terrible, but it's not somewhere I would stay again, and definitely NOT for business travel. The room was small, a little dark, and a bit awkward to move around. Although generally clean, it smelled musty, and there was mildew on the shower curtain. The most frustrating part of my stay was the internet connection -- it dropped literally every 15 minutes, which made it very hard to work productively. On the plus side, the location near Union Square is very convenient, and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Time to upgrade the rooms...
review.reviewText:
This was my third time at this hotel. It's location is ideal for me in SF as I like to be based near union square. Lobby was being refurbed during my visit which meant parts of it were inaccessible during the five nights I was there.
The wine receptions were rather staid affairs because of this.

The staff were as friendly and helpful as ever.

The rooms are egtting very tired and need an upgrade. There is only so long you can hide behind the "boutique" description - the shower and bathroom in my room was like a hotel from the 1970s.

review.title: An excellant base
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a perfect base for sightseeing in San Francisco. It is a one minute walk to the cable car lines Powell St-Hyde and Powell St-Mason that take you towards Fishermans Wharf. In the opposite direction it is a 2 minute walk to the gateway of Chinatown and it is a 5 minute stroll to Union Square.
There are penty of diners serving good breakfasts in the neighberhood.
The hotel itself provided us a comfortable clean and quiet room and the lobby fills out between 5 & 6 as guests gather to enjoy thr free wine tasting in front of the fire to share their experiences of the city.
An excellant hotel that i would highly recommend.

review.title: Awesome time in San Fran!
review.reviewText: It was my first time in San Francisco. I took my mom with me and we stayed at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court in Union Square. Since we arrived on a Thursday evening, the first thing we did on Friday morning was buy a 3-day Muni Passport. With this, you can get around on all the cable cars, buses, and street cars for as many times as you want. Everything except the BART. But if you need to use the BART, it's a great system too. The Executive Hotel Vintage Court was just right for what we needed. Since we were out all day long, we just needed a nice, safe place to come to every evening. The hotel is vintage and it's well preserved in my opinion. It's not big on space but it has lots of character and charm. We were very pleased with the friendly staff. They greeted us every morning as we headed out and every night as we made it back. They were also very helpful with directions and had good suggestions for local restaurants. If you are the type of traveler that is looking for the basics with nearby public transportation, I highly recommend this hotel.

review.title: Tight Squeeze but Well Worth the Visit
review.reviewText:
The Executive Hotel, Vintage Court was an excellent choice for our San Francisco stay. The room was small as are all boutique hotels, but was comfortable, attractive and had everything that you would need for a stay in San Francisco. The Muni public transit was great and the Powell St Cable Car stops within 100 ft. of the hotel.

The concierge(Gary) was extremely helpful in recommending destinations, side trips and restaurants. He recommended "The Bamboo" and it was the best Chinese Food we had ever had, and it's not even in Chinatown! The daily wine reception(5-6pm) is a great idea. It allows you to chat with other guests and get other ideas for restaurants to try, places to shop, and museums to visit.

The whole staff at the Executive Hotel, Vintage Court, were very helpful. The EHVC was centrally located and a great jump off point to go anywhere in San Francisco. Unfortunatly, the lobby was undergoing renovations during our stay and that took away some of the charm of this unique boutique hotel. Still, well worth the visit!

review.title: Good value city hotel
review.reviewText:
Old hotel but obviously well maintained, tasteful decor & features.
Wine serving from 5 to 6p.m. a great bonus.
