review.title: Nice little hotel lived up to its Hotel star rating, great location too
review.reviewText: It was a nice hotel that's right in downtown, good location! Close to cable car, China town, Fisherman's Wharf (Just take cable car). Staff was nice, room was good, everything as expected, would go back to stay there just for the location.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Definitely would never recommend to any "executive" that they stay here. It's funky. Wireless Internet was unstable. The room was tiny, everything somewhat in need of renovation. Good location, it had the basics you need, and it was more affordable than others in the area.

review.title: An ok hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an okay location it was close to shopping but there weren't many restraunts around other then the restraunt at the hotel. The hotel was clean and the cleaning people made sure that I had new things everyday.

review.title: Just what we needed.
review.reviewText: While this hotel is not large and fancy like those in Union Square, it is just 1 block away, so the location is great, and at a great price. Friendly and helpful staff, and the free wine tasting daily is a plus!

review.title: Meh.
review.reviewText: Old hotel, small rooms, cramped bathroom, ancient and noisy window mounted air conditioner. Neighborhood is probably safe but rife with homeless people. It is in a utterly charmless section of the city, spend a little more and get a better hotel.

review.title: Excellent Service
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were outstanding. Everyone was very friendly and helpful beyond expectation.

review.title: GOOD VALUE
review.reviewText:
The staff was very helpful and courteous. Went out of their way to help us book
another hotel in Morro Bay. They also have a wine tasting each evening.

review.title: Loved our experience at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything we hoped for and then some!

review.title: Ok, get what you pay for try and get room higher than 2nd floor
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine. Room was clean. But we were on the second floor which in San Francisco means we were at street level so saw peoples legs when they walked past our window with one guy even having the cheek to look in, couldnt see anything due to blinds but still not very nice. We booked 5 nights and hotel is advertised as having a lot of rooms with nice views and bay windows but we had poor view and quite dark. Would have thought they might have put us in better room as staying for 5 nights but they didnt. Apart from that we found all ok, they are doing work in lobby and staircase at the moment so we had to use fire exit or lift. Staff were nice. Coffee making facilities in the room. Thought we got what we paid for so all in all not too bad. Made the wine reception one night and met quite a few people so that was nice.

review.title: Great Location with Very Nice Staff
review.reviewText: This was my first vacation to San Francisco. The location in Union Square was great. It was a 3 minute walk to the center of Union Square where all your excursion transportation can be found if they didn't pick you up at the hotel. China Town was even closer walk the other way. Taxi to the Fisherman Wharf area was about $10 which is reasonable and could save you the cost of renting a car and worrying about parking if only there for the weekend. The hotel featured a red and white wine each night for their guest to lounge and meet each other. Friend had the king size room which was a lot roomier than the queen I had chosen. Worth the upgrade for walking room. Carpet are a little worn, I had only a shower with normal water pressure, and don't expect to have a great view since tall buildings surrounding the hotel. Staff was great in every way and didn't hesitate to answer any questions no matter the time. Guess being a San Francisco resident has some perks!

review.title: Had a great time
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel with friends for two nights. We found that the hotel was conveniently located within walking distance of everywhere we needed to go. The hotel was clean and in good condition, though you should keep in mind that is a boutique hotel and that is much of its charm. The wine reception each night was a great experience and we found that the staff of the hotel were helpful and friendly. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, especially considering the reasonable price.

review.title: Satisfactory
review.reviewText: Good location, enjoyed the free wine receptions around the fire (yes in August!) Hotel staff however very rude and unhelpful.

review.title: Excellent stay
review.reviewText: As I entered, I was proclaimed the "expedia guest of the month" and received an upgrade. Tthe hotel was quiet, guest room comfy, the wine reception was generous, and the front room lovely. Not real near (walking distance) the restaurants, but discovered a great little sushi house almost right across the street, called Swell. Of course, would have enjoyed Masa's nextdoor, but it is closed on Monday nights.

review.title: Great experience!
review.reviewText:
Upon checking in we were upgraded to a King even though we had booked a Queen. The staff was unbelievably friendly and went out of the way to make it a good expereince. The hotel is in a great location as well...walking distance to Union Sq, Chinatown, etc. The wine tasting in the evening was a great extra. We were quite surprised at how much wine there was. Usually these things are under catered.

Overall, everything was as advertised and we felt like we got great value for our money. We would definitely stay there again!

review.title: Good location and affordably priced!
review.reviewText:
The Executive Vintage Hotel lives up to its name.
As soon as you enter the hotel, it feels like you are a true guest at a vintage countryhouse.

The room itself was rather small and the bathroom was even smaller. Walking to the room, the carpetting was clean and smelled fresh. Howevere in the room there was a penetrating smell which I can't describe specifically, but it smelled like a room that hasn't been aired for months after heavy rain season.

The best part was the Lobby! Loved the feel of vintage living room!
Wish all the rooms had that touch.

review.title: Perfect for our needs
review.reviewText: I was on vacation to show my 13 year old son San Francisco for the first time. We couldn't afford the higher hotel prices on Fisherman's Wharf, and I found this hotel via Expedia. After reading the reviews, I thought we would give it a try and it's a good thing we did! The hotel was small and intimate, and was generally very clean. The bathroom sink had some cracks, but overall, the room was in good shape. I had read that the streets could be noisy at night and early in the morning, but I always travel with a sound machine, so that pretty much drowned out any traffic or garbage trucks. A key feature is that the hotel is walking distance to the cable car stop, Union Square and Chinatown. One day we even decided to walk to Fisherman's Wharf, which turned out to be about a 25 minute walk, mostly downhill. Another key factor was safety, and I felt completely safe in the neighborhood, even when arriving back later in the evening. A nice touch is the free wine tasting from 5:30- 6:30pm every evening. Since we were sightseeing most of the time, we only made it back for one wine tasting (just for me, not my son!), and it was a nice social scene, with hotel guests mingling. I would absolutely return to this hotel and would recommend it to others.

review.title: disappointed in dc
review.reviewText:
The hotel was very worn. the faucet for the shower fell off during a shower, which made it non functional. we were able to figure out how to stick it back on.
cleanliness of the rooms was mediocare. front desk people were nice and responsive.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Hotel is very conveniently located, close to Union Square, etc and is clean and tidy. The downside is that it does not have a refrigerator in the room or a restaurant so there is no breakfast or room service available.

review.title: Pleasant stay
review.reviewText: In general, the staff was pleasant & friendly. The room was clean though it had a slight mildew smell (I guess due to the fact that its an old building), but forget about the view as our room was facing on the inside, looking at other rooms window so we left the blinds closed.We did enjoy the free wine tasting that they offered each evening.

review.title: Perfect Stay
review.reviewText:
My wife and I really enjoyed our recent stay at this great and affordable San Francisco hotel, located on the East side of Union Square, right around the corner from Chinatown on one side and a street away on the other direction from the cable car line that takes you around the area and to the wharf. Perfect location. We got a 3-day Muni pass so we could ride the trolleys and bus as much as we wanted to. Trolleys are normally $5/each way so the pass is worth it.

Back to the hotel...the staff was very friendly, the room was clean, the shower felt great, bed was comfy. Free wireless internet was a very nice perk. I requested a quiet room, and it was. Each room is sponsored by a local winery, and we got the "Midlife Crisis Winery room" which was perfect. We had to check out at noon, but our flight didn't leave until 7PM, so the staff kept our luggage for us in a locked room (and gave us a bag-claim tag receipt for each) so that we didn't have to tote our stuff around town with us on our last day. We came back to pick up our luggage, took the trolley to the BART station on Powell, and rode the BART to the airport. Piece of cake.

I highly recommend The Executive Hotel Vintage Court and will be back.

review.title: Reliabale hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Their morning breakfast and evening wine tasting are nice complimentary services. Their lobby with its gas fireplace makes for a cozy place to sit and read or visit with friends. The location just up from Union Square and 1/2 block from the cable car stop is good for tourists. As a frequent business and pleasure traveler to San Francisco I usually look to the Vintage Court as one of my top three hotels to stay at.

review.title: Not bad for the money, but location a bit rough
review.reviewText: Nice hotel - homely feel and much of the ambiance of a higher grade place. But let down by the area it is in.

review.title: Good deal on a basic room. Great location.
review.reviewText:
The room was quite small (very old hotel), but everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. Some reviews mentioned a bad odour, but we never smelt anything. In the mornings, the cleaning staff was a bit noisy and you can hear the traffic from the nearby street. But everything was quiet at night.

The price and location (near Union Square) made this hotel a great deal. If you're looking for a comfy bed and a no-frills hotel, this place fits the bill. Note: This hotel is on a steep hill. We walked from the BART station, and it was quite the exercise. Older people or those with mobility issues should take a cab or pick another hotel.

review.title: Cozy Hotel
review.reviewText: Very accommodating staff. Older hotel so a different experience than the corporate ones. Much more "homey". Like a cross between a B&B and a large hotel.

review.title: please don't further reduce the amenities at this hotel!
review.reviewText:
Having stayed at this hotel many times over the last decade, we have always found it clean, well located and a good fit for us. In previous years, a continental breakfast was offered. There were always bowls of apples handy around the foyer and the evening wine reception was a nice feature and allowed an hour to sit, have a glass of wine and chat with fellow travellers. On this stay, the continental breakfast was no longer offered, no bowls of apples were around and the wine reception was policed by a hotel staffer/manager who was hesitant to pour more than an ounce per guest. It made guests feel uncomfortable.
It's clear they are trying to save money, and that's fine.. but please let's stop there. Don't touch the premium bedding or any of the other features that will keep us coming back. Also, a coffee maker in the room is not the same as having a pot of hot coffee and a muffin available to guests in the lobby - it's more social and a very welcome addition.

review.title: Bad Customer Service
review.reviewText: The overall condition of the hotel was as expected: basic and clean with some room for improvement but definitely worth the money. The hotel is located close to the cable car stop and is close to Chinatown and other attractions. I had a major problem with room service removing items from my room (air pillow from the air plane and a pair of pants) and placing them into lost and found. I was able to claim the neck pillow but never found the pants. I was also told that the valet parking charge was pro-rated based on how long my vehicle was in the garage. This was, in fact, not true at all and I was charged for 48 hours of parking instead of the 27 hours that I was there. No one tried to resolve these issues which was a major concern to me. Overall, because of this, I would not recommend this hotel or stay here again.

review.title: They meet the target
review.reviewText: They have good quality and clean rooms with good central location close to union square, which meets the target and requirement of my trip

review.title: Good location & nice extras
review.reviewText: We checked in early, so our room wasn't quite ready yet, but they held our bags for us until we came back later on. On top of that, the hotel offers a free wine reception each night for guests. Being San Francisco, the walk up from the Powell Street transit station is a bit steep, but the cable car stops half a block away, so if walking up the hill is an issue, you can always take the cable car. We were able to get everywhere we wanted in the city easily, and the front desk took care of arranging our taxi to the airport. We would be happy to stay there again

review.title: Great location for the price
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful visit to San Francisco and this hotel was everything we were hoping for. The rooms are small, but have everything needed and are clean and comfortable. The location is the best feature.....right next to cable car lines, easy walking to bus lines, Chinatown, Union Square, plenty of restaurants, and a small grocery across the street. We flew in to SFO, took the BART, walked up the hill with our rolling luggage, and used public transportation the rest of the time....no rental car needed. Highly recommend the City Pass for the sites and the transportation! At $5 per trip, the cable car would add up pretty fast otherwise. There are lots of restaurant choices, but we really enjoyed the chocolate/strawberry crepes at the Cable Car Cafe 1/2 block away on Powell. : )

review.title: Good hotel Nice location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel well located and the complimentary wine between 5 and 6 p.m.was nice. The staff was nice and helpful.4 blocks from Union square and 2 blocks from Chinatown and the cable car runs on Powell street. Cannot beat the price for all of that.

review.title: Great time
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Funky smell in the room, but otherwise throughly enjoyable. We would go back!

review.title: Like an Apartment in the City
review.reviewText: Staying at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court was almost like staying in an apartment (minus the kitchen), conveniently located by Union Square and the Financial District. I read the other reviews on Expedia to set my expectations, and this hotel met them. The staff was friendly, check-in late at night was quick. My room was facing a side street and was quite large. The safe was also big enough to fit my laptop. The only huge disappointment was the outdated bathroom - mold in the shower, no windows, a running toilet, and a cheap shower head. The noise level was low (even on Friday night), but it's a city, so hearing the garbage truck at 5am was to be expected. The hotel's location is a major plus. It's near a few bus stops and the Powell St cable car line. The evening wine reception is also a nice touch. The poor conditions of the bathroom made me think twice, but I would recommend this hotel as a place that feels like home in the city.

review.title: Great hotel, good location
review.reviewText:
Recently returned from 4 nights at this hotel. Hotel is in great location, walking distance to Union Square and China Town. It is also right next on the tram stop.
Rooms were basic, but just what we needed (worth what you pay). The free wine in the evenings was a definite incentive to stay here
We would recommend and stay here again

review.title: Dissappointed
review.reviewText: Was looking forward to going back to a hotel I had used in the past, but the overall experience did not match up to expectations. Room on the street was very noisy; lighting was dim. One day, the room was not serviced and on return in the evening I was told they had no housekeeping people on duty after hours. Several times the front desk person was sound asleep when I went by. Nice location; nice lobby and wine tasting, although very short and never got to use. There are lots of other hotels to pick from.

review.title: Good for budget minded...great location..would stay again.
review.reviewText: Everything here was pretty good. The service was friendly but not overly attentive. We had to ask for the coffee maker and then every day had to ask for coffee as the cleaning staff would not leave any (gotta have coffee in the morning!). The room was small (which all rooms in San Fran are) but not the smallest we've been in. The rooms could be painted soon but it was comfortable enough and we got a good price. The location is great (1 block to Union Square) but be warned it is up a steep hill for that block and it does cause a bit of a challenge after 1 drink too many at Lefty O'doulls! Never ate at the resteraunt but took a look at the menu and way pricey! Doesn't seem to fit with the hotel. China Town is right close as well. Safe feeling area. Garbage truck make WAY too much noise at 6 am but you are going to get this anywhere in this area. We have been in a few hotels around here and same thing.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: hotel staff friendly, would of liked coffee facilities in the room. Location perfect for everything. as someone else said the bin men come really early around 4.00am and they arent quiet!!! overall a lovely stay

review.title: gonna go again
review.reviewText: good hotel, good town

review.title: Will return to this hotel
review.reviewText: Very pleasant stay. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the free wine hour every evening by the hotel fireplace meeting many interesting people from different parts of the world. The location of the hotel was ideal for the sites. It was only 1/2 of a block to the Powel Street cable car line which could take you downtown to all of the department stores and in the other direction to Fishermans Wharf. A pass on the city transportation to cover the days of your stay is highly recomended even if you have your car. It has unlimited on and off.

review.title: Still Good After All These Years
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Vintage Court about ten years ago and enjoyed it. When we stayed this time (April, 2010) we were just as happy with our choice. The hotel staff were all pleasant and willing to help. The rooms are not large but the same is true of most of the boutique hotels in Union Square. The location is perfect, within easy walking distance to North Beach, Chinatown, theaters, cable cars and MUNI. We would certainly stay again.

review.title: Loved San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would stay at the hotel again if the parking situation was more convenient and cheaper. Overall, visiting San Francisco for the first time was amazing.

review.title: Great location! Great Staff!
review.reviewText: I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. The location was perfect. We walked and took buses/cable cars every where. The staff was really friendly and easily answered any questions we had.

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: very good

review.title: Mediocre Quality, WiFi Fail
review.reviewText:
This was business travel, and I'm a web developer, so it was imperative that I had good WiFi. Not only did they lie to me at the front desk saying everything was fine, but it took them three days to finally admit there was a problem.

Once I was at my wit's end, they did end up trying to make things right, so I'll give them that. If they were able to guarantee that the WiFi was 100% solid, I would probably give them another try.

Remember to ask for a room not near the huge air conditioner ducts. I was in room 614 and it was like trying to sleep inside a jet engine. They moved me to 506 and it was pretty nice, and quiet except for occasional street sounds.

review.title: Small in size, extra-large on service!
review.reviewText: I read previous reviews. I don't understand the negative comments. I had nothing but a god experience, and in one case, superior help from the front desk. The room was clean, quite and relaxing.

review.title: Loved the wine but NEEDED coffee!
review.reviewText: Loved the wine in the evening, but actually would have preferred coffee in room in the morning! Even one of those low level machines would have been greatly appreciated.

review.title: Clean but very dated.
review.reviewText: My room 814 was clean, but in need of a total makeover. The head board of the bed had a hole in it, there was no wardrobe or facility to hang any clothes up. The bathroom whilst clean had a loose tap and other fittings were very dated. I found the hotel position excellant for exploring the centre or for catching the cable car to fishermans wharf. The staff were extremely friendly and most helpful.

review.title: Recommended.
review.reviewText: Much better than expected according to previous reviews on Expedia. Great location and hotel service. My only dissatisfaction was some noises from other rooms, sometimes it was easy to hear people walking or using water facilities. But I do recommend this hotel.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: It was ok, but I don't think I'll be going back. I also don't like the fact that the parking garage the hotel directed me to (and charged my credit card for) cost 127 dollars for 3 days. And the hotel didn't even give me the rate before I checked out.

review.title: Good San Francisco Hotel in Union Square/China Town area
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and nice. The complimentary wine reception was fabulous.

review.title: Great value but keep out of Masa Restaurant
review.reviewText: Great location for a very reasonable price.The smell from the old carpets was the only negative.Stay away from the Masa restaurant. It is overhyped and do not deserve the expencive check.

review.title: Good valus, good location
review.reviewText: Very nice touches, such as wine hour in the pm. No coffee, either in the room or in the lobby. Attentive service, very good accommodation, even with small room. Old electrical system, which necessitated staff needing to come into my room to cure electrical problems with another room.

review.title: Pining for more
review.reviewText: Arriving by car is not the best idea, navigating the San Francisco hills and one-ways; there is also precious little room in front for unloading and one is then faced with the usurious parking fees. For a downtown hotel though you don't need a car so avoid if possible; we never used ours once installed. The name of the hotel is apropos as it does have an old charm about it; the tiny elevator and style, small rooms, remind one of Paris. The glass of wine in the lobby of an evening is a nice touch (acceptable wine too). Room is small with minimal storage space. For some reason, the coffee-maker had to be requested. The early morning dawn chorus of garbage collection reminded one that this was a city center; otherwise actually it was pretty quiet. Location was really good: reasonable walk to Market Street, Union Square, Chinatown right round the corner. Up the hill not so enticing: large neon sign advertising nude male review a warning perhaps not to venture that way. If you eschew hotel cuisine any number of nearby places to acquire provender. Never felt unsafe.

review.title: Good location, low budget
review.reviewText: It is a very good location. Near everything we need. Buses, Restaurants, stores. People of front desk were nice. Room was clean. A little bit noisy because it is in downtown.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText: Definitely awesome vintage aesthetics with a classic feel. Great location, within walking distance of everything...as well as being merely a block away from a cable car stop. Surprisingly inexpensive compared to other hotel options in same area.

review.title: Vintage Court was a complete failure
review.reviewText: Would never recommend it or stay there

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Squre
review.reviewText:
All was great. Got a gret deal through expedia for a top notch hotel.

Only downside was that I got the room with the view of the alley. But considering I probably paid less than everyone else in the hotel and I spent no time there at all in daylight hours I was very happy with the room.

review.title: A clear choice for a return visit
review.reviewText: Although all roads are uphill in San Francisco and the Vintage Court is no exception, it is worth the climb. We loved the efficient, friendly staff and the clean and yes spacious for San Francisco, sized room. The elevator is slow but if you are on vacation, why not? Wine tasting was ok wine wise but great to meet and greet other hotel guests. Cable care stops at the top of Pine and it is downhill to the front door or save your energy for one big stair climb off the beginning of the tunnel on Stockton. A great convenience store across the street and Uncle Vito's on the corner of Powell and Pine is great for Italian fare. An easy walk to Union Square and shopping and of course Lefty O'Doul's for lunch. Get a 7 day MUNI pass and use the cable car to go uphill! If you are a senior buy a monthly bus pass at the cable car stop Union Square for $15.00! A great way to get around San Francisco - Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the Zoo or anywhere. Vintage Court is very central and you can also walk to many places easily.

review.title: Average hotel if you're on a budget.
review.reviewText: Safe and fairly clean 3 star hotel with nice staff and an awesome restaurant attached to it (Massa's). If you're in SF and not going to be in the hotel a lot then it's a good choice.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: Small room but good value and good location. Would definitely go there again

review.title: Good value and excellent location
review.reviewText: Good service at check in. Excellent central location. V handy for union square. Safe area. Room sizeable with everything I needed. Bathroom a little small but otherwise room was nice. Watch out for the garbage trucks that come round at 4am. Woke me each morning. Not really the fault of the hotel but maybe I would ask for a room at the back in advance next time.

review.title: Good location - cost benefit
review.reviewText: My first room was not good. Lower floor, humid and noisy (aircon system). I request a new room and was sent to the 6th floor. Much better. There's a peculiar smell in the hotel, I think is effect of humidity, since the building is not very airy and do not receive a lot of light. In any case I would recommend because the location is good, the staff is very nice and the price is fair.

review.title: Satisfied Hawaiian
review.reviewText: Great location, affordable, complimentary wine tasting, did I mention great location? Previous reviewer(s) noted a "funky" oder of some kind... Well, it's seems like stale air mixed with the scent of the disinfectant. Tolerable, unless you're really, really sensitive.

review.title: Scojomojo
review.reviewText: Perfect for my needs. The room was just the right size and the hotel is in a good central location for everything. Right by Chinatown and the cable cars. Not far from the BART station and right by Union Square. Lots of bars and late nite restaurants. Very quiet. Friendly and helpful staff

review.title: not going to return to the Executive Hotel, Vintage Court
review.reviewText: What's good about the hotel is its location and, I believe, safety. What's not so good about the hotel is: paper-thin walls, I heard my neighbor coughing and definitely heard street traffic and cable cars, and I was on the 8th floor; the room was cold at night and there were not enough covers; the hotel lobby had wall-to-wall carpeting that was old and felt dusty. When I booked in I was given a room that, upon entering, had not been cleaned.

review.title: not what I expected
review.reviewText: The hotel didn't offer all of the amanities they claimed.

review.title: Great downtown location
review.reviewText: Just a block or two from the Chinatown gate... North Beach is just a short walk... loved the restaurant Gitane. Super central location to all SF fun!

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location; we were close to public transportation, Chinatown, shopping, etc. We were able to walk to just about anywhere. The hotel staff members were pleasant and attentive. Our room faced the street. While there was some noise (as can be expected when your hotel room is centrally located in a large city) it was less than I expected. Over all, it was a great experience.

review.title: Beware
review.reviewText: On arriving to hotel manager was asleep..........we called ahead of time and was told there was free parking and upon arrival found out we had to pay 38 per night..............The room was disgusting, looked as if it hadn't been dusted or vacuumed in weeks, the shower was dirty and the curtain had mold on it. Very stuffy smelling and had to sleep with window open to get fresh air. Even for the cheap price my husband and I would never stay here again.....................

review.title: comfy cozy lobby
review.reviewText: The location is amazing because the cable car stop is literally a hop, skip and a jump away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel offers a complimentary wine reception in their lobby which is very cozy; there is always a fire going and the couches and chairs are chic yet cozy. And for traveling in the month of January, the fire was nice to warm up by before or after heading out. However, the trash trucks were so LOUD in the mornings! it woke us up a couple mornings. The fabric panel headboards of the beds really gave the room a lot of character.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed here on business with 2 colleagues. We had a great stay and the service was excellent. Very charming and nice atmosphere. Only complaint was the outside noise. The windows/walls seemed very thin and I woke often due to garbage collectors and sirens.

review.title: Tammy from Denver
review.reviewText:
Check-in was okay. the guy at the front desk put me in a room near elevator but i requested through Expedia that i need a room far away from elevator, anyways, he moved me to a better room and a better view. i was happy with the room BUT it smell so bad, i don't know what kind of chemical they use to clean the carpet but it smell awful. Me and my bf ended up had to buy a carpet cleaner (the powder one) to put on the carpet. It helps so much. But the rest of the hotel is fine, very cozy lobby and situated in a nice area, close to China town gate only 2 blocks a way and 2 block to Union square and 1 block a way from the famous cable car. Location was very convenient for us to roam around.

The staff was extreamly helpful and he also help me with all direction because it was my first time in SF.

review.title: Good for what I needed
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, easily accessible by walking, BART, the bus AND the cable cars. We didn't spend much time there as we wanted to see as much of SF as we could. That being said, the room, along with everything in it, felt a bit small. For the price and the location I would stay there again

review.title: Middle of San Fran.
review.reviewText: Comfortable bed,wine in the early evening helped to meet other guests.Not much for frills, but we did not spend alot of time at the hotel.

review.title: would stay here again if i had to. ti was quiet and clean.
review.reviewText: my overall review for the price and location i would stay here again. it was very quiet and no people hanging out in front of the place . it was close to ublic transportation.

review.title: GREAT HOTEL & LOCATION
review.reviewText: See above statement!

review.title: Good quality/price
review.reviewText: The location was great, there are a couple of nice restaurants and art galleries nearby and its also a great spot for shopping. We were at walking distance of the SFMOMA, of the Embarcadero and of many other great places. The only down side is that our room had a weird smell, perhaps from the chemicals used to clean. Also, don't bother going to the hotel's restaurant its way over-priced.

review.title: Overpriced
review.reviewText: The bed was uncomfortable, the air conditioner didn't work, the room was musty and there were stains on the sheets.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: As other reviews state, this place has great location!!! The only thing, the guy at the desk was a little sparse on hotel info. I had to ask him about everything instead of there being something in the room telling you, or even him telling us upon check-in. They DO NOT have a continental breakfast, it's just coffee and tea. The fitness equipment (3 machines) worked great but there was no towels or cups for their water in the fitness room.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Stayed here for New Year's and was pleased that our room was available early (11am). The room was small and does have an "old" smell but for one night, it was really no big deal. The hotel offers a wine reception and they constantly walk around and offer you more which was nice. Only wished that they offered some breakfast items. Hotel staff were very friendly.

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in very convenient area. Only a few blocks walk to the station of cable car and Union square. Also very near to Chinatown where I enjoyed "DIM SUM" for lunch. My room was not so large but enough for several days stay. Room is kept clean and staff is nice. There's nothing so special but I satisfied this hotel.

review.title: Loved the Whole Experience
review.reviewText: My husband and I booked this hotel for our honeymoon and we were extremely satisfied. We loved the nightly wine receptions in the lobby and the concierge was very attentive and had some wonderful restaurant recommendations for us in Chinatown. The hotel was so close to many of the sites we wanted to see while in San Francisco. While the rooms are a little bit smaller, we found it was quaint and comfortable. I would recommend for others to stay here and would definitely stay here again!

review.title: I Left My Heart in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I agree with all the other reviews that I read about this hotel and was not disappointed. The location of the hotel was outstanding, the staff excellent and the room itself more than adequate. We were quite high up in the hotel so had some natural light. Yes we could hears the bins being empty early some mornings, yep there was some street noise, but seriously people, you are staying in a city, if you don't want normal city sounds then stay in the country.

You literally have a cable car at your door to jump on. make sure you buy a muni pass, otherwise one small trip costs you $5.

The room did have a slight musty odour when we first arrived but after a quick spray of room freshner and leaving the windows open for some fresh air everything was fine in no time.

Vincent, at the front desk was fantastic, friendly and lovely and it felt like you were greeting a friend everytime you came in and out of the hotel.

Don't count on the wine reception though, if you're from Oz and enjoy wine you'll be disappointed in the quality, and it can get quite busy so hard to sit down.

My only other comment would be to probably avoid the mini bar. Ours looked like it hadn't been updated for about 10 years.

Also try the Mexican bar/restaurant on the corner, especially on Tuesdays when drinks are half priced. Cheap Dos Equis beers and best beef bean dip I've ever had make a very happy hour or three.

Also try Mel's diner for THE BEST CHEESEBURGER I'VE EVER EATEN!

review.title: Hotel is fine
review.reviewText: Everything was fine except for the absence of advertised continental breakfast. Only tea in the morning but no food at all.

review.title: Nice basic hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice - had a change of plans so got a free upgrade to a bigger room which was lovely of the hotel management. Room and bathroom was clean. Only complaint is room had a funky smell - not very bad just strange.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel in excellent location.
Some rooms smaller than others so ask to be moved if not happy.
Can be bit noisy from road outside but to be expected in city center location.
Staff very helpful and fire in lobby was great, as was free coffee in morning and wine in evening, much appriciated!

review.title: Nice value hotel
review.reviewText: The conceirge was very friendly, even helping us to find a restaurant that we had passed by but didn't know the name of. The room had a funny smell to it when you first walked in (and every time after that) but you got used to it. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The heating was a little dicey at times but I think SF was having unusually cold weather during this time. We never made it back to the hotel for the wine tasting but I'm sure it was great. We never ate at the hotel restaurant (Masa's) because it was too expensive but it comes highly rated. We would stay here again. The location is excellent.

review.title: boutique hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was fine. I reserved a king room, which was fine, as it was clean, and fairly well appointed. It was reasonably comfortable and large enough. The issues I had were: the windows looked out on a not too beautiful inner courtyard and there was only coffee and tea in the morning, with nothing else. Also, the last block from Union Square was quite an uphill one. However, on a nearby corner is the Powell St. cablecar. But all in all, the hotel experience was quite nice.

review.title: Nice but uncomfortable
review.reviewText: Great location and wine reception. Elegant hotel and nice accommodations. However, the mattress and pillows are extremely uncomfortable, the air (window) unit is noisy, and the advertised breakfast is no longer available.

review.title: Very happy with all staff, services and facilities provided
review.reviewText:
The hotel is situated 2 blocks from Union Square. There is no problems getting parking validated or directions or accurate advice from the staff.
There is a charge for in-room internet access and the rooms also do not have a fridge or coffee making facilities but tea and decent quality coffee is provided in the lobby each morning.
We would definately go back to this hotel. We felt safe at all times in this area.

review.title: Not bad for a few nights
review.reviewText:
We stayed at this hotel on either end of a 5 night time-share down the street. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable, but you pretty much get what you are paying for and we had some issues with figuring out the heating set-up on one cold night.

The hotel has a nightly wine reception from 5-6pm, but honestly - we were so busy elsewhere in SF that we never made it. There is also coffee in the lobby each morning, but it ran out pretty quick.

The area was great. Just get a weekly transit pass and take the cable cars wherever you need to go.

review.title: Outstanding Staff and hospitality
review.reviewText: Fantastic stay. The staff was so accomodating and the hotel provided great services like free wine and apps at night and very clean rooms. I would stay here again anytime.

review.title: Great Location, Standard Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location near Chinatown and Union Square is close. Easy walking distance to lots of sights. Hotel is nice enough, pretty standard but not run down. Wine tastings in the evening are a nice touch

review.title: great location with great staff
review.reviewText: This was a lovely hotel with fantastic staff. The wine evenings were a great start to your evening. The hotel was close to everything we wanted to do. The only downside to the hotel was it smelt musty in the rooms but we got used to the smell after a day or so.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel locarion very good, very central and safe (single woman on her own and I felt safe). The room was a good size and the bathroom was good. The reason I didn't score it higher is that I was put in a room that backed onto a/c units so it was very very noisy. Also the inclusive breakfast has recently discontinued and so people that booked prior to Sept were given a box with muffins (they didn't look very appealing so didn't bother accepting it). The cable car stop half a block away was brilliant (so no need to carry all your bags up the hill). For the price really can't complain.

review.title: Can't wait to go back! The hotel and staff were amazing!
review.reviewText:
We felt welcome and comfortable the minuet we walked into Hotel Vintage Court, the front desk staff were so help full! The lobby was so cute and comfy we hung out there all night with some other hotel guests -it was alot of fun!

So much we wanted to see was within walking distance of the hotel-it was perfect.

review.title: excellent value and very comfortable
review.reviewText:
This hotel had a great location very close to union sqaure but in a quiet area away from all the noise.
I stayed twice in a king room and both rooms very excellent. Large, comfortable and very clean.
The hotel and rooms had a homely feel but still of a high standard.
Would definitely return and highly recommended.

review.title: Absolutely Perfect
review.reviewText: The location was excellent! Plenty of little restaurants nearby for a sit-down or a quick bite to take out. I love the trolley cars and the walk to see the musical "Wicked" was only about 20-25 minutes. The hotel offered free wine-tasting in the afternoons around 5:00 pm. There was always a cheerful fire burning in the foyer-living room. Tours were easily available to book at the front desk and everyone was friendly and helpful. Chinatown was just around the corner and if you're fit a 45 minute atmospheric walk would get you to the crooked street and 10 to 15 more minutes gets you to Fisherman's Wharf. My room was always cleaned with fresh towels. I will be back!

review.title: Will Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: On the whole, the stay was very pleasant: the location is as good as it gets; the hotel is very well maintained (we had a room on the top floor that, despite very little view, was lovely); and the service was good enough (cleaning staff was superb; front-desk staff were, well, decent). There is absolutely no shortage of things to do, and places to eat, shop, etc.--all accessible from Hotel Vintage Court. Just don't bring your car, and, if you do, don't park it in the hotel's designated garage (it costs a small fortune). A solid choice in the Union Square area.

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Front desk workers, always helpful. Location could not be better. We recommend getting the city pass (59$ - 7 days free transportation, free museums, etc) check it out, we though it was worth it. We had read about a 'funny' smell to the hotel and yes it is there, but did not bother us. Must be the humidity stuck in the carpets. Bed extremely comfortable - new pillows need. The 5 - 6 wine tasting added to the touch. Would definately go back.

review.title: Very good
review.reviewText: Exellent location, 5 minutes walk from Union square, cable cars and China Town, friendly service, complimentary wine tasting is a bonus. One negative remark - musty smell in the room although it's clean. Bring air freashener.

review.title: Great location, good value!!
review.reviewText: Right in the heart of union square, 1/2 block from cable car stop..amazing location! Wonderful evening wine reception, every night! Charm of an old hotel with modern amenities.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: We loved the location! We walked a lot and it was so close to Union Square, the cable car stop, Chinatown was a couple blocks away. It was clean. Most of the staff were extremely friendly. The nightly wine reception was a great bonus!

review.title: noisy hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good central area. however, the hotel is also not far from a large fire station. Therefore, you hear fire engines constantly, day and night. Also, you will hear dumpster trucks. We got no sleep while we stayed at this hotel, but the front desk staff did. On our first morning, we went downstairs and the girl working the desk was sound asleep, snoring loudly. We left the hotel and went to starbucks. When we returned 15 minutes later, she was still sound asleep. We got on the elevator, and went upstairs all the while not waking her up. She never knew we left and returned to the hotel. The rooms here are very small. The bathrooms have running toilets. I won't stay here again.

review.title: Excellent value in Nob Hill
review.reviewText:
Excellent front desk staff, beautiful building, however our room did have a slight odor to it. The wife referred to the odor as "old people smell". I don't disagree.

Great value, half the price of other hotels in the surrounding areas with all the amenities.

review.title: really nice hotel
review.reviewText: very cute hotel, i go to San Francisco about 2 times a year and stayed in plenty of places around union square and this is far better then all the others ive stayed at. i love the wine tasting in the afternoon was a bonus touch.great location right near everything. would stay here again..

review.title: Good, but expensive.
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco and the motel seemed to fit the city. I was surprised at the price of the motel. For someone looking for a bed to sleep and excellent service this is a great motel. If you are looking for a luxurious new hotel, this may not be what you are looking for.

review.title: Vintage Court San Francisco
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and cosseted. We were give help with the local area and transport options and advice on how to get the most out of our visit. The hotel is very well placed for Union Square, the cable cars and trams, and the evening wine tasting provided a delightful chance to relax and meet other guests and share stories of our days. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to those who want something a little different and wish to the explore the delights of San Francisco. A gem!

review.title: Great location- not so impressed.
review.reviewText:
Our room was very crowded and small, but it was clean. Our friends had a more spacious room and were fine with it. The complimentary continental breakfast was disappointing. The had 1 airpot of regular coffee and a tray of mini muffins for the whole hotel.
The location was the best part, we could walk most anywhere.

review.title: Loved This Charming Hotel In Great Location!
review.reviewText: We've just returned from a 10 night stay at this hotel and I loved it! The hotel didn't look much from the outside but inside it was really charming and comfortable. It has a lovely cosy and comfy lounge where the staff serve muffins, danish pastries and coffee in the morning and wine in the evenings. Our room was really comfortable (no view from our room though). The staff were great too. Plus a fantastic location - would definitely go back.

review.title: Not very nice.
review.reviewText: On our arrival the tap in the bathroom sink broke off. We insisted on changing rooms. Toilet in the new room ran all the time, noisy garbage trucks outside at 4AM, small old rooms, tiny bathrooms. The continental breakfast was awful, coffee and a stale mini-muffin. Hotel is in a nice location, close to tram and Union Square. Staff were helpful and friendly, but the rooms don't live up to basic standards for a medium priced hotel.

review.title: Great hotel, great price
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at the Hotel Vintage Court. It was a very clean, well kept small hotel with a friendly staff. The front desk were always willing to give recommendations, directions, and imput on what to do while we were visiting San Francisco. Working in the hospitality industry I look for hotels where I feel welcome and at home. They met our satisfaction during our stay for sure. I love the wine reception in the evening!!!

review.title: Expensive Internet
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and the location. Most of the staff was very helpful to direct us to specific points of interest. The only drawbacks - they need a new supplier for the continental breakfast (muffins were terrible) and the internet is way too expensive ($18.oo per day)

review.title: Not so good
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, the staff was very courteous and helpful. But that being said, the room had a very funky smell, like old and sour. It was hard to stay 3 nights. The toilet didn't work it kept running and we had to take off the lid to stop it. We were very disappointed with the so called continental breakfast. Just coffee and very stale mini muffins. Definitely needs improvement. I would not recommend. Would try a different place next time.

review.title: a true boutique hotel
review.reviewText: During our visit we met a lot of the guests at the afternoon wine tasting hour. It was great to exchange tips on what to see and do in San Francisco. Clearly the boutique nature of the hotel was appealing to internationals as Americans were in the minority. If you're looking for the typical American hotel with huge rooms and a ton of onsite amenities, this hotel is not for you. If you like intimacy and a chance to meet other guests, give the Vintage Court a try.

review.title: It did the trick!
review.reviewText: You pay for what you get. This hotel is relatively cheap for San Fransisco but centrally situated. The staff were very helpful and courteous. I did feel there was a bit of a musty smell in the bedrooms and I guess the hotel could do with an update. The linen and bathrooms were however very clean. Breakfast consisted of a danish pastry and tea or coffee - it was fine. My room was rather noisy but on request I was able to change. As a lone female traveller I felt safe.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: I really like the Hotel Vintage Court. The staff is really nice and very helpful. If it wasn't for them we would have never figured out the MUNI system. The wine in the evening was really nice too. Although the rooms are small, they are comfortable and very clean, and you don't spend too much time there anyways. The continental breakfast is small, just pastry and muffins, but the coffee is fantastic. The beds are kind of hard but not too bad at all. All in all our stay was wonderful.

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: The location was great - central and within a block of a cable car stop. Staff was very responsive and the room was nice.

review.title: good hotel at the right price
review.reviewText: got a great deal on this old but renovated boutique hotel.service was excellent.staff very helpful.could do will better pillows,otherwise no complaints.

review.title: Rather good
review.reviewText: The wine testing everynight was great. The only downside was the carpet in my room who really stunk.

review.title: I'll be going back... Again for sure
review.reviewText: This hotel is close to everything, your just 2 blocks away from Union Square, just footsteps aways from resurants at good price,hotel is really nice, nice staff very friendly, Will be going back again in a couple of years.

review.title: Very good and good location
review.reviewText: Very good location, close to everything and far enough from the bad part. People very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and really good price.

review.title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Vintage Court for 4 nights. The location is central to Union Square, China Town, Nob Hill and a cable car stop. This was a return visit to the Hotel and we were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a bit small for a long stay, but adequate. The afternoon wine tastings were an added pleasure. Overall a lovely place to stay.

review.title: Decent Hotel
review.reviewText: i would stay here again. its nothing fancy, but great location.

review.title: We would stay there again
review.reviewText: This Hotel is in the heart of San Francisco. The staff was very friendly and informative. The hotel was well maintained and our room was very comfortable. We had the best stay there. When we go back to visit,this is the Hotel we will be staying at.

review.title: Will always choose this hotel
review.reviewText: I came to the Hotel Vintage Court after one night's sleepless stay in a comparable hotel on Union Square. I had stayed at the Court once before knew that it was quiet, clean, and very comfortable so immediately on rising I made reservations for the rest of my stay to be at HVC. The staff is courteous and helpful and I will always be sure to stay there whenever I visit San Francisco, which is about twice a year.

review.title: definitely recommended
review.reviewText: Ideal location, just a 10 min.walk from Market Street and all means of transport. Room was very confortable,quite and clean. Breakfast is served in the living room,near the fireplace,with classic music in the backgound and you can eat relaxed on the sofa.It wasn't particularly reach, but it was enough!Definitely I'd recommend it!

review.title: Had a wonderful stay; would highly recommend!
review.reviewText: Very comfortable. Moreish pastries for breakfast. Delectable complimentary wine at 5 pm each evening.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The hotel is reasonably priced, reminiscent of an old European-style hotel. It is old, but charming and in an excellent location -- two blocks from Union Square in one direction and two blocks from Chinatown in another. There are plenty of places to eat within walking distance. My sister and I enjoyed our visit immensely.

review.title: ok
review.reviewText: I am not too picky and thought maybe others were too harsh. There is an unpleasant odor, but not always noticeable. The room is quite small. The staff was polite. The room was very conveniently located.

review.title: Quaint boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Quaint little boutique hotel with very close access to near-by cable cars and the Union Square area. Hotel service was definitely top notch - extremely courteous and very knowledgeable about the surrounding area, with lots of touristy tips. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who was looking for a affordable hotel in the heart of San Francisco.

review.title: Room was o.k. for the price
review.reviewText: Location was good, room decor was nice but the room had a weird old smell and bathroom was a bit small.

review.title: Old style hotel (this is not a good thing)
review.reviewText: Old style hotel. Very small room. Micro bathroom. Noisy. Iffy wireless internet. Convenient to the city if you don't mind being almost to the top of Nob Hill. Would not stay there again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is fantastic. Just hop on a cable car a block away. The staff is willing to assist and very helpful. They had my room available for an early check in and answered my questions about the room. I stayed for 5 days and enjoyed every moment

review.title: quality stay
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were exceptional. The design was comforting. Everything was clean. I'm very pleased with the experience.

review.title: executive hotel vintage court
review.reviewText: nice, but small hotel, friendly people, clean and neat for an older building. bed was pretty hard, though. not a big prolem. close to night life in chinatown and north beach

review.title: Great deal for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an ideal location, just a quick walk to Union Square. The showers/tubs were dated and had some mild mildew. The carpet didn't look clean so I wore sandals all the time. It was nice having a fridge. I bought milk at the Walgreens (just down Powell) so I could have cereal every morning. The free wine was a very nice touch. Front desk was extremely helpful in showing me places to eat, run, etc. Internet costs way too much, and there wasn't a place to print my boarding pass without having to pay.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location and close to cable cart (on the corner)was a must! Spacious charming room. Bathroom a bit small but clean. Elegant gathering area for continental breakfast and we did get a chance to go to their daily evening wine reception which was a nice touch...

review.title: great value, great location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel was the location, and that I saved a lot in a special offer when booking. The decor is a little dated but the room was clean and the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. Complimentary breakfast was very minimal but there are great breakfasts everywhere in the city so you wouldn't want to stay in the hotel anyway! The internet access was pricey, wish I'd brought my laptop as there was free wifi all over town. I would stay here again because it was such a good base to explore SF from

review.title: I would love to go back
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely well located. All the staff of the hotel were extremely helpful and friendly. Although we seemed to miss the happy hour (wine tasting 5-6 pm) it was a added bonus. Although they served a continental breakfast a coffee maker in the room would be a good idea.

review.title: would stay there again
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel, very similar to Kimpton, but at at a better price. Only negative, and this is true of most hotels in San Francisco, the parking was very expensive. Location is excellent with shopping and restaurants just a short walk away.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: Make sure you request an interior room, or go down to the Walgreen's on Powell and buy some earplugs. Hotel is older and does have a weird smell, but hey, you're not going to be spending much time there anyway!!! Staff is greatttttttttttttttt!!

review.title: It's okay, but it could be better
review.reviewText: While the rooms were somewhat small, they were also clean and comfortable. The problems that I had with Executive Hotel Vintage Court is that 1)you must pay for wireless use (it is NOT free). 2)Continental breakfast is horrible! Only coffee, dry muffins, and bland danishes were available...I've had better at a 2 star hotel! 3)They put a hold on your credit card ($50 per night that you stay) WITHOUT telling us that at check in...this is a problem, especially if you are traveling on a budget.

review.title: Good place
review.reviewText: Great hotel. Nicely placed for Union Square and China Town. Cable car not far away but always full! Walking a must, prepare for the hills!!!! Staff friendly and courteous. Breakfast should have been available until 10am when we were there but was cleared away by 9am!! Everything otherwise was fine.

review.title: A bit small but a great location and a great deal!
review.reviewText: The complimentary breakfast and wine receptions were great. The even better part was its convenient location. The rooms were clean and the staff were very helpful and friendly. I would say the only disadvantages were the internet wasn't free and the rooms were somewhat small, but I think that is typical of San Francisco hotels. Make sure you ask for a room with a view because some have windows that open up to the wall of another building. Overall very satisfied!

review.title: Lovely Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Perfectly lovely hotel to stay in San Francisco. Excellent location, a couple of blocks away from Union Square and China Town. Very nice European feel and look to it. Other than the small shower, would definetely stay there again.

review.title: I recomend this hotel , I can come back to this hotel .
review.reviewText: I think , when you pay a reasonable price and you get a good service , I fell good . The hotel has an excellent ubication , close to everything ( cable car , bart station , fishermans wharf , chinatown , etc, ) .

review.title: nice hotel, nice location
review.reviewText: Very nice little hotel, old, but good. The staff very attentive, check in was very fast considering we arrived very late and were very tired. They even hold our bags our departing date so we could spend the day in the city. Continental breakfast good, excellent coffee and tea and pastries. Rooms were very clean. There was a complimentary wine tasting at 5, but we never get to taste it, because there's so much to do and visit in this great city. For the price we paid, it was a bargain.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Very convenient to everything San Francisco. Many attractions within walking distance.

review.title: Definitely Vintage
review.reviewText: The hotel is quite dated and has a funny smell. However, the location is great.

review.title: Friendly hotel, but way too noisy!
review.reviewText: Positives: Good location, friendly service, clean rooms. Negatives: noisy trash truck wakes you up @ 4am on the lower floors.

review.title: earlier reviews were helpful
review.reviewText: Perfect location and room was larger than expected based on earlier reviews. For the price, it is a perfect find. The continental breakfast is a zero and we returned to the hotel at 6:03 p.m. The wine service ended at 6 - no way were they going to give us glass of wine! Nonetheless, it is clean, the desk staff very, very helpful, quieter than expected and I will stay there again.

review.title: Good value for money
review.reviewText: Great location only a couple of blocks from union sq. and next door to Powell St cable cars. Good value for money and added nice touch with wine reception and coffee plus pastries and muffins for breakfast. All staff friendly and welcoming. Only negative point for my husband & I was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities available in the room or to order as room service.There were cold drinks available.

review.title: Would probably visit this hotel again
review.reviewText: Overall this hotel had its charm. The service was friendly, the wine tastings were quaint, the rooms were maintained often, and we were able to get in our room early when we checked in. It is fairly close to transportation and just on the corner is a lovely cafe. The only thing I did not necessarily enjoy was the size of the bathroom in the hotel. It was pretty small and the sink was placed outside the bathroom. Other than that, I would say we were pretty pleased with the location and stay at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court.

review.title: good value
review.reviewText: Excellent location just minutes from Union Square, trolley, subway. Good price. The nightly wine tasting was a nice touch. Room was fine, clean, some water damage to the wall from A.C. unit. Comfortable bed.

review.title: A Very Pleasant Boutique Hotel WiIthout the Inflated Boutique Price!
review.reviewText: I found more things to like about this hotel than not, and this review will be reflected of other hotels both in this price range and star/accommodation level. The relaxed service upon check-in was quick, and I was able to do so three hours before the scheduled check-in time. Thanks, Alex and Michael for being so polite and hospitable. My request for a top-floor room away from street noise was honored with no fuss. So my Queen room, though musty at first entrance, easily cleared out by opening the sliding windows (and yes, they are double-paned!), and was just the right size. Overal cleanliness of the room was quite good. I love the golden, earth-toned wallpaper and large crown and base mouldings, which is such a far cry from the bland whites and square corners of other places. Since I spent much of my time touring the city, I threw away any expectations of resort-like or Vegas amenities that is mentioned in several of the comments here. As for families, if you want reasonable accommodations for you and your brood, stick with the chains.

review.title: Disgusting bathrooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is very affordable well located, close to everything but unfurtunately the condition of the rooms is not acceptable. Because the status of our bathroom, after the first night we asked to be changed to a better room and we've got another even worst. Even for the price, we've got a very poor service.

review.title: Great location, Small bathrooms
review.reviewText: The sink in the bathroom was too small. There was hardly any room to place toiletries. The bathroom sink wouldn't drain and we had to ask them to fix it twice. The room had an old carpet smell but it wasn't over powering. The building itself just smelled old. Which it was! The location of this hotel was AMAZING and the people working at the front desk were very kind and helpful. It was a busy July 4th weekend and the price of our room was very reasonable. The 5 o'clock wine tasting was a classy touch and the wine was actually very very good.

review.title: The true San Francisco experience
review.reviewText: A great find right in the heart of Nob Hill. The hotel's staff went out of their way to help us find out what to do and how to get there. The rooms have a very eclectic feel, which I LOVED in San Francisco. I'll definitely be back!

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: Centrally located however our room was small and the trash trucks are constant every morning at around 5:00. Would stay closer to Fishermans Wharf area next time.

review.title: We shall return.
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice and clean. Is centrally located to everything yet away from the maddening crowd, a few steps away from the cable car stop, that takes you down to Union Square and a couple of blocks away from the gates of Chinatown. Personnels are happy to help and are very courteous. Can't beat the complimentary breakfast and newspaper and the afternoon wine tasting.

review.title: Great hotel....great location
review.reviewText: Outstanding stay....very reasonable...you can't go wrong.

review.title: Best location/best price!
review.reviewText: My family, friends and I have been staying at the Hotel Vintage Court for more than 15 years. The staff are friendly and willing to help whenever they can. The hotel is situated close to shopping and the cable car in Union Square. The Wharf is not far either, just a cable car ride away!

review.title: Great experience, great location
review.reviewText: Friendly, helpful staff. Good experience for the "not so big price" we paid. Would definitely stay again!

review.title: very vintage
review.reviewText: The hotel was extremely vintage. The smell of the rooms was musty, and moldy. The staff was helpful. Not a very family friendly hotel, it's more for couples. The continental breakfast was not anything special, don't plan on it filling you up. The location of the hotel was good. The room was so noisy it kept us up most of the night. The shower was so small that I could barely turn around, and I am a petite woman. Overall I would have paid more to stay in a more modern hotel.

review.title: Great hotel for the money. Would stay again.
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location and it was a good price through expedia. The hotel is definitely older and rooms are not huge, but that was expected going in. They are very clean and well kept though. The wine reception every night was a nice touch. Overall the staff was exceptional. The stay was great!

review.title: How fun is wine tasting in the afternoon
review.reviewText: We loved this hotel! The service was wonderful. What really sold us on this hotel is the afternoon wine tasting. Usually when you stay at a Hotel you are lucky to meet one or two other guests. When we came down to the wine tasting in the lobby we met a great family from Ireland a couple from Australia one from France and of course others from the US. It was so fun talking to everyone that we made a point to fit the wine tasting in every evening we were in San Francisco.

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: The room was very small but we didn't spend much time there, so it wasn't a problem. The bed was very comfortable and the staff was nice. Plenty of restaurants walking distance from the hotel.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: The only complain I have about the hotel is the smell. It smells pretty vintage but you really get used to it. Besides, everything is great... service, very friendly people, location!!!! I really recommend this hotel.

review.title: Absolute great
review.reviewText: Very good service. Friendly staff. Good idea to have a wine tasting every day between 5 and 6 p.m. The breakfast is not too big.

review.title: i would go back to this hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room and friendly workers

review.title: I Heart S.F!
review.reviewText: I was a little nervous about the Hotel accomidations. I was plesantly surprised with the overall service of the hotel.

review.title: OK for the price
review.reviewText: Very good location, clean enough, but nothing great. The room and bathroom were both large enough. My shower however was not working properly, which of course was annoying. I called down and was immediately set up with a new room and a key was sent up. However the key was not programmed correctly, so I had to go downstairs regardless. Not a huge hassle, but annoying. It was also noisy, with people carrying on above me and people carrying on outside, which for me was the back of a restaurant. In the morning, I was treated to clanking garbage cans.

review.title: Great Place to Stay
review.reviewText: The service there was unlike any service I've received from other hotels. Any question I had about places of interest or transportation methods were answered with ease. The rooms were a bit smaller than the norm but that's as to be expected as it is in San Francisco...but there was still definitely enough room. The best part about this hotel is the location. 2 blocks from the Union Square (and major transportation), 2 blocks from China town and too many restaraunts to name. Will definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a perfect location and was great for the price. We loved the cocktail hour, but could have used a better continential breakfast. Only coffee and small muffins were available. The hotel was recommended to us and we would recommend it to others.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court, Union Square
review.reviewText: Great location; however, hotel could use a little makeover. Though the room was clean, the carpets and bedding look really worn. Also, it's no secret when the people next door or upstairs are taking a shower.

review.title: Well Located with a personal touch
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and ever ready to assist with any questions/issues. Hotel had a personal feel. Room was dated but clean and comfortable(this is a renovated older style hotel after all!). The hotel is very well located being adjacent to Union Square, main trolley car line and China Town. Nob Hill is "just up the road". We would happily book this hotel again (providing it doesn't change!).

review.title: Nice Hotel Unbeatable Location
review.reviewText: Stay here 3 days, great location near Union Square and China Town. The Hotel staff was very nice and on-site 24 hours a day. They printed out my boarding passes for me at 11:00pm. The room was very comfortable, felt like a bed and breakfast type of room. I would stay here again without hesitation.

review.title: Perfect Location and Value!
review.reviewText: The Executive Vintage Court Hotel had the best location, it was only a 5-10 min walk to Market Street where all the shops were, was surrounded by amazing eateries, and was literally a 2 min walk to the cable car stop! There were also 2 parking garages located near the hotel with really decent prices, which is always a plus because parking in SF isn't always pretty. The Hotel wasn't the newest, but was incredibly quaint and cozy and is perfect for anyone just looking for a place to stay while they explore the city or enjoy a weekend getaway! The concierge was the nicest and most down to earth friendly guy who helped us all weekend too! I'm a college student so the fact that the prices were reasonable was definitely a major plus! My friend recommended this place to me and I've already recommended it to 3 other people, definitely check it out!

review.title: A good deal in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The Executive Vintage offers good value for a reasonable rate. The continental breakfast was light and the seating a little cramped but the danishes and the tea were high quality. The hotel offers wine tasting at 5pm. We had hoped wi-fi would be complimentary, but there are numerous free wifi cafes in the area. You cannot beat the proximity to attractions such as China Town and Union Square

review.title: Great Location for Bay To Breakers 12K Run
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Older style but very clean. Very nice staff. Wine tasting in the afternoon is a nice touch. The location is excellent. I basically walked to the many resturants, shops and bars in the immediate area. I visited in order to run in the 2009 Bay to Breakers 12K. Walked to the start the day of the race. Thanks to the manager for a great stay.

review.title: Horrible smell through the hotel
review.reviewText: Horrible smell through the hotel

review.title: Fabulous Hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText: I stayed here for 6 nights and was very impressed with every aspect of the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions for local activities and places of interest. The hotel offers complimentary wine in the lobby every night at 5pm for an hour. The drinks are not skimpy and the wine is good. The location of this hotel couldnt have been better. It is about 2 blocks from china town and there is a cable car stop on the corner. You can walk just about anywhere from here or catch the bus close by. The room was exquisite! The bed was large and comfortable. Our room was a corner room so we had two bench seats to view the city. This was a great choice and I would definately return.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Good service, clean. If you need a really quiet place I probably wouldn't stay in Union Square.

review.title: Wonderful Stay in Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is right near Union Square in San Fancisco. Perfect location with a cable car stop less then a block from the front door of the hotel. Really accessable to public transportation. A few blocks away to great shopping and delicious restaurants. Always someone at the main desk greeting every person. Breakfast consisted of muffins, pastries and scones with coffee, tea and orange juice, just enough to hold you over till lunch out in the hilly city. In the evening the free wine tasting was a great way to interact with the other guests and meet some neat people. I stayed on the 7th floor, had a corner room that overlooked Bush Street. Overall it was a great experience and will go back there when I travel to San Francisco again!

review.title: Service is good and rooms are clean
review.reviewText: It's located within walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square. Check in was at 3pm but we flew in early and were allowed to check in as early as 10 am. Our keycards to the room didn't work at check in but it was resolved by a friendly hotel staff. The style of the room is old, hence, the name "executive hotel vintage court". The rooms are small but it is very clean and worth the price for shorter stays.

review.title: It's in the smell
review.reviewText: That this hotel is old was expected. But I was not expecting the overpowering smell of urine and dirt. The room was tiny, and gave an overall feeling of discomfort. Would definitely not stay here again.

review.title: Always a great experience
review.reviewText: I've been staying at this hotel since it opened in 1983 and it's always a pleasant experience. Staff is hospitable, rooms are clean (if small) and it's a real San Francisco treat! Great location and one of the city's top restaurants is just off the lobby. An incredible bargain. One tip: Demand that they call you a taxi for the trip to the airport. I ended up with a limo service instead and the price I was quoted at the hotel ($40) became $50, then $45, then finally $40 once the driver started listing prices. He was all over the place. I think a taxi would be about $10 less.

review.title: Okay but would not return
review.reviewText: Although the location of the hotel was good, close proximity to Union Square, Chinatown, etc.. it was old (thin windows)and could not block out the street noises, revelers, bar crowds, etc.. lot's of talking, yelling, etc. finally quieted down after 2:00 am..bathroom very tiny could hardly move in it.

review.title: Perfect for a short stay
review.reviewText: The customer service is exceptional in this home-like feel of a hotel although the rooms are VERY small. Depicts old San Francisco which is part of the charm and perfect hotle choice and location for a short stay near Union Square.

review.title: Friendly staff - Nice stay
review.reviewText: The people at the front desk were really friendly and willing to provide directions. The heating system of the hotel is pretty old and the room was cold during the night, so it's not ideal for a winter stay. Breakfast is included, but don't consider that as a plus, as it is very plain and simple, almost no options. Great location.

review.title: It's an appripriate name.
review.reviewText: The hotel is very charming

review.title: Great hotel for a great price
review.reviewText: Executive Hotel was a great hotel in the heart of San Francisco. It is very close to the cable car line, so very easy to get where you want to go. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay there again if I visit San Francisco in the future. Not to mention the room rates are great!

review.title: Great Place!
