review.reviewText: Good value for your dollar. It is conveniently located, can walk to Union Square. Close to cable car, China Town and Downtown. Hotel looks good inside and out, neighborhood looks safe. continental breakfast was good.

review.title: close to union square, cable car , shopping stores
review.reviewText: I syayed there for 4 nights started on New Year Ev. The moment I got to the Hotel I was upgraded to a King size bed . there was no vew from the room , it faced the back street. The only problem was that the walls are not thick enough so I could here all night noises wich buthered me .

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Only problem was the noise of dumpsters being emptied at 5AM, even though I asked for a quiet room

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: hotel was ok, only problem was it was very cold at night and heating system did not work properly.There should be extra blankets in the room. I was literally freezing at night. Very old bathroom, not updated.

review.title: Great Location - Great Price!
review.reviewText: I've stayed at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court 4-5 times in the last several years. The room is always comfortable (a couple of rooms have been small, but always nice), the staff is great, and the 5pm wine tasting is a fun perk. This hotel is in the middle of everything - just uphill from Union Square, 3 blocks to the Chinatown gate, and a cable car passes on Powell less than 100 yards away. I plan to stay here again. Sometime, I'd like to pack a suit and try the Masa restaurant in the hotel - reviews are impressive.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel is perfect. It's two blocks away from Union Square and Chinatown. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. However, the bathroom was very small. The hotel indicates that a complimentary breakfast is served, but it is just coffee, juice and few pastries put on as table. However, in the evening, the hotel offers a free wine tasting. I would definitely go back.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. Central to Union Square and on the tram line. Lots of bars and restaurants in the area - great base to see San Francisco - would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great location, Boutique SF Hotel.
review.reviewText: The Vintage Court is A centrally located S.F. Hotel, close to China Town, Market Street, Cable Car stops right on the corner. The staff is friendly and knowledgable about the city. You an walk to most aresa or step on the Trolly and head to Fisherman's Warf. Great Rates as well, would definatly recommend and or stay there on my next visit to San. Fran.

review.title: Great location and very helpful staff
review.reviewText: Hotel is within walking distance to everything. Older hotel but well kept. Staff was very helpful and allowed us to check in early. They even held our luggage for us while we waited for our room so we could walk down to Union Square. Wine tasting every night at 5. The concierge was very knowledgeable and assisted us with navigating the public transportation system.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Would go back there again, great location, friendly and helpful staff. Our room was well decorated although the view of the trash cans was a bit of a let down and the noise at night sometimes was a bit loud!

review.title: Great location :-)
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to Union Square, cables & buses to Golden Gate Bridge. Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. Good and fresh breakfasts, but don't expect much except for pastries.

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: We make frequent trips to the city and try to experience hotels in different areas each time. This one was conveniently located within walking distance to Union Square/Market St/Mission St. which have tons of shopping, restaurants, and theater. You have the option of self-parking or valet; cab or cable car...all convenient for going further distances. The hotel is non-smoking which was a big plus for us (and most other guests from overheard comments). Our room was spacious, well stocked, and had very hot water for showers and bathing. Flat screen TV and safe. We were comfortable.

review.title: Never again1
review.reviewText: Room wasn't very clean, heater was broken on arrival (making a strong noise), they 'fix' it but it broke again in the middle of the night. Staff wasn't helpful, they kept answering the phone while talking to me. The driver they booked to bring me to the airport was really rude. A nightmare! You can go to a much nicer hotel, with better customer service and spend less.

review.title: wonderful place!
review.reviewText: What a beautiful, character hotel: great location, friendly staff and beautiful room.

review.title: Average hotel - decent location
review.reviewText: This is a fair to average hotel in a decent location just north of Union Square (relatively safe area). The room was o.k. but in need of a remodel - peeling wallpaper in bathroom, threadbare sheets, etc. Regarding cleanliness, I always ask myself, "Well, is MY house actually cleaner than this?" I found someone else's contact lense (blue) in my bathtub. Of course I'm not going to call housekeeping about that. But let's face it - my own tub doesn't get scrubbed daily either!

review.title: The hotel is very nice and all the people that work there are friendly
review.reviewText: The rooms are very nice, The location was excellent, very easy to go any were because everything is on a walking distance.

review.title: European style, which means...
review.reviewText: ... the room was a bit smaller than you would perhaps expect. Given that though everything was great. The service was extremely good and all staff were very helpful. It is not a 5-star as there is no room service or any of those extra amenities as it seems well suited to the business traveler, but it had its own extras (such as the nightly wine tasting) and its own little touches (such as each room being styled after a unique winery) that really made the hotel quite nice. It is not the hotel if you are looking for opulence and luxury but if you want a cozy atmosphere and very helpful staff at a reasonable cost, this is the place.

review.title: Nice Place Nice Price
review.reviewText: My Wife and I visted S.F. for the first time, we had a great stay, the hotel was clean and well kept, the afternoon/evening staff were fantastic always willing to help and provided outstanding local eating establishments, (Hunan home,John's Grill) Another big plus the hotel was within walking distance of many many things to do. Bring good walking shoe's those hills are tuff

review.title: Good place to stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a good location,and easy to travel around from the tram at the end of the street.This goes straight to pier 39.You can walk to Maceys and alot of shops.Also China town is 5mins away.Hotel staff very friendly and helpful to me asking daily directions.Hotel is clean,and comfortable.Free breakfast in the lobby daily was great.

review.title: great location
review.reviewText: shower was small and some confusion with handles no other negatives

review.title: Everything that you need
review.reviewText: Perfect hotel location. Very close to the strip and shopping Malls, as well as everything that you need under one roof. Complex contains hotel, casino, restaurants, bars and even a cinema all of which were brand new and total comfort. Really enjoyed my stay.

review.title: Best location to see the City
review.reviewText: Wonderful and friendly folks work at Vintage Court. Close walking distance to Union Sq and Chinatown. The cable car basically right out side the door to go to the waterfront. We really like the coffee service in the morning and there was quite a crowd for the wine social in the evening, which offers a way to meet the other guests.

review.title: A Great Value
review.reviewText: The best value for us was in the location. Close to everything we enjoy,...shopping, our favorite cafe, and of course Union Square. Use the valet parking and walk everywhere! The bed was extremely hard, but the room was quite nice. The whole hotel was very comfortable, and very inviting. We will surely be staying there again!

review.title: good location, great price
review.reviewText: nice spacious room, comfortable bed, and great location in the city.

review.title: Great Place to Visit
review.reviewText: The hotel room was fine. The evening wine tasting in the lobby each night was the best. Great opportunity to relax from the days event or talk to others about thier day. We walked every where and enjoyed the local eateries.

review.title: would stay again
review.reviewText: hotel near union square,100 yds from cable car ,stop the free wine at night is a nice touch helps to meet people from all over the world bedrooms a little small but very comfortable.

review.title: Bad, bad, bad choice
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel even if they have tried to make it look as a cosmopolitan hotel. The room was very small for a couple with a baby as it was the bathroom (no room for 2 peple at the same time). We wanted to stay 2 nights but after seeing the room we cancelled the second night and went somewhere else. The parking is not on site ($28/day)and the self parking is only from the hotel to the parking structure located a couple of blocks away. Once you get there is only valet parking. Bad neighborhood, very weird people around the entrance and not at all a place to recommend to someone looking for a safe place, great hotel, confi rooms and friendly staff.

review.title: Good value, great service
review.reviewText: This was my second stay in 3 weeks and really enjoyed it again. The wine reception each evening is a real treat.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the hotel's location close to the cable car line on Powell. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Nice common room area for the wine hour they offered in the evening. Had a chance to meet others staying at the hotel. Restaurants were close by. Only negative was the room I occuppied was close to the mechanical room and was very noisy in the evening while trying to sleep. However I would stay there again and highly recommend it.

review.title: I would stay at this hotel again.
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel. The hotel room was smaller than other hotels I have stayed in, however, I didn't feel it was too small. The room was cleaned very well every day and the bed was comfortable. The service was good, and everyone was very friendly. The hotel is about a block away from the cable car line. It takes you from Union Square to Fisherman's Wharf or Ghiradelli Square. I would stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: Staff was very courteous and helpful. Room was fine. Only complaint was that water pressure was low one day (out of 4) at 8:00AM (peak shower time?). Convenient location. I'd certainly stay here again.

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel was comfortable, location convenient, and staff very friendly.

review.title: very small room, weird configuration
review.reviewText: I wonder if the Vintage Court blocks their smallest room for Expedia reservations. The room beared no resemblence to the photographs on the website, the shower was extremely small with an old, yellowed shower curtain. Sink located in the main guestroom-not bathroom. Some may call this "character", I just call it disappointing. Don't bother with the Vintage Court.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: The room was small. The shower and toilet were together and the sink was in a closet room. The mini bar was there but I needed a refrigerator. The breakfast was really continental!!!!! No microwave.

review.title: Hotel is in a great location.
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel were very pleasant & helpful. It was a real treat to stay in a hotel that was getting to be 100 years old & to have everything working so well. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

review.title: Not great
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel due to the price and location, which were better than others. However, we were really not impressed with the room. It smelled and was not well-maintained. The lobby is pretty nice and they do offer continental breakfast and a wine tasting.

review.title: Friendly service and good location
review.reviewText: Near Union Sq, China town and financial district. Good Price and service! Liked wine tasting every evening!

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Hotel Vintage Court five nights and I asked for a nice room when we checked in, however they placed us in a room that was off the back alley. It was very noisy every morning around 4:30am due to either trash removal or local bars emptying their trash (Sunday) - unbelievable. The GM was well aware of the situation due to comments he made as we checked out, therefore I felt that they were not interested in our comfort. Maybe better windows and thicker drapes are called for to minimize the noise.

review.title: The Best!
review.reviewText: First off the wine reception was so nice! I thought it was going to be like 1 ounce of white and red each. But it's basically unlimited wine for an hour each day, and it's good wine too! It makes everyone so relaxed and much more social, you can get great tips from the staff as well! The location was great. Right in the middle of union square and nob hill and between tons of transportation. The room was roomy enough and very clean/comfortable. Breakfast was just enough to get the day started. Of course you should try Sears Fine foods (down the street on Powell) at lease once for a hearty good American Breakfast or brunch.

review.title: Charming old hotel
review.reviewText: I was impressed with the historic charm of the facility and its amenities for guests. The continental breakfast was slim, however, the daily afternoon wine tasting was an added bonus. If I had a complaint it would be the rattling of the old radiator heating system at night. However, this is a 100+ year old facility and radiators are to be expected even with their noise. For someone interested in an charming old hotel that is not a name brand, I would recommend this location.

review.title: Wonderful stay.
review.reviewText: Our initial reaction to the room was that it seemed very small. However, when we realised how well appointed and comfortable the room was we were very satisfied. One must accept that in an older style building, the space available in each room is not as large as in modern hotels. This is one of its charms. The staff at the hotel are extremely friendly and polite and go the extra mile to be helpful. The room was very clean and well maintained. It is handy having the small fridge and a discreetly placed safe in the room. Thank you to Expedia for including the Vintage Court in your selection of hotels. We will definitely return.

review.title: Great Staff and Location!
review.reviewText: The staff were friendly and went out of their way to make your stay pleasent. The location was great!! We didn't even use our car, we walked everywhere because everything was so close. The room did smell a little stale when we got in but, after we opened the window and turned on the fan for a couple of minutes it was gone. Also, the room was on the small side but we only stayed a couple of nights so it was not a problem. Besides, you are out and about most of the time so the room size didn't really affect us.

review.title: Great location, comfortable room....
review.reviewText: The hotel was accommodating in my late arrival, quickly checking me in after a long day of delayed flights. The location is nearby to shopping, galleries, transportation and only half a block to the cable cars. Some staff were helpful, others were not friendly or helpful. The wine tasting daily event is a very nice touch. In the rooms, very comfortable bed and pillows, spa like toiletries, safe provided, quiet despite being close to downtown core. The lighting could be brighter but sufficient. All in all, would stay again.

review.title: Really bad
review.reviewText: The smell in the room was awful and trash pick noises started at 4:40am and lasted until 7:30am. I will never stay in this hotel again.

review.title: Great as always!
review.reviewText: This was our third time staying at the Vintage Court. It is in a great location-close to Chinatown and close to the Chinese New Year Parade. The Powell St. cable car is half a block away. It is always clean and problem free. The staff are always top notch. Definitely a great place to stay.

review.title: Did not stay the night
review.reviewText: The biggest problem was the lack of heat. We caught a cold, rainy day in San Francisco and were looking forward to a warm room, but there was no heat. Guests were wearing coats and gloves in the lobby. After complaining about the lack of heat in our room went out to dinner. With no improvement upon our return, we moved to another hotel.

review.title: bad vacation
review.reviewText: the hotel was old , bad service, and too expensive for what really is!

review.title: Great Location, Obliging Service, Very Good Value
review.reviewText: The Executive was a very nice experience. People were friendly, wine hospitality hour (especially Friday) was a very welcome treat. Only wish The Executive would match similar "boutique" hotels and offer FREE Wi-Fi service.

review.title: Worth the money spent
review.reviewText: Good position, close to Union Square. Nice wine tasting and simple breakfast,

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Wonderful hotel with great location. The rooms are a little small but clean and quiet. Complimentary breakfast and afternoon wine add to the relaxing experience. We have stayed in several downtown hotels but feel this one gives the most bang for the buck.

review.title: Turn up the heat
review.reviewText: The hotel only has wireless internet in the lobby and dial-up in the rooms. They would turn the steam heat off at night, leaving the room quite cold at night.

review.title: Good Hotel at a Good Price
review.reviewText: As others have said, the hotel is clean and well-kept, the staff is great and the location is great. The only problem I had was with the heating system. The weather was cold and the hot water register was somewhat noisy. I got used to it, but it would have been nicer had it been quieter. I'm assuming most days of the year this wouldn't be a problem.

review.title: Would definitely go back
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, just off the beaten path from Union Square. You can walk there (up hill) from the Bart Station. Hotel is very charming and comfortable. Staff is quiet and helpful. Nice wine in the evening and light breakfast in the morning. Small rooms, but clean and cozy. We loved it.

review.title: Fabulous hotel, excellent service
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. It was very nice and had that San Francisco feel, not stuffy and up tight. The people were pleasent and helpful, we would definatley stay again.

review.title: Good Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located three blocks from Union Square, near great restaurants, shopping, etc. The evening wine tastings were a nice feature, the staff members were most helpful and pleasant and the complimentary continental breakfast was adequate. Our room was very small, but that isn't unusual in older hotels in downtown San Francisco, and the price was right.

review.title: Can't wait to go back,
review.reviewText: Very good location, small put nice. Staff really nice, willing to help always. Wine tasting was great.

review.title: Good place to stay.
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel is ideal, staff were all friendly and helpful. Rooms were not large but were for a city centre hotel. Complementary breakfast was coffee and a danish. Ideal when heading out for early morning sightseeing.

review.title: Doesn't live up to its own hype
review.reviewText: The front desk people were friendly and even helpful, the location (on Bush between Powell and Stockton) was good, and the parking was conveniently a block away, valet-style. Other than that the place was a let-down. Our first queen room had a view of a wall and we asked to move; they put us in a queen with a sort-of view on the top floor, one of their "best" queens. Our main complaints: the queen bed was hard as rock; the shower was weak and too low to get your head under it; the room was so small that once you've laid out your stuff you have no place to sit down other than the bed. Lighting was dim and unreachable from the bed - forget about reading. Room was not decorated to reflect a specific winery, though a winery name was on the door. So-called wine tastings in the (admittedly cozy) lobby each evening were actually just one mediocre red and one mediocre white - the same one every day. If you just need a crash pad and the location is right and you can sleep on cement, it's perfect!

review.title: Doesn't live up to its own hype
review.reviewText: The front desk people were friendly and even helpful, the location (on Bush between Powell and Stockton) was good, and the parking, though expensive at $26 a night, was conveniently a block away, valet-style. Other than that the place was a let-down. Our first queen room had a view of a wall and we asked to move; they put us in a queen with a sort-of view on the top floor, one of their "best" queens. Here were our main complaints: queen bed was hard as rock; shower was weak and too low to get your head under it; room was so small that once you've laid out your stuff you have no place to even sit down other than the bed. Lighting was dim and unreachable from the bed - forget about reading. Room was not decorated to reflect a specific winery, though a winery name was on the door. So-called wine tastings in the (admittedly comfortable) lobby each evening were actually just one free, cheap red and one free, cheap white - the same one every day. If you just need a crash pad and the loaction matters to you and you can sleep on cement, it's perfect!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The only issue we had is the comfort level of this hotel. Bed was very hard and didn't sleep well one night. Also, room was small so didn't allow for much lounging. But it was clean, very conveniently located with parking garage just a block away and great for shopping, eating out etc.

review.title: Clean hotel, great location
review.reviewText: This was a great location in San Francisco: close to the cable cars, Chinatown, Union Square, etc. We could walk or ride MUNI anywhere we wanted to go. The hotel was clean and well-kept, the rooms were comfortable if not spacious. We only had one complaint: One night, after being gone all day, we came back to find our door ajar. Luckily nothing was missing that we could see, but we called the front desk anyway, to report the problem, and the clerk didn't seem concerned. No apologies were forthcoming, and no mention of the incident was ever made by any of the staff for the remainder of our stay.

review.title: Fantastic find - would certainly stay there again
review.reviewText: This place is an absolute gem. And what incredible value for money. Clean modern room in a great location for less than what you would pay for a crummy motel in Australia. The 'breakfast' wasn't much - just help yourself to coffee and pastries at reception but that's a very minor quibble. Free wine at 6 o'clock evry night too (no kidding)

review.title: Good location, can't beat Happy Hour
review.reviewText: Located just a couple of blocks from Union Square, this quaint hotel served my wife and I well. It's central, and the concierge desk knew many of the attractions and could make reservations etc. There was a restaurant attached, but we didn't eat there. Every night from 5 to 6 there is a free wine tasting; most nights there are a seemingly limitless number of bottles of the house red and white but some nights they have local vineyards in to show off their wares. I'd recommend it.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated close very centrally which is an advantage. The disadvantage is that rooms are rather loud even if they are not facing the street, but then they are facing concrete walls and air-conditioning-systems. The hotel was ok but not a treat.

review.title: Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel was conveniently located. Helpful staff. A little noisy on lower floors. Nice touch was the wine tasting.

review.title: Great Location, old room.
review.reviewText: Some green stuff came out of my sink. Funky smelling room.

review.title: Nice Stay! Would definitely recommend
review.reviewText: This hotel is located in a great location, close to union square shops and it is super cute! I definitely enjoyed the wine tasting every night! Uncle Vito's pizza place as well as the Mexican food place close to the hotel are both very good! I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: great staff
review.reviewText: The room had lots of little extras and staff were very helpful. The free wine reception was a nice touch.

review.title: Very nice hotel, good location, friendly staff. Would return
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel and a good location to Union Square and shopping. Hotel is old but well maintained. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was large but the bathroom was small. Enjoyed the free wine between 5:00 & 7:00 and they provide free juice, roll and coffee in the morning.

review.title: Great hotel for the price
review.reviewText: A great place to stay - easy walking distance to Union Square, many shops & restaurants, and the cable car stops at the corner. The complimentary wine tasting every night in the lobby was a great way to unwind & meet other guests. The only negative comment I have is that the trash pick-up at 4:30 AM is very noisy & it woke me up every morning.

review.title: perfect location
review.reviewText: this hotel was within walking distance to almost everything, the cable car was steps away from the front door the people at the front desk and door were very nice and helpful, they suggested where to go to eat and booked our shuttle bus to the airport for us. this hotel is one of the good ones, a nice touch is the coffee, pastries and fruit in the morning

review.title: Fairly run down with poorly informed desk staff
review.reviewText: See above

review.title: Perfect Location! Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Highly professional qualified staff in a very nice hotel. Located just 2 blocks from Chinatown and Union Square. Served wonderful coffee and fresh rolls in the morning and wine from 5-6 in the afternoon. Very pleased and will return when I visit SF again.

review.title: Really nice boutique hotel, great price, excellent area!
review.reviewText: It really was a great hotel, and the people were who worked there for so helpful & friendly. Each room has its own unique design. They also had daily complimentary wine tasting in the front room! The front room was really nice (fire place, couches, etc.) Great place to stay, close to everything. Really great value. I would recommend this place to anyone.

review.title: Great location. Outstanding personnel
review.reviewText: We stayed here for 6 nights and, while the room we had was in serious need of updating, it was clean and the bed very comfortable. We complained of noise after the first night and they moved us to a much quieter room with no problem. The staff was extremely helpful with directions, bus routes, etc. Wine-tasting at night was a nice touch. Full glasses. Breakfast was just coffee, muffins and juice but enough for our taste. Muni pass is a great deal for $11 one day or $18 for 3.

review.title: An enjoyable time
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our time at the Vintage Court. We'd ordered a king deluxe room. Upon arrival we received a king, but the room was smallish. We could have survived in it, but we asked for and received a room that was king but quite more spacious overall, brighter with more window space. As we were staying seven nights, we felt we should've received this room from the start. Besides that, the hotel is cozy and very well situated in town, the continental breakfast is perfectly good enough to get the day going, the daily 5 p.m. wine tasting is a blast and a chance to meet other guests. One night a bunch of us went out to dinner together! All of the hotel staff were very pleasant except one, and it was easy to avoid him. It was fun being two blocks from the entrance to Chinatown and near bus stops. We plan to stay at Vintage Court again.

review.title: Great location but showing signs of age
review.reviewText: As with any hotel in a big city there is noise... but the single pane class in the bathroom lets in more that I would like. The hotel itself is showing signs of wear and tear but is relatively clean. This is likley the case for all properties not considered premium properties. The service was good and the location was great.

review.title: Very unique hotel
review.reviewText: This was a great hotel, unique; rooms were small but very comfortable. Not there to spend time in the room so it was completely adequate for our needs. Convenient to all amenities. Service was first class. Highly recommend.

review.title: A Great Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel is qaint with nice little touches like free wine tasting for an hour every evening. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Hotel is centrally located and great value for money. Will stay again if ever back in San Fran.

review.title: An intimate cosy hotel in the heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: We stayed for a week in this rather intimate hotel on Bush Street just off Union Square . It has more of a Guest House feel to it with a wonderful sitting lounge with a hearth fire and comfy settees. A bonus for an American Hotel was the fact we had breakfast (muffins,pastries unlimited coffee, juice and tea) consumed cosily in this big lounge without formality lending to a very friendly social setting. The staff werer quite laid back not in your face but very attentive when required and all had a homely demeanour about them. The room we had was spacious , well kept and had roomy bathroom with a very good shower. One of the surprises was a wine tasting event between 5and 6 every night! and your glasses which were already well filled were topped up again(and in my case again) This Hotel added to tjhe wonderful City that is San Francisco which instantly became our fav US City which all the Guide Books reckoned would happen.

review.title: Charming little hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly. Very quaint rooms. There was no bathtub but shower was nice. Room was large. We were facing alley way and garbage truck came every morning early. Good price for the room.

review.title: Excellent hotel stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel and staff were both excellent. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend to anyone for either business or leisure to stay at the Executive Vintage Court Hotel.

review.title: Great Value and Location
review.reviewText: I really found the place convenient (central location) and very reasonably priced for San Francisco. Recommended.

review.title: ok...not anniversary material...but good for business
review.reviewText: ok for business but not if this is your anniversary. a little run down and the mattresses are HORRIBLE!

review.title: Comfortable and Fun
review.reviewText: The Executive Hotel Vintage Court was not only a good value hotel for San Francisco, but the location, the quietness, and the staff were all super. The nightly wine tasting was fun and we got to meet a lot of people, many visitors from other countries. The restaurant connected with the hotel is quite outstanding. Friends we were traveling with said it was the best ever. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

review.title: Excellent - Well return to this hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is awsome! Our room was very clean and most comfortable bed I have slept on in a hotel in a long time. Our room location was quiet. The price you could not beat anywhere else. The hospitality was friendly and helpful- not to mention the convienent location.

review.title: excellent hotel,friendly and comfortable good location
review.reviewText: enjoyed our stay very much

review.title: What a great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We have just returned from an excellent stay at the Executive Hotel Vintage Court. The location is perfect- 2 blocks from Chinatown, half a block from the Trolley, close to Union Square and the theatre district. The hotel is small, friendly, and so nicely redone to keep the "vintage" feel. Parking is expensive and off site, but that too worked out well. You don't need valet service- its' only a block away. We'll definitely go back!!

review.title: close to everything.
review.reviewText: clean and cozy room, the people were polite and helpful. I recommend this place for tourists.

review.title: Will definitely go back!!!
review.reviewText: The hotel was an older building that was in good condition, very boutiquish like, very cute. Hotel staff and service were awesome, very nice and helpful. The wine reception in the evenings is a great place to meet others staying in the hotel and just unwind all together. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Great location too!!!

review.title: good value and location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location 2 blocks from Union Square and Chinatown. Room was good sized except bathroom very cramped and not enough towels provided. Nice lobby and lounge area and the afternoon wine service was very enjoyable.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: We stayed in March on Spring Break, rather than going to Cancun like most college aged people. The hotel's in a great location. The rooms were cute and nice. Ours had a big new flat screen TV. I think it was the 'deluxe room'. Go with that. Ask for a higher floor with one that has a flat screen. The hotel did have a little bit of an old smell but no big deal. It is after all an older hotel. The wine service is nice. We usually aimed to get back in time for it and rested our feet with 3 or so refills. It's definitely an amazing value for it's located and quality in San Fran. I'd stay again whenever we're back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Just a half block from catching a cable car and less than 2 blocks from Chinatown. This is why I booked my stay and do not regret. My room was very spacious with unexpected amenities - bathrobe, minibar and plasma tv. Could see why patrons may complain about uncomfortable beds, but I was okay with it. The wine was a nice welcome to the end of sightseeing day, however, the hotel should discontinue serving a continental breakfast which includes stale muffins and sugary pastries. A bowl of fresh fruit and wrapped granola bars would be an improvement. A clean, affordable hotel right in the heart of San Fran.

review.title: Friendly, helpful atmosphere
review.reviewText: Our stay in San Francisco was memorable, in part due to our hotel accommodation. We found the hotel very comfortable. It is ideally located with ready accesibility to shopping, attractions rental car agencies and dining. The staff were extremely helpful and very pleasant. The daily wine tasting of local (Napa Valley) wines every evening from 5 to 6 p.m. was a bonus and an opportunity to meet your fellow guests.

review.title: Great location /Decent Room
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an amazing location. Close to everything! The breakfast is kind of a joke but the wine reception and lobby sitting area is quite nice. The room was OK. Clean but the bathroom needed a bit of of an overhaul. I stayed in an upgraded deluxe room. Personally the only update I believe I received was a king bed.

review.title: Wine reception is fab
review.reviewText: Was really pleased with this hotel; good area near Union square and wine reception every evening which was great for a pre-dinner drink.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText: Nice simple boutique hotel. I agree with what another reviewer said it's like staying in a bed & breakfast. The staff are polite and helpful. The continental breakfast and daily wine tasting are nice touches plus you get to meet lots of the other guests staying at the hotel. Yes the room did have a slight smell and it wasn't a bad thing just open the window and it's gone. I have lived in many old apartment buildings and it's just the smell of an old building. It's not offensive. Standard rooms are comfertable but on the small size but totally acceptable and the bathrooms are spacious. Located in nice neighbourhood, totally safe. I didn't see the bad side of town that a lot of people said there was and yes there are some homeless people but they aren't aggressive and mind their own business plus there aren't many around.

review.title: If you like Boutique Hotels, this one offers a great location, great service and a great value.
review.reviewText: The best amenity this hotel has to offer is their staff. Everybody is nice and wants to do everything to make your stay perfect. I can not say enough about the service. Next plus is the location, conveniently located in Union Square, you can walk to most places. The main entrance to Chinatown is 2 blocks away. One block in the other direction is Powell Street where the historical trolley has a stop. For places further away, like Fishermnan's Wharf and Ghirdelli Square, catch the trolley at Powell St. or it is a short walk to Market to catch the "F" cable car. Other amenties include a small continental breakfast (pastries, muffins, coffee and tea) each morning between 7am and 9am and wine tasting in the evening between 5pm and 6pm. Note: the wine reception does not offer any snacks. If you bring a car, the valet service at the hotel is very prompt and efficient. Lastly, the rooms are adequate, nothing fancy, remember this is an older hotel and small rooms are the norm. If your idea of a vaction is to lounge around in your room, you will be disappointed. If a comfortable place to lay your head and instant hot water in your shower are your priorities - stay here.

review.title: Just a great spot
review.reviewText: very friendly. small, clean and private. nothing at all negative about this hotel. i'll go back here everytime i visit!

review.title: Small and Cute!
review.reviewText: A botique hotel in downtown San Francisco located only couple of blocks from Union Square and 3 blocks from the Market street. We stayed at room 716 and found it a bit small. The bed was fairly comfortable but the room itself was pretty small. The Hotel is overall very clean and maintained well. we liked the wine country theme of the Hotel. The only issue we had was the garbage collection around 4am. It freak us out every night. Also we made to local calls from our room and were charged a dollar per call. I have never been charged for local calls. Overall, we very pleased with everything considering the hotel rates.

review.title: Good value; convenient location
review.reviewText: Booking through Expedia the cost of this hotel was very competitive. Location is very convenient - short block from the Powell cable car line, 2 blocks to Chinatown. Hotel was comfortable and overall in acceptable condition. It shows its age and a lack of good cleaning in cracks and corners. Continental breakfast is well below expectations - ran out on Monday morning, poor, limited selections. Get up early; late risers are met with a cool shower.

review.title: Great hotel and Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for us (2). I was worried as I read some of the reviews about the musty smell. If you took the wrong staircase yes it was a bit musty (but it reminded me of my grandmother's house which was a very pleasant memory), we took the central staircase and never came across that smell again. The staff was very friendly, the breakfast was perfect to get you started on your day and the wine (tasting, not quite with one red and one white) was great. We came back to the hotel after sightseeing to change and get ready for dinner and the glass of wine was a nice way to relax, before heading out again. If you're in the Bay to stay in your room, then you might feel like you had tight quarters, but if you're there sleep and have a quick break it's the place to be.

review.title: Great location in Union Square
review.reviewText: I wanted a hotel close to Chinatown and easy access to San Francisco's famous cable cars. This hotel fit the bill nicely. Our room was a bit noisy because it was located right next to the elevator, but the sound wasn't overly objectionable. I particularly liked the free wine tasting every evening between 5 and 6pm. I would stay there again.

review.title: We had a nice stay
review.reviewText: Good location to shopping, cable car, and bus routes. Reception staff knowladgeable on bus how to get places. Wine tasting at 5pm nice touch for after a long day of sightseeing.

review.title: Would go back
review.reviewText: Nice old hotel in a good location. Well maintained with a friendly, helpful staff. Wine tasting sessions every night were a nice way to meet fellow travellers

review.title: Deluxe Room... Too Small
review.reviewText: Before getting to my major complaint, the overall quality of service was excellent. The staff was friendly and very responsive. The complimentary breakfast was decent, and the wine tasting from 5-6PM was awesome. The only major complaint is that the deluxe room was just too small. There was not enough room to relax and enjoy yourself. Minor complaint was the noise from trash pickup. I am a very light sleeper and the trash pickup occured around ~4AM, thus waking me much earlier that I really would like. Last complaint was there was no view from our room. The location was great (walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, etc). If you are not a light sleepy and the size doesn't bother, I would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Suitable for a short stay
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to restaurants and shops. Concierge very helpful and accommodating.

review.title: Great time, great location
review.reviewText: We were just a few blocks from Union Square where the shopping is superb. the hotel staff could not have been friendlier or more knowledgeable. We inquired about Giants Tickets and the concierge made the call for us. Anytime we needed anything for our room, we had it in a matter of minutes. I would defintely stay again.

review.title: Would return to this hotel.
review.reviewText: Centrally located, excellent service. "Happy Hour" wine from 5PM was nice touch. Good continental breakfast.

review.title: will use it again
review.reviewText: hotel was very clean and employees were very nice.very satisfied with the stay.

review.title: perfect hotel
review.reviewText: A block and a half from China town, across the street from a great breakfast place, walk down the hill to Union square, this was the perfect hotel to stay at in San Francisco! We caught the cable car feet away from the front door and got droped off in the same place. Very friendly staff, and the wine reception is great. Free wine before you go out to dinner!!! Very clean, no funny smells, plenty of room. Not your run of the mill hotel, it has personality and very cute rooms. Stay here!!

review.title: Very Nice, Friendly and Convenient
review.reviewText: We absolutely loved this hotel! Very cozy with great ambience. The staff was polite and very helpful. We loved the wine tasting in the late afternoon. It may be the best location to stay in San Francisco. Close to everything but far enough away to avoid any noise. We took the BART to the outside areas (i.e. Golden Gate Park, The Presidio, etc..). Very convenient. Would definitely stay here again!

review.title: Would return again
review.reviewText: Very professional and friendly staff, both at the front desk and the conceirge. Fantastic location with the hotel being located just a few blocks away from union square, the cable cars, and Chinatown. When we return to San Francisco, we would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great quality and location for the price
review.reviewText: We had no problems during our stay. The location was great....2 short blocks from the entrance of China Town. An easy 20-25 minute walk to the Ferry Building. Halfblock from the Cable Cars. An easy 15 minute walk to all the major stores. The only negative was the room had a slight "smell" to it, but it disapaited after turning on the AC. Alos, the evening wine tasting was fun.

review.title: Cozy, friendly
review.reviewText: Free wine from 5-6 pm. Really friendly staff.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court Personal Review
review.reviewText: The rooms were small and dated but the location was convenient to everything! Chinatown was just down the street & Union Square was within walking distance. There was a side street that was empty and bare during the day, but several lovely restaurants came to life and filled the alley at night. The food was excellent along with it's quaint ambiance. Overall, we were satisfied with this hotel because of the excellent location. We would definitely recommend this hotel if location is your primary concern and the dated rooms are not. The evening manager's wine tasting gathering in the lobby was a plus also.

review.title: old, but charming
review.reviewText: Our room was quite a bit smaller than we were anticipating - basically, just enough room for the bed, and room to walk around it. Our window faced the alley, but we could still hear lots of street noise, including a garbage truck at 4:00am. This noise was mostly blocked by shutting the blinds and closing the window all the way. The service was excellent - everyone was extremely friendly, polite, and helpful. It's in a great central location, and is directly next to a major trolley stop. Uncle Vito's next door has decent pizza. The parking situation wasn't very convenient - you have to walk up a block and wait for a valet to get your car. Overall, be prepared for an older hotel with a decent amount of city noise, but we still enjoyed our stay.

review.title: Nice little cozy hotel
review.reviewText: This was a very nice and quiet hotel, the staff there are very polite and helpful. It is within walking distance of Union square and the trolleys.

review.title: Great Little Hotel
review.reviewText: This is our second sojourn at this hotel and we were struck more this time how absolutely top notch the staff is. I mean everybody, from the room cleaners, to the front desk people, every time we entered the property we were welcomed with a warm smile, and people went out of their way to do extra for us, - did not feel like a big city hotel. You can hear the cable cars clang from the room- how much more romantic could that be?

review.title: Great Hotel for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location, 1/2 block from the cable cars, 2 blocks from the entrance to china town, just really centrally located. As a hint, go to the Walgreens that is 1/2 block to Powell street and 1 block down the hill and purchase a 3 day pass for the transit system for $18. It cost $5 for each ride if you don't and you can get almost anywhere in the city by using the cable cars, trollies, buses and sub. As for the hotel, our room was great and clean. They cleaned it each day and we had a nice view out the front. Room was quiet large but we did upgrade from the standard room. Staff was always helpful. We had a problem with our toilet running constantly, we told the front desk and within an hour they had someone fix it.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: This hotel's best assets are its charm and its location. It is within one block of Chinatown and not much further from Union Square in downtown San Francisco. If you are willing to forgo a little space for a lot of charm, then this is the place to stay.

review.title: Very small room
review.reviewText: The hotel is located within walking distance of Union Square. The rooms are quite small but serve their purpose if you just need a place to sleep. During our stay the doorknob to the bathroom was not working and we informed the front desk, they sent someone up immediately to replace it. The continental breakfast consisted of coffee,tea juice and muffins don't expect a full breakfast. In general the hotel was clean and within good walking distance to many shops and restaurants.

review.title: A Bed & Breakfast in the middle of a city
review.reviewText: This hotel was so quaint and beautiful. It felt like we were in a bed and breakfast. Even though the bathrooms were a bit small we were very comfortable. Definitely use the valet parking or at leasst drop your bags off before parking the car. The wine tasting were great and the staff was so amazing- We will definitely stay there again!

review.title: quaint little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: bright and airy rooms with an antique flair. mornings, they offer complimentary pastries, coffee, and tea in the lobby and between 5pm-6pm they have wine tasting!

review.title: Heritage Hotel in great location
review.reviewText: Great location central to Union Square & Chinatown, very clean rooms, small bathrooms which is expected for a vintage Hotel. I would recommend asking for a street view room when booking.

review.title: It grows on you
review.reviewText: My first impression was that it was cozy looking in the lobby then I went into my room, and there was an old room smell. The window would not shut either. The bathrooms are very old and need to be updated. But as time went on I got used to it and actually enjoyed my stay. There was one clerk at desk that was very rude I forgot his name though but everyone else was very pleasant. I don't think I'd go back.

review.title: Convenient and Comfortable.
review.reviewText: We had 2 rooms during our recent stay, which were both very comfortable, although one had a slight odor that we could not get rid of even when opening the window.Although the rooms had a well stocked mini bar there was no coffee maker. The hotel was extremely convenient for all the attractions being 1 block away from Union Sq. We enjoyed the simple pastry/coffee breakfast and also the evening wine tasting. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Just as we had imagined
review.reviewText: The hotel was just as we had anticipated from the pictures and descriptions available online. The lobby, the rooms, the location...all wonderful!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a classic older building. Teh location i sperfect fo raccess to China town and Union Square.

review.title: Good cost performance
review.reviewText: Hotel room rates around Union Square are very high except this one. This is not a fantastic one but good enough for business stay.

review.title: Really Lovely
review.reviewText: This was a great place to stay - extremely close to the street car and bus lines, within walking distance of some truly amazing restaurants, and the staff... beyond exceptional. They went out of their way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. The continental breakfast wasn't the best I've had (and certainly not the worst), but to me, merely adequate breakfasts are minor compared with everything else. I would go back in a heart beat.

review.title: Very nice service
review.reviewText: The people at the front desk are very nice and helpful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The employees were friendly and helpful. The complimentary wine added to the warm and friendly atmosphere. We were walking distance to China Town and Union Square and a short cab ride to Pier 39. I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel was very old, which I knew. I knew the rooms would be small, but they were uncomfortable. It had a strange smell that was unpleasant. There were only three small pillows for two people. When I requested more pillows, they never showed up and I didn't sleep well all night thinking they might come to the door to deliver them, which they did not. There was no space at the sink area to get ready. The refrigerator leaked all over some purchased food items (cheese) and ruined it. We did request a cab to go to the airport and there was one there for us with time to spare, so they did do that. The bed was not very comfortable.

review.title: Very impressive for the price
review.reviewText: Very clean rooms, about 125 feet from the cable car stop, 2 blocks from the china town entrance, restaruants within walking distance and a Wal-greens very close by. Good wine tasting ever evening and decent continental breakfast. Even though the hotel does not specifically cater to children, we stayed with our 2 minor children and it worked out very well. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would definetly stay their again.

review.title: I will return, again and again.
review.reviewText: Do not visit the Vintage Court if you are looking for a big hotel experience. Do visit if you are looking for an excellent location, wonderful, caring staff, meeting interesting people from around the world at the afternoon wine tasting, unique room settings, etc. all in a very fair price-range. Also, if you want an extraordinary dining experience see if the hotel can arrange for you to fill a cancelled reservation at Masa's (do know that it is an expensive venture well worth that expense!).

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It is rated a 3 star hotel, but it's more like a 2 1/2 stars. There was nothing troubling about it, but don't think they vacummed rooms everyday or windexed everything between visitors. However, it was a wonderful location, and the staff was very kind and helpful. It is a 1/2 a block from the Powell cable cars, 2 blocks from Chinatown, and five blcoks from Union Square.

review.title: Great Place for First Timers!
review.reviewText: This was our first time visiting San Francisco and we could not have been happier with our hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, especially couples.

review.title: Friendly, clean, in great location
review.reviewText: We enjoyed the friendly atmosphere and got to meet other guests at the wine tasting each evening. The location is great, just two blocks from Chinatown and four blocks from Union Square. We would definitely return to this hotel.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at this hotel for a 6 days, the staff were friendly, and the wine tasting was good. Only piece of advice would be to go out for breakfast. There are some nice places to eat in short walking distance.

review.title: Good price
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice for location, right by the trolley car to take you to the wharf and within 2 blocks from china town. The concierge was great and hooked us up with all of the fun things to do right away so that they would not be full! Rooms were small but just fine for us because all we did was sleep there!

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText: Clean hotel - helpful staff - great location - walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square, cable cars stop is at the corner. Small room but the bed was comfortable. Window was directly opposite another hotel room - no view of SF. Bring toothbrush, toothpaste, hair conditioner - soap, shampoo, lotion are the only toiletries provided.

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: The nice staff and location of this hotel made our pleasure trip to San Francisco even more memorable.

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: i have to say that after reading the reviews, i was satisfied with my stay there. i stayed in the king deluxe room and it was okay. i think for travelers on a budget, this is a great place. the service was good, but there is no room service. there is a parking garage that is very close so you should use that. i didn't take advantage of the daily breakfast or wine service.

review.title: Stay away.... its very old run-down hotel
review.reviewText: Not good at all. Rude treatment at check-in. Shower was not even lukewarm in morning. Bathroom was old and crusty and faucets barely diverted water to shower head. Room had that "old carpet" smell. Old furnishings. Noisy window unit air conditioning. Getting on internet was a half hour ordeal. Front desk said internet was via cable jack in room and it turned out that they ONLY have paid wireless service!

review.title: Disappointed
review.reviewText: I was disappointed with the hotel for a few reasons. The room had an old mildewy smell. The heater seemed to minimally work the first night, but did not work at all the 2nd night. Upon leaving for the day, we asked the front desk to have maintenance check the heater while we were gone. When we returned late in the evening, the heater still was not working, but we were too tired to address it a second time. Our second morning, there was no hot water when we showered. Overall, the room was clean and the staff was courteous. I do not plan to stay at this hotel again.

review.title: Not too fancy but very nice - recommended
review.reviewText: When looking at prices - the Vintage Court was about middle-of-the-road but the great service and quality make this hotel a great value. Good location - 3 blocks from Union Square. Nice lobby with free wine every night. Friendly and helpful staff.

review.title: great small hotel in the best location in san francisco
review.reviewText: i have stayed in this hotel many times and never knew that a coffee maker was available for my room instead of going down to the lobby before 9am for the contenential breakfast.I think they should offer this and any other ameneties when you check in.

review.title: Great Pick
review.reviewText: I was a little bit weary due to some fo the other reviews, but the location and price seemed perfect, so I thought we'd give it a try. The people who did not like this hotel must not have liked San Francisco, never been to a big city before, or were looking for a 4 star hotel at the 3 star price. There was no weird smell and the noise level was not bad at all. If you are looking for a clean decent room with a great location, this is the place for you. There is a hill you have to walk up to get there, but you can expect this anywhere in SF.

review.title: Nice hotel,Great location!!
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel with great location,and staff. The hotel has a great resterant,and is located 50 yards from Powell St. cable car stop,from their you can get just about anywhere.Just be sure too get a week pass it will save you a load of cash,other wise it is $5.00 a ride.Close to shopping,Chinatown,Nob hill,North beach & much more.Cant wait to go back!

review.title: Quiet Union Square retreat
review.reviewText: An unusual, small hotel with a friendly atmosphere in the center of San Francisco shopping, dining and theater areas. Amusing wine receptions each evening, close to cable car. Plenty of nearby restaurants offer choices. Only drawback is the last hill to the hotel is quite steep.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText: Funny smell in the hotel, but the staff was extremely nice, and the public area with breakfast and wine tasting was comfortable and clean.

review.title: Travel to San Francisco
review.reviewText: It was an ok hotel , old but comfy, with good service. If you are not looking for luxury, this is a conveniently located hotel to stay. I'd definitely recommend it.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: All the employees were very helpful and nice!

review.title: Cozy hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was close to Union Square which made it very convenient but the room was a little smelly and extremely hot. We had to have the a/c on in the middle of December. There was only one elevator so it took a while to get to the room sometimes. Rooms were an ok size, bathroom was small.

review.title: Good, Not great
review.reviewText: Good location, pleasant staff, nice but seems to be on a downhill slide - it doesn't look like there have been any upgrades in years. Tiny bathrooms. I'd stay there again for business but probably not for a special vacation.
review.userLocation: seattle, Washington, United States of Am

review.title: Fairly good, clean rooms and polite employees
review.reviewText: Was on a conference. Was satisfied by the hotel. Main point the rooms where clean and comfortable.

review.title: Location was great.
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean and the service adequate. The lobby is very sterile and rooms satisfactory. Bathroom extremely small. Best part of hotel is location near Nobb Hill and Union Square.

review.title: Overall, a decent place to stay
review.reviewText: The best things about this hotel are the reasonable price, proximity to Union Square and the quality of the service provided by staff. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, and the evening wine tastings were well-attended. The room was adequate, although had a slightly funky smell. Small bathroom, very comfortable bed, noisy window air-conditioner, not-terribly-effective air purifier. Just okay, not great.

review.title: Not what it seems
review.reviewText: Mu husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel and we were very dissapointed. DO NOT BE FOOLED by the website pictures. The lobby is small but warm and inviting but it stops there. The rooms are in desparate need of an upgrade, the bed was very ucomfortable and the bathrooms are horrible. The hotel staff were very nice and the hotel is in a geat location but you need to go somewhere else! The hotel was trying hard to be a nice, boutique style hotel but just did not have the rooms to back it up. Spend a few more dollars and get something nice. San Francisco however is amazing. It is so beautiful, lots to see and do, great shopping, great food.

review.title: Nice location ,but just average .
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a nice location for everything in area. The problem I had was the garbage was picked up very early every morning & this woke me up,due to the fact my room was on 2nd floor next to side street.Room was clean but lobby & hallway were unkept,nothing a little vacuming could'nt cure.I would have to say for the price it was'nt a bad deal.Be sure to order you're own taxi,hotel has a bad habit of ordering a town car and telling you it is same price,I payed $20 more for ride back to airport compaired to taxie from airport to hotel.

review.title: Great Location-Comfortable Stay
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was great. The beds weren't as comfortable as other hotels in the area, but not bad. It was within an easy walk to Union Square as well as about 50 yards from a cable car stop.

review.title: very quaint
review.reviewText: small hotel, great location, and great staff. Loved the wine every night, and the continental breakfast in the morning...Would go back and we will.

review.title: Best small and affordable hotel in San Francisco.
review.reviewText: This hotel is just a few blocks from Union Square, and the Financial District. It is small, and no frills, but they do a fantastic job. I used to live in San Francisco, and every time I return, I stay at the Hotel Vintage Court. I highly recommend it.

review.title: Not Impressed at All
review.reviewText: The hotel is in shabby condition (carpets, wallpaper). Although it is convenient in location I would chose another hotel for future visit. Have been to San Fransisco before and was not impressed with the service or staff. Bed was extremely uncomfortable!

review.title: Small but nice
review.reviewText: As is often the case with older hotels in big cities, everything was on the small side. Small lobby, small room, small bathroom(s). That said, everything was very comfortable, and I had everything I needed. Wine at night and OJ in the AM were bonuses! Very convenient location.

review.title: Great location with a European feel.
review.reviewText: The location was just around the corner from China Town and the shopping district. The trolleys were within sight of the entrance wich had a direct route to Fishermans wharf. The rooms were clean, nothing to rave about, but who stays in their room in this great city?

review.title: Wonderful quaint hotel
review.reviewText: For the price you cannot beat the service, comfort, or location. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The lobby is very nice and serve a nice wine tasting in the afternoon. All in all very impressed. Could improve on the continental breakfast by adding some fruit or other items.

review.title: Great Location but rubbish breakfast
review.reviewText: This hotel was in a great spot, walking distance of Chinatown which is full of great shops and restaurants and for Union Square (more shops) and all your transport systems. Only downsides were the rubbish breakfast (we ended up having to go out for breakfast every day - there are plenty of places for this close by) and that the top floor where we were is noisy as you can hear all the air conditioner system outlets, having said that you do get used to the humming and block it out. The complimentary wine tasting was good and gives you chance to have a chat to other guests which was very enjoyable. Overall excellent value and a great spot. Don't miss the sea lions at Pier 39 - very amusing.

review.title: Fantastic Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was everything we had hoped for to start our vacation in Northern California. So close to Union Square and the cable cars to go to Fishermans Wharf and also close to Chinatown. I would certainly recommend it to everyone. The wine tasting between 5pm and 6pm each evening in the lounge was very pleasant and friendly.

review.title: Would stay there again on my next visit
review.reviewText: This was my first trip to San Francisco. The hotel staff was very good. The bed was comfortable. My friend who lives there was impressed with the size of the room as well as the bathroom. It was very close to the massive Union Square Mall which is a plus for those who like to shop. Trolley cars are less than a block away on Powell Street. Well known restaurant Massa's is attached/next to the hotel. Overall experience was enough to make me return to this hotel on my next visit, passing by more expensive national and international hotel chains.

review.title: Old and worn
review.reviewText: Good location (2 blocks from China town). Poor complimentary breakfast. Only Danishes and muffins provided and those were stale. Hotel needs upgrading

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location in Union Square. The room is small, but adequate. The bathroom is a bit tight though. It's very hard to use the sink since it is so tight. The front desk was awesome though! You could call them for anything and they were VERY helpful! A little dissappointed with one of the in room options of wine and chocolates from the restaurant downstairs. When we tried to order it, the chef did not make chocolates that day b/c he didn't feel like it.

review.title: Vintage Court, San Francisco
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and helpful. I enjoyed the coffee and muffins provided in the lobby each morning. There was also a wine tasting each evening.

review.title: Good and Bad
review.reviewText: There were good and bad things about staying at this hotel. We liked the wine tasting. We drank a lot more than just tasting. They held our luggage for us because our flight was later in thd day. The room we were in was much smaller than I thought the rooms looked on their website. The hotel seemed old and could use some updates. Our view was of another building and some dumpsters. We could hear everything in our room. The laundry shoot was next to our room and we could hear a lot of banging from it. The bed wasn't very comfortable. The location was okay. We always had a hard time finding a cab near the hotel. We usually had to walk a few blocks. It was a slightly below average hotel in my opinon. If I ever come back to San Francisco, I would try another hotel.

review.title: Can't ask for better.
review.reviewText: On Bush St. 1/2 block from Powell so you can pick up both cable car lines. Great pizza place on the corner (Uncle Vito's). Clean room every day thanks to great housekeeping staff. Good muffin/danish breakfast in the morning. Free wine tasting every evening from 5-6 in the lobby. Walking distance to Chinatown, great shopping, several Starbucks, and tons of restaurants. Just a perfect place to stay.

review.title: Great location!!! Excellent service!!!
review.reviewText: Chris the best bellman around, thanks alot guys. Ill see you soon.

review.title: Perfect if you don't need luxury
review.reviewText: We were out in the city all day, and really only needed a place to sleep at night. Sheets, blankets, towels were all above-average quality. We didn't need a fridge or any extra luxury services while we were in SF. The room I stayed in was on the inside of the building - much nicer rooms can be had with street facing windows... There was also a complementary wine served from 5-6 in the lobby (unlimited refills were nice)

review.title: Would go back....great location
review.reviewText: Rooms kind of small, but comfortable. Room was reserved for 2, but only 1 robe available. Continental breakfast kind of skimpy, but lots of eating places close by and discount provided by motel is nice!

review.title: Highly recommended
review.reviewText: Great location! The hotel is a little musty, but so is everything in San Francisco. Otherwise it's clean and perfectly safe for a single woman. Unless you require the lap of luxury it's a great deal for a place to lay your head while in a beautiful city.

review.title: hotel was okay
review.reviewText: hotel was okay

review.title: Nice Place to Stay While in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was very convenient to the Trolley line as well as a short walk to Market Street. The only problem would be for those who have trouble walking the hills. Loved the evening wine tastings - great opportunity to mingle with the other "residents".

review.title: Close to Union Square, and a Small Cab Fare to Most Hot Spots
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very accomodating,and the room was a decent size for San Francisco. We were only 4 blocks from Union Square, and walking distance to most destinations, or a short cab ride. Only drawback the room was a bit cold, but the staff are so pleasant, and will help you out wiht your travels with such friendliness. Great place to stay.

review.title: Quiet Boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is small and quiet.. parking is down the street, and at 2006 rates, it was $24 a night.. We ate in a small cafe on Grant and Bush........and it was wonderful! china town is three blocks.. and the cable car picks up right outside hotel at corner.. so thats a plus... the bed was really comfortable. tho arranged in a way that does take advantage of the small space.. has air, so on hot nights, is comfortable.. and you can adjust to your liking... I would stay in this hotel again...

review.title: Good hotel for Touring SF
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent for touring San Francisco. There is a cable car stop within one block, great shopping at Union Square (3 blocks), and it's possible to walk to Fisherman's Wharf (about 40 min). The room was a little small but reasonably comfortable. I recommend this hotel for those travellers who are very focused on touring the city, as the hotel lacks some amenities that would make it a good place to just 'hang out.'

review.title: Inexpensive & Located Well
review.reviewText: If cost and location are paramount, then this hotel is a good pick. Do not anticipate the amenities of the chains. Corner cuttings include: two bath towels for two guests only; no clean sheets after first night without complaints; continental breakfast is poor and packed; and no on-site bar, restaurant, etc. The rooms are not charming, but nor are they dingy. The most negative experience was the lack of internet capability (it claims to have a provider, but connecting and reliable service is not part of the deal). We had to walk down Bush Street to find a wireless connection at a local restaurant, or down Powell Street to another hotel to locate a reliable connection.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel offered a good location for a decent price!

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Would be very happy to stay here again. Had heard a few horror stories about locations of some hotels in San Fran but happy to report that this one is in what appears to be a safe area. Had no complaints about any aspects of the hotel. Good access to public transport and shops and plenty of places to eat / 24 hour shop nearby.

review.title: Life in a cupboard
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel could hardly be better for the tourist, close to Chinatown and Union Square and cable cars running nearby to access almost all of the other usual tourist haunts. However, the accommodation is poor. The hotel styles itself has having a European flavour, but even by European standards the room we were assigned was little more than a cupboard. There was no room for luggage and it was barely possible to walk around the bed without bumping into the other furnishings. The room overlooked a very small service yard and the immediate view was of a wall opposite about 3 metres away. The room appeared quite dingy as there was little opportunity for daylight to enter. Air conditioning was provided by a noisy anitique unit mounted in the window. We were kept awake at night by the combined sound of the array of air con units each mounted into the windows of the rooms surrounding the service yard. In order to give a chic appearance the beds are adorned with cushions of geometric shapes, but as these had to be removed to use the bed the appeal of the chicness is lost when one was faced with the problem of where to store the cushions in the cupboard of a room so that one didn't trip over them getting out of bed.

review.title: 2nd visit
review.reviewText: great spot, wine at 5 so you meet other guests & share best restaurants, attractions,etc

review.title: Great location, mediocre facilities
review.reviewText: This is a great location, half a block from the cable car and 2 blocks from Union Square. Our room was clean but smelled like cigarette smoke even though the hotel is supposedly non-smoking. It was on the second floor looking out on an ally and the dumpsters. I recommend you request a specific room - on an upper floor overlooking Bush street.

review.title: Nice small hotel close to everything
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel. Have stayed there on three occassions and always happy with room, service. Location is very good with quick access to Union Sq, Fisherman's Wharf, etc.

review.title: great location without going broke enjoying San Francisco
review.reviewText: Our room was roomy and comfortable. The hotel offers easy access to anywhere in the Bay area. We enjoyed the wine at 5 and the coffee and juice in the morning. Had nice conversations with other guests.

review.title: I would definitely go back
review.reviewText: Great location, helpful staff, nice sized room (we stayed in the king); a good hotel at a good price.

review.title: Great location, great service
review.reviewText: We found this to be a great central location, easily able to walk to Chinatown and Union Square. The trolley stop was right near our hotel, which made it very easy to go to Fisherman's Wharf and back. Nightly wine hour had great service. Location of our specific room was noisy, but otherwise, all was good. Would stay here again.

review.title: Would go back in an instant!
review.reviewText: Vintage court is very nice and the wife and I would go back in an instance. It can be a little noisey, but what place wouldn't be that's on a major street? Only complaint is that they put junior size pillows on a queen size bed. Conceriege service is excellent and everytime I walked the halls I was greeted by the cleaning staff. All around good place.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Excelent service

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff treated us with courtesy and went out of their way to ensure we had an enjoyable stay by changing original room accommodations and checking our luggage before and after check in. They provided excellent references for restaurants and checked on our tours when they were running late. Our room was comfortable and appeared newly decorated. The location is excellent, one half block from Powell trolley and a few blocks from Chinatown. I would stay there again on a return trip!

review.title: So, so
review.reviewText: I have stayed in a few San Francisco hotels and this one fell a littl e short in comparason. It is a old hotel and can feel a little gloomy. The service and cleanliness are adequate but nothing stood out. The elevator very old and slow.

review.title: Great location -- Comfortable stay -- A Great SF Welcome
review.reviewText: This hotel has an "SF Victorian" environment: thick carpeting, creaky stairs, homey comfort. The location can't be beat: walking distance to the Financial District, Union Square and Cable Cars. There is a comfortable, friendly vibe in this hotel which makes the evening wine tasting very successful. Both nights I stayed, the living room/lobby area was filled with guests, unknown to each other in most cases, talking and tasting. Those that wanted to read, or relax on their own also seemed at ease . It's a great entree to life in San Francisco.

review.title: Not a good place to be
review.reviewText: Dirty , old and smelly regardless of this here are a few extras --- "Complimentry breakfast" -includes coffee and a muffin, $ 10 a day for wireless access, $25 a day for parking

review.title: Cute and quaint hotel with great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel was in the middle of Union Square which was great because it was walking distence to great food and shopping! The wine tasting provided nightly was a huge bonus! The staff was great too!

review.title: Will definately stay here again
review.reviewText: Location of this hotel makes it so easy to access all of San Fran's sites. Just hop on bus (2 blocks away) to ride to most anywhere (went to ballgame and Fisherman's Wharf) and trolley stops right at corner to (Union Square and Fisherman's Wharf). Steep but easy walk to Chinatown and Union Square (only few blocks). Able to walk through Chinatown to Little Italy easily. Lots of good night life and restaurants within walking distance. Liked Lefty O'Douls and Irish Bank Pubs. Felt very safe in area. Took Bart from Oakland airport into Union Square and carried luggage up very steep climb (but you could get on trolley if you wanted). Our room had window seat and city view. Very nice, large room, clean. Staff very friendly and helpful with directions. Coffee in AM and wine in PM great.

review.title: Location is the best feature
