review.reviewText: The lobby is very nice, but our room was rather shabby. The bathroom, in particular, had broken and repaired fixtures. The room was clean and comfortable, though, and the location is great. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, but would probably check out other hotels in the immediate neighborhood, too.

review.title: cozy and walking distance to pretty much everything
review.reviewText: If you want to smoke do not stay here.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great hotel, with great staff. There is a wine hour every evening and a small breakfast every morning. The bathroom was a little dirty when we got there, but we called and they cleaned it right away.

review.title: Good location, nice acomodations
review.reviewText: s

review.title: I am sorry I do not know what this is referring to.
review.reviewText: Comfortable, nice, reasonably priced, well located hotel.

review.title: Nice, Clean, nothing snazzy
review.reviewText: Not in perfect condition, but clean, and centrally located. Good price, with close parking. I've stayed here about 4 times, and I always go back.

review.title: So Civilized
review.reviewText: My husband and I arrived at the Vintage Court after flying 3000 miles cross country. In the lobby there was a fireplace with a fire going and they were serving wine (as they do every afternoon) It was such a civilized way to end our one journey and start our stay in San Francisco.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: The furniture and the conditions of the room was old and not attractive. When we arrived, with seven suitcases and a cat, at around 10 pm, there was the receptionist and what seemed to be a bellboy at the check in. Nobody offered any help.

review.title: Just OK ...
review.reviewText: Room was small, sink was in a "closet" and didn't have much room. Pillows were awful. Service was very good, everyone went out of there way to attend to you. Wine was served from 5 to 6 everyday ... One reason we chose the hotel was it was close to the Trolley Car line ... however when it arrived at the stop on the corner it was always full and you had to walk to the end of the line to get on.

review.title: Comfortable and friendly
review.reviewText: Great location! Staff friendly. Stayed five nights and was extremely satisfied. Staff helped us arange a wine tour that was fantastic. Contintel breakfast was only a roll and orange juice. San Francisco is a great place to visit!!

review.title: A good choice at the right price
review.reviewText: Once you get past the unpleasant smell of the otherwise charming lobby (combination of old age and mildew) you'll find very comfortable but smallish rooms that are tastefully decorated and very clean. Bed is very comfortable. But, if planning to walk to hotel from Union Square, be prepared for two block of very steep hill.

review.title: OK but not splendid
review.reviewText: Great location!

review.title: Very old, Very Nice
review.reviewText: I would go back to this hotel. It has a lot of history, the employees are wonderful, and the rooms are clean and very enjoyable. It's located very close to China Town and Fishermans Warf. Both just a trolly car away.

review.title: Mixed Review
review.reviewText: Promised room with view did not materialize, instead my room faced a wall with hanging laundry. Room smelled of mildew. On the positive side, there was internet access in room, service was dependable and bed was very comfortable.

review.title: friendly staff
review.reviewText: The people make this holtel. they treated us like friends, not customers. the wine at night didn't hurt

review.title: Comfortable Hotel Close to Most Attractions
review.reviewText: The hotel accomodations were very nice. It was located down town, near most of the cities attractions. Our room was comfy and gave off a very bed-n-breakfast type atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: A Must Stay
review.reviewText: The hotel is located just a couple of blocks uphill of Union Square and the main shopping district which is just about the perfect place to be. You are far enough away from the gaudy Fishermans Wharf, close the the shops, and right next to the cablecar line that takes you to the waterfront. The Staff are really friendly, polite and helpful. The room was clean, suitable for the money and comfortable. There was no bath, although who uses one nowadays. Fully recommended to you all.

review.title: Great Location Friendly service
review.reviewText: Good Location Friendly service easy to get around from this location

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: This hotel was a great place to stay. The location was wonderful, within walking distance to Chinatown and Union Square and a cable car stop was only feet away. The complimentary breakfast wasn't that impressive but the wine reception every evening was a great way to talk to other people. The room was small, but apparently that's common in San Francisco. The room we were in was pretty quite except for the garbage trucks early in the morning. Overall, I would definately recommend this hotel to others. The staff is very helpful and the hotel is nice.

review.title: It's OK...
review.reviewText: The price is what it is based on the city and location. The staff was cordial and helpful. However, when we checked in, front desk "upgraded" us to a king bed (originally had a queen). We thought this was a nice gesture but the room they assigned ended up to be handicap-friendly. The only problem with this was the showerhead was half the height of a normal showerhead. A bit problematic for a guest who is 6'3". This made me wonder whether the upgrade was genuine or if it was the only room remaining (since they informed us that the hotel was fully booked)???

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is very well located, closetopublic ransportation and within walking distance of many sites. Rooms are small but well maintained. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Excellent location! Great staff
review.reviewText: The staff was great and very attentive. Can't beat the location (3 blocks from Chinatown and 4 blocks from the Irish Bank pub which we highly recommend). The cable car was less than a block away. Our concierge was wonderful. With so much to do, we missed out on the complimentary wine tasting, but the continental breakfasts were adequate. Contrary to the web site, no coffee makers in the room, but with breakfasts from 7-9 it wasn't an issue. Starbucks close by. Recommend Uncle Vito's for a quick bite (same corner as the cable car). There were some free wi-fi's we could connect to in the lobby. Can't miss with this one.

review.title: Just like the photos!
review.reviewText: We were delighted with the charm of this smaller hotel - much more interesting than a larger "chain"! Excellent location with Union Square 2-3 blocks away and Chinatown Gate even closer. Enjoyed talking and getting touring tips from other travellers during morning OJ, coffee 'n muffins (tho' wish there were healthier ones) as well as at eve wine tasting. Might suggest staying higher than 2nd floor as the slope outside makes your room actually at sidewalk-level! Would've loved a higher room with bay window/view. Also, no pop/snack machines so go prepared or pay $$.

review.title: San Fran's Knob Hill Boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Loved it! Best price value downtown! Close walking distance to China Town, Union Square and the Moscone Center. The rooms are dated, but clean. The staff is wonderful and very helpful. They have a wine tasting hour from 5-6. For the price and close walking distance - I will stay here every time! I also felt very safe there. Can't wait to go back!

review.title: OK Place to stay
review.reviewText: There are so many places to stay in San Fran. Very small rooms, elevator was not dependable, "continental breakfast" was a danish and coffee. Definitely OK and safe, but not memorable by any means.

review.title: The only hotel we use in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The character and charm of a small European hotel where you are called by name, remembered from trip to trip and who respond to any request from having flowers and wine in the room to getting dinner reservations at restaurants that are "booked". A truly great pleasure to stay there and can't wait to go back.

review.title: small but clean and safe
review.reviewText: room and bed were very small, hotel was clean and felt safe there. Desk and door people were not the most helpful unfortunately. Location is good for many restaurants and shopping. Continental breakfast is just juices, coffee and danishs.

review.title: Not quaint -- just old
review.reviewText: Pros: 1. Pretty good location near Union Square. 2. Fairly friendly staff. Cons: 1. Very small rooms. 2. Our room overlooked an alley full of dumpsters and the adjacent apartment building. Each night, our sleep was interrupted by the racket of restaurant trash being poured into the dumpsters. 3. Old fashioned window-mounted air conditioner turns into a drum when it rains. 4. Smoke detector set off by shower steam (at least, the ancient detector made some sort of half-hearted squawking noise.) 5. Bathroom door knob broken. 6. Bathroom was dusty, blankets were dirty. Overall: Not a bad place to sleep if you get a good special rate (or appreciate the complimentary evening wine tastings). Don't expect a luxury hotel, though. And bring your earplugs!

review.title: Excellent hotel for a reasonable price!
review.reviewText: I was recommended the hotel by a friend and I must say that it was indeed an excellent recommendation. The hotel is located in the heart of San Francisco and it is easy to get to anypart of the city quite easily. The hotel staff were very courteous and friendly. The room was very spacious, clean and well maintained. The complimentary continental breakfast and the Wine tasting are the other highlights of this hotel All in all, I highly recommend this hotel to anybody planning to visit San Fran!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location, the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are clean and well appointed. Only the bathroom lacked space and style (it was painted 'Pepto Pink' and was very small). I would stay there again if my travels take me back to San Francisco.

review.title: Okay Place To Stay (Not Impressed Though)
review.reviewText: I actually expected a more modern type of room. It seemed like it would have been a good room in the 1970's. It is outdated for sure. The room was clean and the service was good. The location of this place is great. It is located about 2 blocks from Union Square.

review.title: I'd go back
review.reviewText: Very pleasant experience. Good location. Rooms were on the small side but comfortable. Front desk staff were very attentive to their guests. The wine tasting in the late afternoons were very enjoyable. It allowed guests to mingle.

review.title: Good to stay at
review.reviewText: The room are nice size, although some of the bathrooms are a bit tight. We have had bathrooms that were nice in size but this last time was quite tight. If you need housekeeping, you'd better know it before 4pm or your out of luck. Other than that it is pretty decent to stay at.

review.title: Find Another Place
review.reviewText: We found this hotel unacceptable. The white coverlet on the bed had stains on it. The upholstered chair was dirty around the end of the arms. The hallway carpet had stains. Who knows what the room carpet had on it? The motif and color were of the kind that hide stains. I would not stay here.

review.title: Well located bargain
review.reviewText: It's not fancy, but well located and well priced. Only complaint was the sticky bathroom floor. Door locks seem flimsy to me, but everything was fine. Continental breakfast was meager, but okay.

review.title: Great location and hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is only 1/2 block from China Town and 1/2 block from cable car line. We could go any where in San Fran very quickly. Well-kept but small rooms. Great service. Very friendly and helpful. Will definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: Excellent hotel to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Vintage Court is great! You can tell it's an older holtel but it's EXTREMELY clean and service is wonderful. The continental breakfast is nothing to speak of but there's plenty of good restaurants to have breakfast at. The location couldn't be better, it's a two minute walk from union square and china town. We felt very safe walking around in the evening. All the restaurants are open late into the night and there's tons of people walking around all the time. We'd definetely stay in Vintage Court again.

review.title: So-So
review.reviewText: Great location and clean but a bit old.

review.title: Good accomodations at a good price for SF
review.reviewText: The Executive Hotel Vintage Court is a good value in SF. It is by no means a four star hotel but it has a certain classic charm, is clean and comfortable with friendly staff. You will not find a better hotel for the money. The location is great with a 100 foot walk to the cable car that will take you to Fisherman's Warf. Only a two block walk in the other direction to Union Square. Other reviews mentioned a strange odor in the guest rooms; however, no such odor was noticed during my 4 night visit. I recommend the hotel and use the money saved for some of the best dining in the country.

review.title: Great location, friendly service
review.reviewText: The staff is friendly and the service is great. The rooms are small but clean. They do have air conditioning. The complimentary wine serving in the lobby from 5 - 6 is a great way to start your night. The hotel is older but well kept. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is three blocks from Union Square and the from the China Town gate.

review.title: Super location
review.reviewText: This was our second stay at the Vintage Court. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed but a bit on the small side. The evening wine tastings are a real treat and the towncar to take you to the financial district is a big plus. The hotel is located 1/2 block from the Powell St. cable car line.

review.title: Not clean or impressive
review.reviewText: As far as I can tell the most redeeming feature of this hotel is its wine hour between 5 - 6 PM daily. But I'm not a lush so I couldn't consider that sufficient compensation for the dirty dingy room and the violent street noises that we heard all night long.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The European flavor of this hotel; its quaintness and perfect location made for a great weekend get away!

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised and Pleased
review.reviewText: My husband and I recently stayed at the Vintage Court Hotel for 4 nights to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. I told myself I would write a review, since I relied so heavily on reviews to chose our hotel. I can honestly say we had no complaints. The staff was friendly, the room was cozy, housekeeping came every day, the linens were clean and there were no strange stains on towels or linens. The room is small, but the bathroom size makes up for it. There is a separate vanity and that was great with two of us. Everything was in perfect working condition. Location was great and close to everything and we heard NO street noise AT ALL from the 3rd floor. We didn't partake in the wine tasting, but it looked like the other guests were enjoying themseleves immensely. I would definately reccommend this if you are looking for romance, quiet or just a nice escape from the "big" hotels.

review.title: Nob Hill stay
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location, very convenient. Very comfortable beds. One morning they neglected to give us our wake up call, causing us to be late to an appointment. Aside from that, it was a good place to stay for the price.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: The rooms are quite small, we asked for a change from our original room because it was claustrophobic. We were given a much nicer room with a King bed instead of queen and more room, but still on the small side. I wish they had given us that room first, so we didn't have to move everything.

review.title: Love this hotel
review.reviewText: We always stay in this hotel even though we could find something less expensive. The wine they provide in the evenings is excellent.

review.title: Nice Hotel.
review.reviewText: Very different hotel than what I am use to. Decorated European style. Very clean and comfortable with very friendly staff.

review.title: Can't wait not to go back.
review.reviewText: Toilet clogged several times; sorry it was not my fault. Heating is controlled by a radiator. I tried to turn up the heat on a cold night and it spurted water every where. Location is the best thing going for this hotel.

review.title: A satisfactory hotel convienently located in downtown San Fran.
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was eager to please and the room included wine in the evening as well as breakfast in the AM.

review.title: Clean, good location, and great for the price...
review.reviewText: The hotel has been redone with care and was clean and comfortable. Has a small boutique-like feel to it - doors to the rooms didn't feel hearty - I thought the key was going to break each time I turned it. It is right next to one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. Has a wine tasting in the evening and coffee service in the AM (although I didn't see the coffee service, but I'm a "Starbucks-nut" and there was one a block and a half down the hill. It is right above Union Square, so easy access to shopping. We had a room next to the stairwell, which had a little noise in the AM, but overall it was a great place to stay for the price.

review.title: Nice hotel but small rooms
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice but rooms are a lot smaller then the pictures show. The free nightly wine tasting was the same wine each night but still was nice. The water pressure in the showers will knock you off your feet which I liked a lot

review.title: OK Hotel in SF
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, the hotel is a classic older building. Don't eat the muffins in the morning since they have no taste. The wine tasting in the evening was enjoyable. Beware, parking is a block away and $24.00/day and no/in out service, a disservice to the patrons.

review.title: Clean and functional.
review.reviewText: Adequate in all areas.  Centrally located.

review.title: Don't stay here.  Rooms are small and dirty.
review.reviewText:
Upon arrival, I had to park outside and run my bags to the room after checking in.  Then, I had to drive to the closest public garage to park the car.

The rooms were small.  I had brown marks on the sheets.

Very disappointed.

review.title: Charming hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Charming hotel with warm fire in the lobby, wine reception and continental breakfast in the morning.  Walking distance to Union Square.  Atmosphere and feel of "Old San Francisco".

review.title: Not as expected
review.reviewText:
The hotel did not really resemble the photos I saw when I booked through Expedia.  It is very old and my room was on the shabby side, although it was quaint and definitely not a cookie cutter type hotel room.  The bathroom had no heat and was quite chilly and the room had heat only from a radiator, which was hard to regulate.

The continental breakfast was AWFUL - a stale muffin.  I went elsewhere for breakfast after the first morning.

The hotel staff was not particularly friendly or helpful.

Overall, I was disappointed since this was rated as a 4 star hotel.

review.title: Website looks better than the real thing
review.reviewText: The location is quite nice, between Stockton and Powell on Nob Hill. But it is extremely noisy at night. The hotel description promised great city views, but I didn't find them. The staff is mixed. Some made the effort, others couldn't care less. It seems that this was a nice place, but has not enough business. The pictures from the web site look nice, but the reality is a bit disappointing. It is almost impossible to get internet access in the hotel. The lobby has a computer, but to log on you need a special card. I wanted to buy one, but apparently nobody could find me one. The wine tasting was not very exciting. For the money, you could find something nicer and friendlier.

review.title: Don't be fooled by the pictures and colorful descriptions
review.reviewText: I was not very impressed with this "boutique" hotel.  The hotel was outdated very much in need of some remodeling, especially the bathroom.  It looked like my grandparents bathroom!  Our room was very cold, the heater/radiator was useless.  The noise was also a downside.  Street noise along with cold air made its way through the cracks of the air conditioner and window.

review.title: it was o.k.
review.reviewText: nice lobby and wine reception, rooms are on the smaller side.

review.title: Very Convenient
review.reviewText: This hotel was conveniently located to everything in and around Union Square.  The only thing that I did not like was that it sat on a street that had some vagrants who made comments as we walked by at night.  But I didn't feel threatened, just irritated.  Otherwise, the hotel was pleasant, not extravagent.  Chinatown was only a couple of blocks away.  One of the cable car routes was 1/2 a block away.  There was a lot of good food within less than 5 minutes walking.

review.title: Close to Chinatown
review.reviewText: Five blocks away from Union Square sits Hotel Vintage Court. A quiet hotel on Bush St at Powell. The cable cars run at the corner regularly. There are little resturants scattered around the neighborhood. A nice stay in the Bay Area.

review.title: Can't wait to go back!
review.reviewText: Great hotel for wine lovers. The staff was very friendly, and free house wine is offered during the social hour between 5 and 6 pm. This is a great opportunity to meet people around the world and learn about some traveler's tip. I am definitely going back to this hotel next year.

review.title: Excellent hotel + location for an unbeatable price!
review.reviewText: I stayed here for Thanksgivings 04 and I loved it!  I got a room via Expedia for a very good price.  Despite mixed reviews I decided to go ahead with it anyhow - the location was great, the price *very* reasonable and I was curious about the wine tasting.  The wine served is not the best in the world but the setting is very intimiate.  You get to mingle with other hotel guests and share your experience with them.  And as for the hotel itself I cannot ask more of the staff.  They are courteous and helpful.  The room itself is great.  I got a semi-view of the street that I'm on.  Now as this *is* downtown SF , it is a tad bit noisey.  If it's  a problem, I imagine you can ask to be placed on the inside court yard.  The room is nicely decorated and I love the wine country theme.  Very good value and I'd stay here again.  :D

review.title: will definitely return
review.reviewText: What I liked the most was its location, within short walking distance from China town and North Beach and the coziness of the lobby where guests casually gathered  for a glass of wine evenings and chances to compare notes on their various experiences

review.title: Very Satisfied
review.reviewText: My husband and I travelled to San Francisco on leisure and business. We wanted a hotel that was afforable but was classy and chraming at the same thime. Iknow that seems a little impossible. However it's not. Vintage court was perfect. It was central to everything, the staff was courteous and very accommodating, and the room was perfect for what we needed it for. I'd definately reccommend it. Oh by the way, the price was perfect! They even let us check in 5 hours early!

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText: We were extremely satisfied with location of the hotel.  Its proximity to the sights of San Francisco was excellent.  The wine receptions were tasty and allowed us to visit with other travellers from around N. America.  Unfortunately upon arrival we received a second floor room that was simply not acceptable, we asked for another room and eventually after three attempts received one on the third floor that was quite comfortable.  The staff although in general courteous and friendly were not totally consistent in their service.  I believe that we would again try the Vintage Court but only if we could be guranteed a room of reasonable quality. And finally it must be mentioned that the price was right.

review.title: What?
review.reviewText: Reasonable accommodations for the price and good city location.

review.title: This is not a boutique hotel
review.reviewText: I travel a lot for business and pleasure.  This hotel was listed as a "Boutique" hotel.  If this is a boutique hotel, then I'm Donad Trump.  My biggest complaint, besides the outdated bathroom with broken fixtures and cracked tiles, poorly patched, was the smell in the room.  This is an old building and all of the years and all of the history of the building are condensed into one smell which permeates the rooms.  I must compliment the staff who were very nice.  The lobby area comfortabe.  Skip the "continental breakfast" it is a joke.  over three days, the pastries got progressevily more stale each day, though the orange juice was fine.

review.title: Bigger Bathroom than normal
review.reviewText:
Most of the older style hotels around Union Sq have smaller size bathrooms, this one was a little bigger than normal which makes it nice if there are two of you. 
Greeting upon arrival very accomidating. 
Very quiet.

review.title: Executive Hotel Vintage Court
review.reviewText:
We loved this little hotel.  The room was cozy and clean.  We found it to be very convenient.  The cable cars and buses stop 1/2 block away at the corner of Bush and Powell.  China Town Gate, Nob Hill and Union Square are all within a 2 block walk, yet the area is quiet and very safe.

The complementary wine service from 5:00 to 6:00 pm was a great time to meet other guests, plan dinner and regroup for an evening out.  We will stay there when we return to San Francisco.
